192001.name: By a Throw of the Dice
rpg: By a Throw of the Dice
192001.description:
User summary:

In the game, characters select a race (Human, Elf, Dwarf) and then generate Abilities. Characters also possess Skills with ranks. Experience is accumulated and leads to gaining levels. The game uses a modified 2D6 roll to resolve most actions.

192002.name: Cruelty and Gothic Tales
192002.description:
From the introduction:

Set in a Victorian World somewhere in time on The Misty Continent. There are five giant cities of the Misty Continent and these are their Gothic tales.

User summary:

Characters have several paired Attributes with values derived from 2D10 + 39. Character also have "Problems" generated from a random list. The game is a derivation of Wuthering Heights roleplay.

192003.description:
Hunter's Island is a last man standing card game. Each turn the players will search the Island for better cards, equip the cards they find or attack the other players. While the player searches the island animals are also there to attack.

Can you out hunt the other players?


For 2-4 players, this card game pits players on a lonely island against the island's dangers and also each other to the last Hunter standing.

Starting with the ability to escape and attack, players take turns searching the island to gather equipment or encounter animals and other dangers. Found cards are placed in the player's Storage, where they can be picked up rather than searching the Island or Attacking.

Players must decide which of three areas to search, either safely by camp, the deep island, or crossing the ocean water to another dangerous island while the island's dangers whittle away their life points and equipment. Soon, the opportunity to be the lone Hunter will arise.
192003.name: Hunter's Island

192004.name: Other Skylines
192004.description:
From the introduction:

For basic tasks, the player rolls two dice of any type. The higher number determines who narrates the outcome of the action, with the player describing what has happened if the number is even and the GM resuming narration if the number is odd.

The lower number shapes the tone of the attempt. An even number means that something positive has happened, while an odd number represents an unpleasant twist.

192005.name: Hunter's Island: Thieves
192005.description:
Hunter's Island Thieves is a last man standing card game. Each turn the players will search the island for better gear, equip the gear or attack the other players. While the players search the island animals will attack the players. Be the last man standing to win.

This game is a stand alone expansion of the game Hunter's Island. Combining the games will allow for more players and more situations.

192006.name: Hero's Mag
192006.description:
User summary:

While characters in the game do have Attributes, they are not generated with numeric statistics but narrative tags that describe above-average performance. Almost all of the game relies upon narrative construction and resolution of events, though a simple D20 mechanism can be used when desired. The rules are light-weight and simple; the manual provides numerous examples of play.

192007.name: Hunter's Island: Zombies
192007.description:
Hunter's Island Zombies is a last man standing card game. Each turn the players will search the island for better gear, equip the gear or attack the other players. While the players search the island Zombies will attack the players and if they kill the player, the player becomes a zombie and for rest of the game is attack the other players to make them zombies as well.

This game is a stand alone expansion of the game Hunter's Island. there is also Hunter's Island Thieves expansion, combining the sets will allow for more players and more situations during the game.

192008.name: Fina Fisken
192008.description: The game contains 36 fishes in mixed colours and two dice. From the beginning, all but three of these are upside down. On your turn, one die is rolled and show your action. Either you are allowed to fish, everyone are allowed to fish, you can turn one fish around or you miss your turn. If you are allowed to fish, the second die is used showing which colour you are allowed to take. The same goes when everyone are allowed to fish. The players then compete to grab the fishes with the correct colour. The game ends when all fishes are taken and the player with the most fishes wins.

192009.name: Cap de Colla
192009.description:
Cap de colla és un joc de taula de cartes i daus que representa i difon la cultura castellera d’una forma divertida, dinàmica i enginyosa.

Cap de colla is a boardgame that uses cards and dice to spread the human towers culture in a funny, dynamic and clever way.

The purpose of the game is scoring the most points by doing human towers typical of catalan culture. The game is played in five regular rounds plus a column round. Each regular round is divided in two phases.

In first phase, called "assaig" (something like "erzatz"), cards are dealed and traded until most players have assembled enought cards to build a human tower.

Then a new phase called "a plaça" (literally "to the square", but it means performing), each player must perform the towers by using the dice : thay have to roll over difficulty of their tower to build the tower, and if the tower is succeful, they score a "trial" token and can try to "unbuild" the tower. The trial tokens earned in past rounds can be exchanged for rerolls. Each round has a scoring process : first player to complete a tower, succesful builds and unbuilds score points according with the difficulty of the tower. After the five regular rounds are played, players can try to build human columns (called "pilars") with excess trial tokens and score points according to column difficulty.

The player that scores most points, adding score of all rounds is the winner.

192011.name: It All Falls Down (5E)
192011.description:
From publisher blurb:

A 5th Edition compatible adventure for four to six PCs of level 6

The Saatman emerald is an artifact, a relic of a long lost civilization that has been safely hidden in the Iroth family vault for years. But now, it, along with thousands of other precious gems have been stolen! A secretive group of duergar, long since driven insane from a curse, have broken into the family home and stolen away with the emerald, which must be recovered before it is lost in the miles of tunnels that lead ever deeper into the world.

But getting the relic back is the easy part! The players will soon find themselves running for their lives, and lost in an underground catacomb as the duergar are more than happy to collapse the tunnels behind themselves. Are the players lost forever, or perhaps, are there other treasures to recover on the long road back to the world above?

Also included in “It all Falls Down”:

The Thousand-Hammer, a wall-toppling magic item bound to pack a punch
A new monster, the Chikfari, along with several variants the PCs can hope to catch and train as mounts
Details on the Iroth family, complete with treachery brewing

192012.name: Missing Mythic Magic Volume XIX
192012.description:
From publisher blurb:

Uncover Forgotten Arcane Lore!

Everyone knows that knowledge is power, and that having options is better than not having them. It should come as no surprise, then, that wizards, witches, and other powerful spellcasters are always on the lookout for new and exciting spells to add to their repertoires. While many spells from the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook received a facelift and an upgrade in Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Mythic Adventures, the sourcebook that introduced mythic power to the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, dozens of spells were left behind. Missing Mythic Magic Volume XIX, and its predecessors, aim to give each and every spell from the core rules a full-fledged mythic upgrade, all the way from A to Z, with a special focus on making mythic spells that feel as over-the-top and larger-than-life as possible.

This installment includes 19 mythic spells, from sleet storm to stonetell. A mythic snare can be placed in any location, and tightens on the victim with each attempt to escape. A mythic soul bind doesn’t require an expensive material focus, and can even be used to destroy the target’s soul outright, while a mythic spectral hand can be used to wield weapons, manipulate objects, or make touch attacks to drain a foe’s life force directly, and mythic spell immunity can protect against entire schools of magic, or, with the greater version, even protect against all magic of a certain type (arcane, divine, or psychic). This tome contains all that, and much, much more!

192013.name: E.D.E.N.
192013.description:
From the back of the book:
Esiste un luogo misterioso, in cui si deciderà il destino dell'intera MultiRealtà.
Esistono Spiriti di immane potenza che si muovono tra le Sfere.
E.D.E.N. è una Realtà composta da sette mondi diversi, un luogo gigantesco da esplorare per carpirne i numerosi segreti e affrontarne le minacce mortali... tra cui possenti Spiriti, convocati su E.D.E.N. dalle più svariate Realtà.

English translation:
There is a mysterious place , where the fate of the entire MultiReality will be decided.
There are spirits of immense power that move between the spheres.
E.D.E.N. is a reality composed of seven different worlds, a gigantic place to explore to understand its secrets and face its deadly threats ... including mighty spirits, conjured on E.D.E.N. from different worlds.

192014.name: Countdown
192014.description:
From the back of the book:
Il mondo è pronto ad esplodere: minacce di conflitti globali si perdono nella Babele virtuale della rete mentre l’orologio dell’apocalisse scandisce imperturbabile la sua marcia verso la fine dell’umanità.
Il secondi scorrono sullo schermo del computer: la sua Venuta è vicina.

English translation:
The world is ready to explode: threats of global conflicts are lost in the virtual Babel of the web while the apocalypse clock marks unflappable his march to the end of humanity.
The seconds are ticking on the computer screen: His coming is near.

192016.description:
Attack the walls, build siege weapons, explore the dungeons and prepare your strategy on this fast paced card game.

Destroy the enemy castles to win the game.

Each player starts with a castle card, protected by 3 wall cards. A castle can't be attacked until you destroy their walls (unless you get an assault card).

The Castle & Walls defense is represented by shields. To destroy a card you need to attack with more swords than shields.

You can attack with several cards, gathering soldiers, bowmen, siege weapons and so. Your enemy can avoid your attack using Academy cards (strategies to reduce the damage taken).

There are different decks on the game:

The Town deck provides soldiers, bowmen, builders, explorers, gold and more. You will draw 1 Town card on each turn, and you will perform an action then (an action can be played with 1 or more cards at the same time).
The Siege deck provides siege weapons with high attack power; you can get Siege cards using your builders and gold.
The Academy deck provides tactics to avoid enemy attacks.
The Dungeon deck will be open with explorers; beat a deck to get a treasure (additional town cards).




- - - - -
Español:

Castlecards: Asalto al Castillo es un juego de cartas de partidas rápidas donde la estrategia y la suerte se entremezclan para disputar batallas medievales. Podrás construir armas, explorar mazmorras, preparar tu defensa, atacar murallas y asaltar los castillos enemigos.

Es un juego muy fácil de aprender a jugar, de 2 a 4 jugadores en partidas de unos 10/15 minutos, a partir de 9 años.

Tu objetivo es asaltar los castillos rivales para preservar tu poblado, pero para conseguirlo tendrás que acabar antes con las murallas que los protegen.

Cada partida empieza con 1 castillo y 3 cartas de muralla para cada jugador. Se reparten 5 cartas de Poblado a cada uno y en cada turno podrás robar una carta de Poblado y realizar una acción.

Con estas cartas podrás realizar ataques, defenderte, construir armas, explorar mazmorras y otras acciones.

Las cartas de tu fortaleza, murallas y castillo, tienen un valor de defensa representado por una cantidad de escudos. Las cartas de ataque, como soldados, arqueros y armas, tienen un valor de ataque representado por espadas. Para atacar una carta puedes unir tantas unidades como desees y lanzar un ataque: si el número de espadas supera al de escudos, tu ataque vencerá.

Las unidades de ataque también tienen valores de defensa, y pueden apostarse en las murallas o el castillo para defenderlo. Además, podrás usar cartas de reacción para intentar repeler un ataque.

¡Utiliza tus cartas con habilidad para asaltar el castillo enemigo!
192016.name: Castlecards

192017.name: Trivial Pursuit: The Big Bang Theory Edition
192017.description: Fancy yourself a brainbox like Sheldon? Then Trivial Pursuit Big Bang Theory is for you! This nerdy version of the hit comedy show is packed with 600 questions, spanning all seven series. What`s more, this edition requires no board and can be carried around in its bite-size wedge case. Prove you`re the biggest Big Bang fan with this special version of Trivial Pursuit! A great game for 2+ players at ages 12+.

192018.name: Fábulas Fantásticas
192018.description:
Fábulas Fantásticas é um jogo de storytelling, isto é, através das imagens contidas nas cartas, os jogadores se unem para contar e criar uma história pra lá de fantástica.

O jogo é formado por um baralho de 54 cartas dividido em 3 tipos: Persona, que define o protagonista e os coadjuvantes da cena, Locações, que define o cenário onde a cena ocorre, e Acessórios, itens que trazem o conflito motivador da cena.


Fantastic Fables is a storytelling game, that is, through the images contained on cards, players come together to tell a story even more fantastic.

The game uses a deck of 54 cards, divided into 3 types: Persona, defining the protagonist and the supporting cast, Locations,which sets the local where the scene takes place, and Accessories, items that trigger the conflict scene.

192019.name: Escola de Dragões: Intercâmbio no Oriente
192019.description:
The Gran-masters decided to take their students on a vacation exchange to practicing against a different school. But it seems that will not be easy.

This first expansion for School of Dragons extends the a number of players to 5 (base deck + expansion) and adds 26 cards with Orient-themed illustrations (art by Jersey Giuliano) and two new powers found in two cards:

Old Master - His power change the direction of the table (from clockwise to counterclockwise or vice versa).
Troll Kabuki - Allows the player to see 4 cards from the hand of another player.

The game continues with the same simple features, uniting experienced and novice player while keeping the fun.

From the publiser (Portuguese):
Os magos da Escola de Dragões decidiram levar seus alunos em um intercâmbio de férias para que praticassem contra uma escola diferente. Mas parece que não será fácil.

Na primeira expansão de Escola de Dragões amplia a quantidade de jogadores de 4 para 5 participantes e adiciona 26 cartas com ilustrações com temática oriental, todos os desenhos com a belíssima arte de Jersey Giuliano, e dois novos poderes encontrados nas duas cartas:

Mestre Treinador - Permite que o jogador veja a mão de outro participante
Troll Kabuki - Sim! O terrível Troll também foi para o oriente! E resolveu participar de aulas de teatro! Seu poder é inverter o sentido da mesa. Se o jogo está no sentido horário ele passa a ser anti horário! Ou vice versa.

O jogo continua com a mesmas características simples mantendo sua pegada de unir jogadores experientes e novatos sem perder a diversão.

192020.name: Simon's Dinner Theatre (5E)
192020.description:
From publisher blurb:

The fourth instalment in our Tangible Taverns line, Simon's Dinner Theatre, details a delightful dinner theatre with fantastic food, and is now compatible with the 5th edition of the world's oldest roleplaying game.

As always, we have included rumour and event tables, a tavern map, and descriptions of frequent faces about the establishment (which include names, physical features and personalities for the actors). We have also included a table with play titles and descriptions so you can let your players know what their characters are viewing. Instead of just deducting a few gold pieces and letting your PCs regain some spells, give them a chance to explore and interact with the city around them at Simon’s Dinner Theatre.

192021.name: Ultima Forsan: Macabre Rutenia
192021.description:
From publisher blurb:

FROM RUSSIA WITH GORE

From the frozen shores of the White Sea to the opulent khanate of Astrakhan, from the borders of the endless Tartary to the dark woods of Lithuania... Ultima Forsan: Macabre Ruthenia is a regional gazetteer about Macabre Russia for Ultima Forsan.

Ruthenia is not a country for weak men: Muscovy is on the edge of a civil war, the marauders gather on the east bank of the Volga river, the malevolent Yagas lurk to ensnare travelers, Koschei the Deathless roams the steppes. And the shadow of Erlik Khan, the God of Death that controls the Golden Horde, falls over the whole region.

Inside Ultima Forsan: Macabre Ruthenia you can find:

A gazetteer of Macabre Ruthenia divided by region
A new double-page map: Rutenia Macabra
History, geography and politics of Ruthenia in the time of the Plague
New Edges, weapons and gear for Ruthenian Heroes
Legends, rumors, threats and hints for adventure for the Game Master
An encounter generator that will allow you to create amazing travel adventures for your Heroes
New monsters and enemies




ENTER THE MACABRE REALM OF BABA YAGA!

192022.name: Coffin Dodgers
192022.description:
Take on the role of 1 of 7 quirky old characters as they battle the Grim Reaper in a race for their soul.

Modify your mobility scooter, kit it out with awesome weapons and customised parts to help you stay ahead of the pack.

Take on the Grim Reaper and his army of zombies over 13 races where only the most skilled racer will survive.

Welcome to a suburban retirement village where all is not as it seems… After settling down to recover from the responsibilities of working life, the residents of Sunny Pines have been idling away the days, life could not be more tranquil.

However, a creepy new resident, Mr Grim Reaper, looks set to turn retirement on its head… After years trawling the earth for souls to harvest, Mr Grim Reaper concludes Sunny Pines is where he’ll lay his hat; here he can harvest souls from the comfort of his rocking chair. However, seven of the sprightliest OAPs (old age pensioners) have other ideas and set out to prove that life for Grim at Sunny Pines definitely won’t be like shooting fish in a barrel.

The stately seven decide to strike a deal with the Grim Reaper; a racing championship to the death. If they can prove themselves to be fast and full of life, surviving and ultimately winning the championship, then he will allow them to live. However, too slow and they will be condemned to the retirement village in the sky.

What the Reaper doesn’t tell the folk of Sunny Pines is that once he takes your soul he can bring you back as one of his army of the living dead; mobility scooter racing zombies that are hell bent on making sure that nobody wins, by any means possible.

Source: The Game Website.

192023.name: Demyansk Shield: the Frozen Fortress, February-May 1942
192023.description:
Historical Setting - From 22 June 1941 Axis armies attacked the Soviet Union on a broad front. While the northern group of armies (Army Group North) pushed towards Leningrad in a war of rapid maneuver its 16th Army covered the flank in the Lake Ilmen – Valday Hills area. Here, fighting began to settle down in early fall 1941 and by January had become static. Then the Soviets attacked. By late January the Soviet 11th Army had broken the German front in several sectors and threatened to surround perhaps 70,000 Germans around Demyansk. When 3rd Shock Army broke the southern wing of German 16th Army Soviet advances threatened now to destroy 16th Army and open the flank to Leningrad. It is at this stage that game-play begins.

General Introduction - Demyansk Shield recreates the World War II campaign in the Valday Hills region of Russia, from late January 1942 through May 1942. One player will control the Axis forces (Germans), while his opponent controls the Soviet forces (Russians). The playing pieces represent the actual units that participated in the campaign and the map represents the terrain over which those units fought. The players maneuver their units across the map and conduct combat according to the rules of play. One player wins by capturing certain specified objectives while his opponent wins by avoiding those victory conditions.

192024.name: Car Washer: Summer Of The Ninja
192024.description:
Summer break, a time to relax and have fun. But what's the difference between a good summer and a great summer? Spending money, of course! And what better way to earn some extra cash than a car wash? Unfortunately, the local branch of Ninja Car Washing Corp. is right across the street and they don’t appreciate the competition...

Car Washer is an arcade style casual game for Windows PCs and the Xbox 360. Wash cars quickly to keep your customers happy and keep the money coming in. But beware! Those pesky ninja will do everything they can to run you out of business. You’ll need to use your wits, reflexes, and collection of basic car washing tools to defend against their attacks while keeping your customers happy.

Learn to wield powerful items like the Garden Hose, Giant Sponge, and Reptile Wax both to clean cars and fend off the attacking ninja! You’ll start by defending against simple threats like muddy water balloons and exploding shuriken, but prove yourself superior to such petty tricks and your reputation will grow, earning you more customers and more attention from your enemies. Use the money earned to upgrade your stand and buy new gear such as the Polishing Cloth, Textured Sponge, and Fire Hose then put that equipment to work, taking on bigger jobs and fighting off mud firing bazookas, ninja assassins, and the dreaded trained pigeon attack squad!

Source: The Game Website.

192025.name: Mr. Freeze
192025.description:
From the inlay:

Mr Freeze is faced with a real challenge. Armed with a flame thrower he has to determine a route through the fridge and de-ice each of its six compartments. This involves jumping over ice cubes and gaps between the shelves, and avoiding flying food, lasers and guardian robots. You'll need all your cunning, timing and skill to prevent Mr Freeze from being turned into ice. B-R-R-R!!!

User Summary

Mr Freeze is a game in the mould of Manic Miner. It was writted by David T. Clark for the Spectrum, and he also converted it to the Amstrad CPC. The C64 version was converted by Kevin A. Moughtin and the BBC Micro version by Timothy Wilkinson.

192026.name: Deep Under the Sky
192026.description:
"A psychedelic one-button arcade game by Rich Edwards and Colin Northway.

In the clouds of the planet Venus, a strange species of jellyfish thrive and reproduce among the great space whales. Launch, jet, swing and roll through an alien landscape and propagate your species."

--http://northwaygames.com/games/

192027.name: Cerberus
192027.description:
User summary:
ケルベロス (Cerberus) was developed from ideas that appeared whilst designing the game ヘッジホッグジレンマ (Hedgehog's Dilemma).

Players are dealt six cards. You play a card each turn, whose value is either 1, 2, or 3. If the card's value matches a card in play, you score that value. But if you score more than five points, you lose all the points scored so far.

Publisher's summary:
1-3の数字が書かれた6枚のカードを任意の順番で出し、
場のカードとペアを作り得点を獲得します。
6点以上の点を獲得すると0点になります。
出したカードと同じ数字のカードが場にあると必ずペアになります。

192028.description:
Vagadas is a mancala inspired game of wandering. After setup of the 18 modular land tiles and placement of goods on each tile, players take turns moving the tokens around the board to gain points based on the tokens they are moving and where those tokens end the turn.

Contents:
81 tokens (9 each of cargo, fish, food, gold, love, people, stone, water, and wood.)
1 bag
18 Land Tiles
5 Player tokens

Setup:
Shuffle the 18 land tiles and make a 6 x 3 pattern (You may vary this modular board as long as there are at least 2 rows of tiles). Draw 4 random tokens from the bag and place on each tile, following the rules of each if needed.

Game Play:
Players will take turns going North/South or East/West depending on which side of their player token is face up. Players will take all the tokens on a tile, and moving in the desired direction, place one token on each tile until all the tokens in hand are exhausted. After all tokens are placed, scoring will happen depending on which tile the player ended placing tokens. Play repeats until there are no legal moves and the player with the highest score wins.
192028.name: Vagadas

192029.name: Gozaru Gozaru Ninja de Gozaru
boardgamepublisher: Chicken Dice Games (チキンダイスゲームズ)
192029.description:
User summary:
ござるござる忍者でござる (Gozaru Gozaru Ninja de Gozaru) means "We are NINJA!" in English.

Ninjas are trying to steal your secret documents. Even high fences and heavy security cannot prevent them from infiltrating. Once you let even one of them sneak in, the entire territory will be overflowing with them and all the documents will be stolen. Counter-intelligence is the only way to protect your documents. You must mislead the Ninjas away from your documents.

The game is played with 2-4 players. Each player has four secret documents hidden in a 5x5 square grid gameboard. Your goal is to place Ninja tiles on squares where opponents' documents are hidden, while protecting your documents. During the game, players take turns placing a Ninja tile following placement rules. At the end of game, you score victory points if your document square is not occupied by a Ninja tile.

Are you smart enough to protect your secret documents?

The artwork for this game came from copyright free images.

Publisher's summary:
ボード上に忍者タイルを配置して、自分の密書のマスを守り抜きましょう。
しかし、どんどん増えてゆく忍者を前にしては、簡単な事ではありません！
あなたは大事な密書を守れるでしょうか？　

「密書」が狙われている。
どんなに高い塀も、どんなに厳重な警備も、忍者の進入を阻む事は出来ない。侵入を許せば、不思議な術で部屋はたちまち忍者で溢れかえり、根こそぎ奪われてしまう事だろう。
忍者から密書をまもる為には、情報戦しかない。忍者をミスリードしてあなたの密書から遠ざけるのだ！

192030.name: Infinite Potions
192030.description:
From publisher blurb:

Adding detailed descriptions to special items in your game can help immerse your players. For example, when PCs discover a potion, initially it isn’t a Potion of Healing or Potion of Invisibility. It is a potion that is a certain color, has a given consistency, has a particular smell and taste (if a PC tests it) and comes in one of many types of flasks.

This PDF helps you to describe all of these properties of potions. In addition it includes rules for expired or bad potions if you wish to consider those problems.

Below are several examples created using the tables:

Thin and bubbly, translucent red violet colored potion that smells like ginger and mustard and tastes like snake with a ginger and mustard aftertaste in a steel, tubular top, 3" long, 1" in diameter, triangular bottom 6" on a side flask.
Clumpy white potion with teal blue drops that smells like chives but tastes like pickled venison and mushrooms in a steel, tubular top, 3" long, 1" in diameter, triangular bottom 6" on a side flask. The potion is old... while it works, the subject feels itchy for the next 8 hours.
Jelly carnation pink potion that has no smell but tastes like kiwi and ginger in a clay, tubular top, 3" long, 1" in diameter, spherical bottom 6" in diameter flask. The potion was made by a novice and is only half as effective (Pick one: duration, hit points healed, etc.)




Fizzy translucent plum potion that smells like kiwi but tastes like beef in a steel, tubular top, 2" long, 1" in diameter, rectangular bottom 6" x 8" x 2" flask.

192031.name: Infinite Trinkets
192031.description:
From publisher blurb:

With the rolls of a few d12 dice, instantly create a number of random trinkets! Use them to inspire a new character's backstory or create mundane treasures! The pages that follow include several charts that allow you to determine a trinket and customize it with shapes, body parts, colors, etc. The chart results may be used verbatim but you may also use the results inspire even more trinkets!

Below are several examples created using the tables:

A gold hexagonal prism filled with dead but moving ants.
A brass coin with a skull scratched into the tails side.
Fist sized bright silver scorpion.
3 small jars of animal scat: dog, ferret, horse.
Dart hidden inside a torch.

192032.description:
The theme of this card game is the Battle of Aljubarrota, fought in 1385 between Portugal and Spain.

There are two king cards and 42 cards organised in 7 'suits' (crowns, shields, banners, archers, people, cavalry, infantry) each with 6 values and colours. Each player takes a king card and half the shuffled deck face down. Each player draws a card from their their pile and places it face up. From then on each player draws a card from their pile and places it in one of the face up piles, if it matches the suit, colour or value. If not, either it returns to the bottom of the pile, or it is placed together with a king card on any pile. The aim is to be the first to get rid of their cards.
192032.name: Aljubarrota: The Royal Battle

192033.description:
FRICO is the most popular game of the culture war that is ironically playful parochial controversy that often pits the city of Udine and Trieste on the market. The military confrontation-humorous takes shots of traditions and cultural elements characteristic of the two cities, the background scenario with a regional part of the municipalities of Friuli, Trieste across the districts, separated from Bisiacheria, neutral buffer zone.
The aim is the conquest of the region's most sought-after in the world: the Friuli Venezia Giulia.
The Turn of each player consists of:
- Draw a card from their decks of belonging;
- Acquire reinforcements through the number of territories held;
- Moving a group of armies in another adjacent territory
- Attack other players using a simple rule of combat comparison the result of a dice for the attacker and one defender, the higher of the two wins. Players can stick with the desired frequency.
- Use the cards to take advantage or disadvantage the enemy.

FRICO è il più popolare gioco di guerra culturale che tratta con ironia la scherzosa diatriba campanilistica che spesso contrappone le città di Udine e Trieste disponibile sul mercato. Il confronto bellico-umoristico avviene a colpi di tradizioni ed elementi culturali caratteristici delle due città, sullo sfondo lo scenario regionale con da una parte i comuni friulani, dall'altra i rioni triestini, separati dalla Bisiacheria, zona cuscinetto neutrale.
L'obiettivo è la conquista della regione più ambita al mondo: il Friuli Venezia Giulia.
Il Turno di ogni giocatore è composto da:
-Pescare una delle carte del proprio mazzo di appartenenza;
- Acquisire rinforzi attraverso il numero di territori tenuto;
- Spostamento di un gruppo di eserciti in un altro territorio adiacente
- Attaccare altri giocatori usando una semplice regola di combattimento di confronto il risultato di un dado per l’attaccante e uno per il difensore,il più alto tra i due vince. I giocatori possono attaccare con la frequenza desiderata.
- Usare le carte per avvantaggiarsi o svantaggiare il nemico.
192033.name: FRICO

192034.name: New Teams: Cosplay
192034.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cosplay is a new team of heroic Base Raiders usable as pregenerated player characters, NPC allies, or rivals. Each member of Cosplay has plot hooks that could be used in your next Base Raiders games:

Saber Antimony: A Japanese magical school girl who fought demonically possessed beings in Tokyo. She disappeared for a long time, only to resurface now. How did she escape Ragnarok? Why is she raiding bases? Is she the real Saber or an imposter? No one knows...yet!
Pretty Soldier: A talented Russian power armor pilot equipped with a unique suit of armor built with alien technology. Is she in control of the armor or is it?
The Chosen One: The little brother of a missing superhero takes up his cause. He has incredible telekinetic powers but also believes in his own hype too much. He literally believes he is the Hero with a Thousand Faces, which gets him into trouble quite often.




This supplement also contains information on how to use Cosplay in your game and Saber Antimony's arch-nemsis, The Darkness That Dwells. An ancient evil returning to menace humanity, the Darkness that Dwells can possess humans or animals, turning them into savage monsters.

192035.name: Fifth Edition Monsters #01: Kobold Triggerer
192035.description:
From publisher blurb:

The folks here at Flying Ape Studios have always been fans of the world’s most famous roleplaying game, especially its older iterations.Fifth edition was a great surprise, since it had elements from past editions and became once again a game that can be played without worrying too much about rules and etc.

Much to our surprise the rules for this edition were released under the Open Game License, and Dungeon Masters Guild was opened. We knew we had to come up with some content for it... and here it is! Who doesn’t love kobolds?

This will be a regular series in which a new monster is presented each time. In this first volume we proudly present the Kobold Triggerer.

192036.name: Fifth Edition Monsters #02: Pustule Serpent
192036.description:
From publisher blurb:

Browsing through the Monster Manual, I realized that there are only three monsters in that book with a CR 12. Even with the tendency of having less high level monsters than lower level ones, I thought it would be nice to have some more variety - after all, two of those three available creatures are spellcasters.

I came up with this new monster, caled the Pustule Serpent. It is a venomous snake-like creature (albeit not really being reptilian, but that doesn’t make a lot of difference). One key mechanic of this adversary is that a failed attack against it may spawn of its young right into combat, by rupturing one of its poisonous gestation sacks. Poison damage and more danger ensues!

Other than the adult Pustule Serpent of CR 12 a younger version is also presented, having a CR 6. The key difference between them is that the older serpent has a poison spit attack and more damage resistances, making it a lot deadlier and also harder to defeat. Additionally the creature’s venom can be distilled into the highly dangerous blister poison, whose rules are also contained herein.

192037.name: Tiny Quest
192037.description:
User summary:

Characters have three Abilities (Strength, Dexterity, and Mind). These Abilities have numeric scores distributed from a pool. The game supports six Skills and, in the cast of spell casters, magical powers.

192038.name: Pocket FU
192038.description:
The Free Universal Roleplaying Game - Abridged Edition

User summary:

Pocket FU provides a stripped-down version of the game that can be quickly learned. It is designed to work alone but also will function as an introduction to more complex rule sets. The product has a layout to allow printing, cutting, and folding into a pocket-sized booklet.

192039.name: Dead on Arrival: Survivor Profile Pack
192039.description:
User summary:

Includes one blank character sheet and nine pre-generated characters for the game:

Big Guy
Dangerous Chick
Good Guy
Hot Chick
Quick Guy
Reckless Guy
Savvy Chick
Smart Guy
Tough Guy

192040.name: Journey through Mirkwood
192040.description:
User summary:

Journey through Mirkwood presents a solo adventure in a typical fantasy setting. The player's character has a few statistics which are tracked; events are derived from random tables. The player makes some decisions that influence the narrative arc.

192041.name: Wolves and Seven Days
192041.description:
User summary:
狼と七日間 (Ookami to Nanokakan) is a worker placement game, called Wolves and Seven Days in English.

In the game of Wolves and Seven Days, each player leads a clan of werewolves. They try to infiltrate a village and control it from inside.

There are six villagers in the village. You send your henchman werewolves into these villagers to control them. You gain victory points by controlling these villagers, and the highest scorer wins the game.

A game consists of seven rounds. Do the following each round:
1) Players play an initiative card simultaneously. The player with highest initiative value goes first. But if there's a tie for the initiative value, all tied players lose the opportunity to play this round. (In Japan, the mechanism that has the same cards or the tied values cancelling each other out is called "butting".)
2) Among non-tied players, in the initiative order, place your henchman on a villager. You may then activate that villager's special ability.

After seven rounds, for each villager, total your henchmen's influence points on that villager. You gain that villager's victory points if you have the highest influence points on that villager. But "butting" is applied here again; you cannot gain victory points if your influence points are tied with any other's.

Although this game is inspired by Werewolf, it is not a werewolf game. You send your henchmen in like worker placement, and determine the controller of each villager by majority of influence. And the "butting" and a little bit of bluffing are the keys to enjoying the game.

Publisher's summary:
「バッティング」とちょっとした「ブラフ」が楽しい人狼モチーフのカードゲームです！人狼一族をひきいて人間の村を支配することを目指します。
村には得点の異なる6つの地区（エリア）があり、自分の狼を配置していくことでその地区を支配することができます。
支配したエリアの合計得点が最も高いプレイヤーが勝利します。
また、各エリアにいる、特殊能力を持つ村人たちを扇動することで、さまざまな能力を利用することができます。

192042.name: Dark Fairytale
192042.description:
User summary:

Characters in Dark Fairytale have Attributes and Skills, with independent Levels allocated from a point pool at character creation. Characters subsequently earn experience points which can be spent to gain Levels or other special abilities. The game provides an unusual number of options for character customization. The basic combat mechanic is simple; the game provides several special circumstances for various types of combat.

192043.name: A Wanderer in the Forest of Wyr
192043.description:
In Wyr you wander, searching for the spellshards of your magic which have become ravens. Will you recover all eight shards and win your way home or will you ever roam among the dark trees of Wyr?

A solitaire game using a one page board, 9 markers, 1 deck of playing cards and 1 six sided die.

To Win: You must free each of the 8 Ravens, reclaiming their spellshards of magic before the remaining ravens reduce your health to 0.
Each Raven you free will allow you to draw a Recovered Spellshard card from its deck.

To Play: Each round of the game has 3 phases which are played in cycles until all Ravens are freed or your health is lost:

Phase 1. Raven Flight - Draw 1 card from the Raven Flight deck and discard it face up to the bottom of the game board. The card drawn equals the number of spaces 1 or more Ravens will fly (i.e. move) this turn.

Phase 2. Raven Attack - Each Raven that ends its flight on a space your marker occupies will attack you in turn. For each Raven draw 1 Raven Strength card plus 1 additional card for each freed Raven.

Then, play cards from your hand into a discard pile in front of you, adding the values of each card together for your defense strength. If your defense strength is greater than the Raven’s attack strength you have freed the Spellshard.

Phase 3. Wanderer Movement/Freeing -
The cards in your hand are used both for defense and movement. Each card you play will go in a discard pile in front of you.

Recovered Spellshards Deck -
When Ravens are freed they become Spellshards you have recovered. You may use a Spellshard at any time during a round, playing them from your hand, but once a Spellshard is played it is removed from the game.

This game is part of a series: The other two games are Seeker in the Forest of Wyr and Land of Enin

192044.name: Booklet of Secrets
192044.description:
User summary:

The Booklet of Secrets presents a solo "choose-your-own-adventure" style document in the Tale of Navri setting. Users read material, make a choice, and turn to the page indicated for their choice to continue reading.

192045.name: Quick-Play: A Diceless, Universal, Quick RPG
rpg: Quick-Play: A Diceless, Universal, Quick RPG
192045.description:
User summary:

This rules-light game uses an unusual method of conflict resolution where players attempt to "guess a number" that matches what the game master has selected. Players get one guess for every rank they have in a relevant Attribute.

192047.description:
From the publisher's website:

Story Time Dice are back! Roll your way into a spooky and supernatural world of storytelling. These seven jumbo polyhedral dice illustrate 72 classic horror concepts and combine to roll over 6 million story combinations. And the best part? They glow in the dark!

Pit twelve intrepid heroes against twelve menacing monsters across eight scary settings. Overcome eight obstacles with the help of twenty tools, but stay wary of the six troublesome twists! Will your heroes survive? The answer is just a roll away!

If you need a little help getting started, every set of Story Time Dice: Scary Tales comes with a handy dice guide with 8 suggested games to play. They range from simple storytelling games for beginners to complex, turn-based party games with lots of rolling. There's even a special crossover game for owners of Story Time Dice and Story Time Dice: Fairy Tale! Are you brave enough to play them all?
192047.name: Story Time Dice: Scary Tales

192049.name: Iron Edda: World of Metal & Bone (DW)
rpgsetting: Iron Edda: War of Metal & Bone
192049.description:
From publisher blurb:


The World

Dwarven Destroyers stretch shadows across Midgard, a harbinger of war to come.

Brave human warriors abandon clan and holdfast to bond themselves to the bones of dead giants, hoping to push back the Destroyers.

Strangers from others lands appear in Midgard, bringing with them strange powers, and tales of war abroad.

Seers advise and divine the future, but the fate of the world is murky and dim.
Jarls, thralls, and warriors fight in common cause, shouting “victory or Valhalla!” as they charge into battle.

Ragnarok has come, and you live in a World of Metal and Bone. Will you dine with the gods in Valhalla, or dance with the dishonored dead?

Choose your fate.


The Game

Based on Dungeon World, by Adam Kobel and Sage LaTorra, World of Metal and Bone lets you tell stories of brave warriors, Jarls, Bonebonded giants, and their defense of their holdfasts.


All-new playbooks that reflect the diversity, feel, and scale of the Iron Edda campaign setting.
Add to the world! Every campaign begins with the creation of your own unique holdfast. Each session, you add to the map you’ve made. This is your world and you get to see how it changes.
Form bonds with your party members, celebrate your warrior clan, and honor your history with your own sacred item.


War with the dwarves and their constructs rages across the face of Midgard. What role will you play?

192050.name: Sheriff Character Sheet
192050.description:
Publisher blurb:

Before you get your posse ready print up some of these to handle all your details.

192051.name: Dark Stories
192051.description:
User summary:

Although Dark Stories is diceless, the rules suggest the game master have d% on hand "in case he needs to improvise". Character's have Skills and Attributes that are geared toward propelling the narrative development. Characters in the game live in the "real" world and gradually become aware of the "unreal" world of the supernatural (demons, etc.).

192052.name: Dungeon Squad: Elite
192052.description:
User summary:

The game uses a variable die type to represent area of expertise. Characters allocate a D4, D8, and D12 to three Aspects (Attributes): Wizard, Warrior, and Explorer. THe highest die represents the highest proficiency. In lieu of experience, characters amass gold which can be spent to increase ability (e.g., die size) or gain other advantages.

192055.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 227 - 2015)
rpgissuearticle: Back Room at the Games Pit

192056.name: MACE (2012)
192056.description:
User summary:

Characters in MACE have four Traits (Attributes): Might, Agility, Cunning, and Essence. Traits gain ratings from a "Fate Pool" (points pool) at creation. Characters also have Skills, which are based upon Traits. Action resolution involves a modified d6 roll compared against a Target Number.

192057.name: Connect'Em Halloween
192057.description:
User summary:

This is a game where you have blobs that need to be connected. Each blob has a number in it, which is the number of connections that are needed to complete the puzzle. There can be, at most, two connections between blobs. The game includes 70 packs with 100 puzzles in each pack.

192058.name: Pattern
192058.description:
Are you clever enough to spot the pattern?

You have only a few seconds to spot the 3x3 pattern on a 10x10 grid. What sounds easy will soon melt your brain!

Source: The Game Website.

192059.description:
Fano330-R-Morris is a ruthless game, in that you can never win on your turn, but you can lose.

The “Fano” portion of the name comes from the board, which depicts the Fano plane. The Fano plane is a finite projective plane with the minimum number of points and lines possible: 7 points and 7 lines (counting the circle), with 3 points on each line, and 3 lines through every point.
The “330” portion of the name comes from the original playing pieces for the game: ¥330 of Japanese coins: Player 1 would use two ¥100 coins and two ¥50 coins, while Player 2 would use two ¥10 coins and two ¥5 coins.

For the nestorgames edition, each player has pieces of one color: two circles and two triangles, in celebration of the geometry depicted in the Fano plane.

How To Play

The board starts empty. Each player takes the four pieces of a single color to form her supply: Player 1 takes white; Player 2 takes black.

Note: In this game, the term line includes the circle and its arcs.

If no one loses the game before all pieces are on the board (Placement Phase), the game will continue into a Movement Phase.

Placement Phase

On your turn, you must stack a piece from your supply atop one of the spaces (which represent the points) on the board, respecting this Stacking Rule: The space you select must have no more than two pieces on it, and none of them can be both the same color and the same shape as the piece you are adding. For example, you could add your white triangle to any of the following:

- An empty space.
- A space with a circle, or a space with a black piece.
- A space with a black circle and a black triangle, or a space with a white circle and a black piece.

…but neither to a space with a white triangle, nor to a space with 3 pieces on it already.

Movement Phase

On your turn, you must move one of your topmost pieces from a stack along a line to an adjacent space, respecting the Stacking Rule.

Game End

You lose the game if, on your turn, any of the following are true:

At the end of your turn, there are three topmost pieces of the same color, or three topmost pieces of the same shape on the same line (remember, the circle is a “line”).
In the Movement Phase, you are unable to move a piece, because no stack has one of your pieces as its topmost piece at the start of your turn.

If a repetition of moves occurs in the Movement Phase, the game ends in a draw; play the game again, swapping turn order.
192059.name: Fano330-R-Morris

192062.name: Nameless Land: Schiavi delle Maree
192062.description:
From the back of the book:
Porgete lo sguardo aldilà di un nuovo orizzonte e prestate i vostri occhi a una vista lontana dal deserto e dal vento che innalza giallognole cortine di nebbia.

English translation:
Incline your gaze beyond a new horizon and see a distant view of the desert and the wind that raises yellowish curtain of fog.

192063.name: Drizzit Gioco di Ruolo
192063.description:
From the back of the book:
Con Drizzit  Gioco di Ruolo potrete finalmente essere i protagonisti di mille avventure nel fantastico mondo di Gulfingar. Scoprite tutti i segreti di Città del Re, del Bosco di Topple e di tanti altri luoghi mai esplorati nel fumetto.

English translation:
With Drizzit Roleplaying Game you can finally be the protagonists of many adventures in the wonderful world of Gulfingar. Discover the secrets of the City of the King, the Topple Forest and many other places never explored in the comic books.

192064.name: Strade Perigliose di Gulfingar
192064.description:
From the back of the book:
Strade perigliose di Gulfingar è il secondo manuale d'espansione per Drizzit – Gioco di Ruolo.
Areto, il ciambellano di Re Giorgino, vi farà da guida alla scoperta di tutti i segreti della capitale del regno di Gulfingar, Città del Re!

English translation:
Perilous streets of Gulfingar manual is the second expansion for Drizzit - Roleplay .
Areto, the chamberlain of King Georgie, will guide you to discover all the secrets of the capital of the kingdom of Gulfingar, City of Kings!

192065.name: Gli Oscuri Segreti del Bosco Topple
192065.description:
From the back of the book:
L'Ente del Turismo di Topple vi dà il benvenuto! Volete visitare l'Arena, oppure siete venuti per una delle predizioni di Esterina l'Indovina? Ah, siete solo di passaggio perché partirete alla volta del pericoloso Bosco di Topple? Magnifico! Prenotate una visita guidata alla Cattedrale Pendente e non dimenticavi gli opuscoli con i nostri pratici consigli per sfidare il Labirinto dello Smarrimento!

English translation:
The Tourism Authority of Topple welcomes you! You want to visit the Arena, or you came for one of the predictions of Esterina the Seer? Ah, you're just passing and you will leave for the dangerous Topple forest? Good! Book a guided tour of the Leaning Cathedral and don't forget brochures with our practical advice to challenge the maze of Loss !

192066.name: Zauberstein
192066.description: In Zauberstein players try to reach the center of four circular paths on the board. Players can only move from one circle to the next with the help of another player. A six sided dice determines the movement; if a player cannot make use of his dice throw he can donate it to another player, thus helping the ones behind. Nevertheless, there is a winner: the first to bring his 3 pawns (2 in a 6 player game) to the center wins.

192067.name: See-Schlacht
192067.description: See-Schlacht is a card game based on battleship. Each player receives a couple of empty sea cards, 3 single ships (red ship cards), 1 small fleet (2 brown ship cards) and 1 large fleet (3 yellow ship cards). First each player lays out his sea cards in a grid defined by the players (e.g. 4 x 5 cards). Then each player replaces secretly empty sea cards by his ship cards. Single ships are placed by its own, fleets need to be placed on adjacent spaces. In order to trick the oponents he can also replace empty sea cards with other empty sea cards. The game consits of players taking turns in naming a card in an apponents area (e.g. 3rd row, 4th card). The named card is flipped. As sea cards have identical sides players should try to remember which cards have been named. Each player whose ships are all turned face up are out of the game. The last player with hidden ships wins the game.

192068.name: Tactical Ball
192068.description: Players take turns removing marbles of the same colour from the board. You can take as many marbles of a single colour as you wish but all marbles need to be accessible, meaning they are free and not blocked by other marbles. The player with the most marbles at the end wins.

192069.name: Ironsides Preston 1648 Worcester 1651
192069.description:
Ironsides is a moderate complexity game on the decisive battles of Oliver Cromwell and the “Ironsides” of the New Model Army at Preston in 1648 and Worcester in 1651 which won the Civil Wars and established the English Commonwealth. Philip Jelley uses the same area movement design as Lilliburlero: The Battle of the Boyne, July 1690 (ATO 40), with units representing the regiments and batteries that fought the battles. Each turn represents one or two hours of time, with weather and nightfall affecting command and control and unit activations. Scenarios are included for both battles with historical deployments, free-set-up, and for Preston a short introductory scenario and a three-day campaign game. There are optional rules for units that might have fought at the battles, and a random events table. Ironsides contains 216 counters, two maps (11” x 34” for Preston and 17” x 22” for Worcester) and a nine-page rulebook.

PRESTON 1648 King Charles I was defeated by Parliament in the First Civil War, but secretly made an Engagement with the Scottish Duke of Hamilton to restore him to the throne. John Lambert’s 4,000 Parliamentarians could only slow Hamilton’s 20,000 invading army as it joined 3,500 Royalists under Sir Marmaduke Langdale and marched through Lancashire. When Langdale encountered Lambert near Preston on 17 August 1648 it was dismissed as another delaying tactic, and Hamilton continued south across the River Ribble. What they did not know was that Oliver Cromwell had forced-marched 4,500 “Ironsides” of the New Model Army 300 miles to join Lambert. Langdale desperately tried to hold off the assault, but was overwhelmed, and Hamilton’s divided and disorganised army was destroyed in a three-day running battle. With the Royalists defeated the Army purged Parliament so they could bring “Charles Stuart, that man of blood, to an account for that blood he had shed”. His trial was a forgone conclusion and the King and Hamilton were beheaded.

WORCESTER 1651 In 1650 the Scots invited King Charles II to succeed his father, so Cromwell invaded Scotland, destroying their army at Dunbar and taking Edinburgh. Charles II raised a new army, but with little chance of victory in Scotland he slipped past Cromwell and marched south to Worcester, hoping to rally English Royalists to his cause. Cromwell followed, joining the county militias raised by Fleetwood and Harrison, marching on the 16,000 Royalists with 31,000 men, intent on a battle of annihilation that would end the Civil Wars for once and for all. On 3 September 1651 Cromwell crossed the River Severn with a bridge of boats, dividing his army in order to encircle the Royalist army. Charles seized his chance and attacked the militia east of the river, but was repulsed, and the Ironsides chased his army through the bloody streets of Worcester, killing 3,000 and taking 13,000 prisoners. Charles fled to France, famously hiding in an oak tree to escape capture, while Cromwell would overthrow Parliament and make himself Lord Protector.

• Two Mapsheets (11″x34″ and 17”x22”)
• One Countersheet (216 9/16″ counters)
• One Rules Booklet
• Two Players Aid Charts (one for each player)
• Two Generals Display Charts (one for each side)
Two six-sided dice are required to play the game, but are not included.

192070.name: Age of Steel:  Recharge
192070.description:
User Summary

You defend a base using turrets, tanks, ships, and air units to repel attackers. You mine resources to manufacture units and improve tech. The graphics are retro and the storyline is of future Earth pitted between the Alliance and the Opposition.

192071.name: Gremlins Inc
192071.description:
Gremlins, Inc. is an intense strategy board game in a steampunk world of corrupt capitalist gremlins who compete for money, political power and prestige. Steal resources, extort bribes, manipulate elections, lay traps, provoke conflicts, cheat, arrest other players – or send them telegrams of misfortune: in this game you have to be mean to win!
Gremlins, Inc. is designed by Alexey Bokulev (who shipped Eador. Genesis before) and produced by Sergei Klimov (who also shipped a few games before). It is developed since July 2013 by Charlie Oscar, a Vilnius-based indie studio, between Stockholm, Kiev & Vilnius.
Source: The Publisher Website.

192072.name: Space Pilgrim Episode I: Alpha Centauri
192072.description:
User Summary

Looking a lot like a JRPG, this game has less of those gameplay qualities, as you follow a science fiction space storyline by solving puzzles. There an episodic plotline: in this one you are a space pilot to Alpha Centauri, meeting passenger characters who diverge you from your routine flight.

192073.name: Space Pilgrim Episode II: Epsilon Indi
192073.description:
User Summary

Still looking like a JRPG, this second episode has you again as a space pilot, but this time to a new destination and with 3 new passenger characters.

boardgamehonor: 2016 Games Expo Best Strategic Card and Dice Game Winner
2016 Golden Geek Best 2-Player Board Game Nominee
192074.description:
Best Strategic Card or Dice Game - UK Games Expo 2016

Every morning Odin sends his ravens, Huginn and Muninn, across the entire world to bring back news of what life is like on Earth. Naturally, after thousands of years, they've gotten a little competitive. Race through the landscape in opposite directions to be the first to return to Odin. Focus on speed, or enlist the help of the trickster god Loki to create shortcuts and hinder your opponent. Can you be certain Loki's changes won't help your opponent instead? There's only one way to find out!

The revised edition of Thorsten Gimmler's award-winning Odin's Ravens has been completely redesigned, with new rules and a beautiful new art style inspired by Norse mythology.

FAQ
Only the 'rotate' action on the Loki cards can be used on a loop card, or a card which has been slid partially out of the path.
192074.name: Odin's Ravens (second edition)
boardgamepodcastepisode: DJ110: Odin's Ravens - 2a edició (2016) Thorsten Gimmler
Episode 23 - Unpub 6 and a Slew of New Hotness
The Dice Steeple #18 - Mike Fitzgerald Interview
The Game Pit: Episode 64 - Automobiles and more….
Vox Republica 116: North Wind (Is Totally Not A Pirate Game)

192075.name: Battlemind: A Game of Battle Strategy
192075.description:
Battlemind is a medieval-themed battle strategy game in which two players, each with 10 character cards, try to capture/kill the other player's King. Inspired by the game from George R. R. Martin's A Song of Ice and Fire fantasy novels (HBO's Game of Thrones is based on this series), Battlemind combines the strategic elements of Chess, Stratego, and Blitzkrieg to create a an easy to learn but hard to master game with infinite replayability. This game is for anyone who loves strategy games - not just fans of the books!

What makes Battlemind special? Instead of being played like a typical card game (dealing/drawing), it is played more like a board game, with players setting up a "board" made of terrain cards and moving character cards across them.

Like chess, each character card has a certain number of spaces in which it can move. But that's where the similarities end. Each character has a strength value (1-8) which dictates whether it can capture/kill another character as well as certain advantages and disadvantages over other characters. From the lowly Rabble (rabble is like an angry mob) to the powerful Dragon, every unit has a purpose. How you use them is up to you!

Finally, each terrain type can benefit or hinder your character. Use terrain to slow your enemy down, protect your fortress, and even hide from Dragons!

Ultimately, how you set up your terrain, arrange your army, and advance your units will determine whether you will be the victor or the vanquished. You'll laugh at your opponent when he places a crucial unit on his front line that you are able to capture easily, but will be crushed when that same placement allows him to capture your dragon on his first move in the next game!

Will you create a defensive stronghold and make your advesary come to you? Or will you storm the front lines in hopes of catching your opponent off guard?

It's your decision. The fate of the Kingdom rests on your shoulders. Fight for honor. Fight for glory. But remember: in the game of Battlemind, every move can mean victory or crushing defeat.

192076.name: Solid Africa
192076.description: User Summary: Solid Africa is a shoot'em-up game by Joachim Coche in 1988. The player is a soldier with the mission to destroy four forts. The game scrolls in four directions, and the player has to move forward to the different forts and empty them on there items. On screen is a display of the forts, and while playing the forts fades out for each item stealed. The forts are guarded by other solders. The game is started with 9 lifes.

192077.name: Kaosball: Ringer – Nibbles and Dis Assemble
boardgameexpansion: Kaosball: The Fantasy Sport of Total Domination
192077.description: Expand your favorite Kaosball team's roster and boost their scoring potential with these brand new Kaosball Ringers. Ringers are powerful, all-star players that can fight, steal, score, and even use unique special abilities. Combine the right Ringer with your favorite team and unleash an unstoppable force onto the Kaosball field.

192078.name: E. Kensingworth Pinfield's New Game of Circuitous Meandering
192078.description:
Subtitled: "an Adventure, From Beginning To the End.


From the back of the box: "A Game of Luck, Chance, Serendipity, Fortune, and Happenstance, Intended as an Entertaining Amusement For the Youths and their Elders."


A roll and move game. There are 51 spaces, and all even spaces have a programmed instruction. Up to 6 players roll dice, move and follow the instructions until one player successfully arrives at the end space by exact count.

Many of the instructions are witty, silly or entertaining.

192079.name: States Game
192079.description:
States Game is an educational dice game that teaches math skills and U.S. States. It is played with four six-sided dice, with the number one replaced by an outline of the United States.

States are numbered 1 to 50 based on their date of entry into the union. Each player picks a state, and then each player picks one state for each other player. In turn, players roll four dice, declaring which of their assigned states they're aiming for before they roll. Any United States pictures rolled are wild, and may be used as any number from 1 to 6. The player who rolled must then use any combination of addition, subtraction, multiplication and division to achieve the target state's number. If the player is successful, he or she earns a point.

The number or rounds is equal to the number of players, and players may not try for a state they've already scored. After each player has taken all his or her turns, the player with the most points wins.

If the game is tied, all non-tied players choose a state. Each tied player has one roll to get the state's number. This continues until one player wins.

192080.name: Mammals Versus Reptiles
192080.description:
A roll and move game for two players. One player is the mammals, and the other the reptiles. Players roll a special die to move their team of animals along a path to complete a journey to the other end of the path. However the mammals are travelling the opposite direction of the reptiles. No cohabitation of a space is allowed. If two different animals arrive at the same space, one must restart their journey from the beginning.

The game uses special dice, and if the special icon is rolled, an animal must move one space backwards. The board features a few "safe" spaces. The game is won by advancing all of your mammals/reptiles across the path first.

192081.name: Source of light
192081.description: User Summary: Source of light is a public domain shoot'em up written by Christoph Cemper in 1988. The games graphics reminds of the game Uridium, and is also a vertical scrolling shoot'em up in space, where the player can fly a spaceship left or right, and shoot waves of alien ships. The goal is to shoot down the aliens through the 8 levels. Hotshots (highscores) could be saved on disk or tape, and later loaded into the game again. There is also possible to load new galaxies (levels).

192082.name: Remainders Game
192082.description: Remainders Game is a math game, designed to help students learn division. The game is played with a six-sided die marked with the numbers 3 through 8. Each player has a board with 24 squares, each with a three-digit number. In turn, players choose a number, place a marked on it, and roll the die. The player then divides the chosen number by the rolled number. Any remainder is added to the player's score. After all number on each player's card have been marked, the player with the highest total score wins.

192083.name: Space Warrior
192083.description: User Summary: Space Warrior is a shoot'em up by Sebastian Broghammer in 1988. The player is flying a spaceship, and the screens scrolls from left to right. The player must fight waves of alien ships. By doing so the player can get new weapons, and later also, better ships (5 in total). The aim is to get most points by shoting down as many alien ships as possible.

192084.name: ZHeros
192084.description:
Source: [www.zherosgame.com The Publisher Website].

In a journey through distant and unknown galaxies, you play as the members of the ZHEROS squad: Mike and Captain Dorian. Brave, strong as awkward and dim-witted the first one; agile, smart and ready for anything the second one. They are both intergalactic agents called to defend the universe from crime. Your mission: defend the universe from the evil Dr. Vendetta and his twisted plan to mutate every living creature in his trusted minions. In single player or in co-op mode, you can rely on your punches, using a rich selection of combos, and on powerful hi-tech weapons, but if that was not enough, a strong and destructive mech will come to the rescue in the most dangerous situations. From bizarre characters and encounters to strange locations, find out what mystery awaits you at the end of your journey. Key Features: - Engaging and rich combat system - Lots of spectacular combos and weapons to discover, which will have different effects depending on the enemies you’ll have to face - Jump aboard your awesome mech! Rockets and lasers await you! - Local co-op mode to double the action with a friend - Amazing locations: from futuristic cities and laboratories to astonishing and wild forests where the danger lurks - Develop your character to fit your play style upgrading your muscle or your weapons

192085.name: Squeak, Squawk, Grunt, Whistle: the Animal Soundtrack Bingo Game
192085.description:
Squeak, Squawk, Grunt, Whistle is a bingo derivative that teaches about wild animals and their sounds. Each player gets a 3x3 board with pictures of various wild animals. A cassette tape is played. When players hear the sound of an animal on their card, they cover it with a marker. The first player to cover all of his or her animals wins. In order to make the game replayable, players may fast forward the tape to at random place to change the sequence of animal sounds. A list of the order of sounds is included so winners can be checked.

The other side of the tape identifies all the sounds so that players may learn to identify them before playing.

192086.description:
The year 2000, the year of the Dragon in the Chinese Zodiac, saw the re-launch of the Shadowfist game from publisher Z-Man Games.

The set consisted of five 50-card starter decks for each of the five main factions: the Dragons, the Eaters of the Lotus, the Ascended, the Guiding Hand, and the Architects of the Flesh.

Blurb from the starter box: "Shadowfist is the award winning Trading Card Game that's as fast paced as the Hong Kong action films it's based on. Enter a world where factions battle for control of Feng Shui Sites, mystical places that guarantee power and prosperity for those who control them."
192086.name: Shadowfist: Year of the Dragon

192087.name: StaMTaR
192087.description:
User summary:

StaMTaR, the Standard Method for Tasks Resolution in Role-Playing Games, presents a single mechanic for resolving any type of action or task by using an unmodified 3D6 compared to an action table the enumerates results by action difficulty. The difficulty is determined by the game master and the same task could have a variable difficulty for different characters depending upon their ability.

Note, the product does not include a complete game of any genre; it is simply a core mechanic, as inferred by the title.

192088.description:
Description from the publisher:

Cthulhu Wars: Great Old One Pack One adds five new Great Old Ones to Cthulhu Wars, and all five are available to each faction on a first come, first served basis. If you awaken Mother Hydra first, then no one else has access to her...unless they can kill her and reawaken her for themselves. Each Great Old One has its own special ability, plus its own unique spellbook, which is earned separately from your own.

• Abhoth is, of course, the horrible thing which is the source of all uncleanness. When you awaken Abhoth, you gain the power to place Filth tokens around the map. The Filth tokens "fight", participating in battles in their areas, and any damage they inflict goes onto both sides of the battle. However, since the Filth itself is immune, it gradually makes the world a more and more polluted cesspool.

• Chaugnar Faugn gives you the ability to alter the way the Elder Signs work (to your advantage). In addition, he provides you with a new action: Miri Nigri (cost 1) select an area in which you have units; a battle immediately begins there, and all your cultists in the area add +2 to their combat.

• Cthugha is difficult to get as you have to sacrifice a Great Old One, but it changes the way battle results work, allowing you to transform your kills rolled into Elder Signs. Of course, this spares your opponent, but hey, Elder Sign! Also, his spellbook, Fire Vampires, earns you Power for damage inflicted on YOU.

• Mother Hydra gives you the ability to sting your enemy out of the sea, reserving them for your own use. Her Zygote spellbook permits you to spawn multiple cultists at once at a low cost.

• Yig makes your cultists poisonous, so if they're eaten by enemies, those enemies die. In addition, when he earns his spellbook, each turn your foes must decide whether to donate power to you or have you earn doom points.
192088.name: Cthulhu Wars: Great Old One Pack One

192089.name: The Console: Artificially Intelligent Role-playing
192089.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome, to the Console. In this roleplaying game, the Players take on the role of individual programs that exist within an abandoned ship complex. The programs are just lines of code in the ship’s systems, but they can migrate into mobile Terminals of various kinds to help them perform different roles.

The Player Characters are the programs sent out to gather resources for the Collective, rather like cavemen sent out to explore the wilderness.

192090.description:
Boom Chaka Laka was an expansion set sold as boosters for the Shadowfist game. The set perfectly captured the style, movies, and music of the 1970s.

Blurb from the booster box: "The 1970s. It's cool! It's hip! It clashes! And the Secret Warriors find themselves clashing in a big way. Superfly martial artists, dirty cops, nefarious hoods - it's one big throwdown in San Franciso's Chinatown. So strap on your Saturday Night Specials and boogie on down to the fight, cause the Jammers are about to take Disco Inferno literally!"
192090.name: Shadowfist: Boom Chaka Laka

192091.name: Number Play
192091.description: Number Play is a card game designed to teach numbers, counting and basic math to young children. There are direction for several activities and games included. In addition to versions of Memory, Snap and Go Fish, there is a game called Collect 10, which is a simple set collection game in which players must choose cards from faceup or facedown piles in order to try to collect a full run of numbers from 1 to 10.

192092.name: Catch Phrase
192092.description:
Say what you see in this fast-paced family card game based on the hit TV show. Go head-to-head with your opponent to see who will be crowned Catch Phrase champion!

One player is the host, and reveals a card to the other players. They then have to identify the familiar phrase represented by the picture on the card. The first player to identify the catchphrase adds the card to their pile. Each card has a monetary value based on the difficulty of the catchphrase. Once all cards have been revealed, the game is over. The player with the most amount of money is the winner!

192094.name: Raiders of the Lost Oasis
192094.description:
From publisher blurb:

A level 4 adventure

Fifth Edition Fantasy is here! This adventure module is fully compatible with the fifth edition of the world’s first fantasy RPG, and is ready to play in your home campaign!

Captured! While trekking across a trackless wasteland, your stalwart band has fallen into the clutches of a nefarious gang of desert raiders. Imprisoned in a subterranean chamber, you are bereft of all of your equipment and magic items, save for a few tattered loincloths. But as chance would have it, an opportunity to escape the cell presents itself. To escape, you must head deeper into an ancient sealed tomb, armed with nothing but your wits and anything you can find along the way. Getting to the surface is just one of many challenges, as you still need to recover your precious equipment, and flee the Lost Oasis, which is surrounded by an inhospitable sea of solid glass!

192095.name: True Life Night
192095.description:
From publisher blurb:

A diplomatic robot named CC-80 is missing on a planet that hates artificial life. The robot contains vital information that can either aid your cause or make you rich beyond your wildest dreams. You've just received information that CC-80 has been entered in some type of robot smashing game at a nightclub named Killian's Run. Can you rescue CC-80 before it is destroyed by the club's vaunted robot hunters?

True Life Night is a short White Star: Science Fiction Roleplaying adventure designed for three to six characters of 1st-3rd level (about 12 levels total). The adventure takes place in a nightclub on the world of Breone III, but the nightclub can be easily dropped into any urbanized world.

True Life Night includes one (1) new alien lifeform and numerous NPCs for use in your White Star setting.

192096.name: Phoenix Lily 5E
192096.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deadly Gardens is a series of short PDF documents that each feature a brand new plant monster to use in your 5th Edition Fantasy campaigns. In addition to a new monster, each volume will also feature supplemental material based around the natural wilderness theme.

In this volume:

Phoenix Lily CR 4
2 Magic Items: Specimen Jar and Fecund Totem
Rules for Natural Items and how to harvest them
4 Natural Items: Basilisk Blood, Fire Beetle Gand, Phoenix Blossom and Shambler Wafer
Rules for using Basilisk Blood and Phoenix Blossom as magical power components

192097.name: Book of Icons
192097.description:
From publisher blurb:

Icons are the mysterious and powerful figures that shape the world of the 13th Age Role-Playing Game. The Book of Icons takes a fresh look at the game's icon rules and offers a cornucopia of new stuff to throw at your players.

Need a new twist for your campaign? Six new icons--each presented with themes, agents, gifts, and events that will set your creativity afire--all based on the Tarot Major Arcana will spice up your game:

The Adventurer
The Revolutionary
The Order
The Cult of One
The Monster
The Tempter




In addition, find sly characters, scheming organizations, and brain-twisting secret agendas that you can use as a toolkit to flesh out the world around your icons.

192098.name: Battles: Armageddon
192098.description:
User summary:

Battles: Armageddon presents a similar play experience as the author's previous Battles: Win or Lose but with more refinement and numerous added options.

The game typically is distributed as a ZIP archive, with the rule book, extensive print-and-play components, and a layout document. The PDF manual is 24 pages; the remainder of the distribution consists of print-and-play cards.

192099.name: Shadows of Rebellion
192099.description:
From publisher blurb:

The worlds of Ainerêve and Shaintar collide as agents from both worlds fight to gain a foothold and secure more power. Help assist a group of rebels trying to break free from the tyranny of the Kal-A-Nar Empire, but find that a much deeper plot and more powerful foe work in the shadows. This adventure is a crossover event written to bridge the worlds of Ainerêve and Shaintar. The module is written in a “plot point” campaign style, allowing the GM to sculpt the specifics of each encounter. It can be used for a wide range of player/character/gm experience levels, and run with any rule set that a GM desires. However, it is suggested to use either Eldritch RPG (Revised) by Crossroads Games, or Savage Worlds by Pinnacle Entertainment Group

192100.name: Fertile Glens of Ainerêve
192100.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a supplement to the Eldritch Role-Playing Core Rules (Revised). Fertile Glens are magical valleys in the vast Forest of Meath in the world of Ainerêve. There is a strange sentience permeating these places, intelligence and awareness infused with the land. A shee lord or demon gaining knowledge of its secret name can shape the area to conform to its whims and desires. Thus powerful creatures form a symbiotic relationship with Fertile Glens, forming incredible places ranging from the beautiful to the outright horrifying. Two such places are described herein, each quite different from the other: The House on the Hill, ruled by a benevolent crone and her talking animal friends, and The Torturous “Citymind" of Dys, where few adventurers survive.

192101.name: Thermite (Supers!)
192101.description:
From publisher blurb:

Being a mutant with powers you don't understand is hard enough. Being a hot head with fire powers when you are on the run from your country and the police, it becomes a powderkeg. Going from muscle to superhuman menace, he has become a power for hire. Can your heroes extinguish the threat of THERMITE?

192102.name: Get up and Go with the Power of Oats
192102.description:
This game was printed on the back of a Honey Nut Cheerios box. It is a "flip and move" game where players flip a coin to move along a track, collecting oats along the way. Heads moves the player one space, tails two spaces. Some spaces grant the characters a number of oats, from one to fifteen. Some spaces move the player forward or cause loss of a turn. The player who finishes with the most oats wins.

The rules do not specify if the game ends when one player reaches the end, or when all do, but it would make sense to end the game when the first player finishes, otherwise losing a turn would have no negative effects.

192103.name: Tokala
192103.description:
From publisher blurb:
