Cohorts & Companions – Tokala provides twenty stat blocks (CR 1/2 thru 19) for an awakened fox with rogue levels utilizing both the scout and survivalist archetypes. He provides an excellent mix of mobile combat and wilderness skills. Tokala provides an exciting alternative companion to parties and campaigns focusing on wilderness adventures.

This product is Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game compatible and gives you twenty ready-to-play stat blocks for a stalwart companion at all levels, 1 thru 20! Use these stat blocks to add companions or assistants to the party when players are absent, extra muscle is needed, or mercenaries are hired. This also gives the GM the ability to have potential cohorts on hand built at any level needed.

If you find the character’s history and other story elements not to your liking, you still have twenty NPC stat blocks you can use as standalone characters of your own naming and developing or as minions and other rabble. Increase your available NPC stat blocks at every character level (Challenge Rating 1/2 thru 19).

192104.name: The Cyber Age
192104.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cyber arms, street mercenaries and internet cowboys, the mean streets of the cyber age are tough for those not equipped with the newest tech to survive, let alone make a good living.

The Cyber Age is a campaign sourcebook for use with the Infinite Futures 2.0 and Pathfinder.

In short, The Cyber Age is a detailing of one of the 15 Technological Ages of the Universe (see the Infinite Futures 2.0 core rulebook for more on Tech Levels). Specifically, The Cyber Age is about (you guessed it) Tech Level V, the Cyber Age. Inside you will find all sorts of cool goodies for running a cyber punk game using IF 2.0 including new classes, new cyber gear and ways to include magic into the setting.

192105.name: Five Daggers
192105.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need some great magic items for your Pathfinder game? Avalon Games is here to help! Each issue of the Avalon’s Mystic Treasures series will focus on five new magical items for any Pathfinder games. Each item comes with a full description, powers, and cost, as well as history and adventure hooks. All you need to do is drop them into your game and watch your players squeal with delight.

Each issue will showcase news items and new treasures, so get each and every issue and add to your magical collection.

192106.name: Comic Book Adventures: Mission Book 6
192106.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the sixth in a series of missions usable with Comic Book Adventures. These low-level missions and adventures are geared toward sixth- to eighth-level heroes to continue your fun solo games. The mission book is packed full of new quests and escapades, and builds on the story and plot line begun in the Mini-Mission and the first Mission Book.

Note: that this is not a full product and you will need a copy of Comic Book Adventures and Heroes Wear Masks, both by Avalon Games.

Comic Book Adventures uses Avalon’s popular Heroes Wear Masks RPG as the base for the system, which in turn is based on Pathfinder, so if you are familiar with that great RPG game engine, then you are already to go. If you have yet to play Pathfinder or Heroes Wear Masks, then here is your opportunity to jump in.

So get ready, sew your costume, grab your cape, and power up your energy beams: the city is in need of a hero and you must answer the call!

192107.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 5, Issue 3 - Witchcraft)
192107.description:
From publisher blurb:

Each week Avalon Games offers a new issue of Heroes Weekly.

Packed full of great superhero fun, each issue will offer a short adventure, an NPC, or some game mechanics for the Heroes Wear Mask system. While compatible with the HWM system, you can always use the information presented in each issue for other superhero games—just monkey around with the stats and mechanics to fit the system you are using.

A class of NPC villains with magical powers

192108.name: Ancient Dungeon Corridors
192108.description:
From publisher blurb:

Modular Kit: Ancient Dungeon Corridors is a printable dungeon tileset compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone set, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Modular Kit: Ancient Dungeon Corridors comprises 71 different tiles that can be printed multiple times and arranged in limitless combinations. Three different width corridors with straight sections, junctions and steps, and unique passageways, grand corridors and decorative columns. The perfect set for creating exciting and unique dungeons, temples and tomb complexes!

Also included:
A set of 300dpi full size png files, for poster printing or VTT.

192109.name: Ancient Dungeon Rooms
192109.description:
From publisher blurb:

Modular Kit: Ancient Dungeon Rooms is a printable dungeon tileset compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone set, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Modular Kit: Ancient Dungeon Rooms comprises 11 different large tiles that can be printed multiple times and arranged in limitless combinations. Shrines, sacrificial pits, temples, tombs and magic circles- each features crumbled and worn stone, overgrown with roots and plants. Also included are 4 generic 'builder' tiles (edge, corner, entrance and plain) that will allow you to make custom rooms.

Rooms included:

Altar/temple/shrine
Tombs
Monster Lair
Magic Summoning Circle
Prison Cells
Treasure Room
Throne Room
Sacrificial Pit
Puzzle Room
Large room
Well Room




Also included:
A set of 300dpi full size png files, for poster printing or VTT.

192110.name: Tachyon Project
192110.description:
In Tachyon Project you take control of Ada, a software program that has taken conscience and that was designed to hack into the most secure servers on Earth. After some rather misterious events, Ada is thrown out of the test server where it was living and out into the Internet, but when she tries to go back there she finds she's unable to. She'll then start a journey to uncover the truth behind what happened to her creators, which she considers her parents. In the process she'll find out that things were a bit more complex than she initially thought.

Tachyon Project is a dual stick shooter where we've taken concepts from the classic shoot'em up genre and tried to adapt them to the dual stick shooter genre. In Tachyon Project the player will find the gameplay versatility and speed traditional to dual stick shooters but with the variability in weapons and enemies that you usually find in shoot'em ups. The variety of weapons, secondary weapons and perks allow for hundreds of combinations for your ship. That, along with the number of different enemy types provides a lot of gameplay variety that is something quite unique in the genre.

Tachyon Project also brings new ideas to the table, presenting a new stealth mode in some levels where you have to pick carefully when to shoot to avoid being discovered too early and keep yourself disguised.

The game provides an interesting story mode where you go unlocking new weapons, secondary weapons and perks as you progress and uncover the story behind Ada's creation. But you can also play on challenges that present you with unending hordes of enemies to try for the best score and compete in leaderboards. You can play these challenges either alone or with friends in up to 4 player local multiplayer co-operative games.

Features:
Story driven dual stick shooter
6 different weapons, 9 secondary weapons and 7 perks provide hundres of possibilities for your ship
Over 30 different enemy types, including 4 bosses
Story mode comprising 10 levels, with hand-drawn cutscenes te tell the story of Ada
3 Challenge levels with support for co-op gameplay
Up to 4 player local multiplayer
And an intense original soundtrack developed to match the style of the game

Source: The Developer Website.

192111.name: Inside My Radio
videogamehonor: 2014 AzPlay Awards Best Music/Sound Nominee
2014 AzPlay Awards Most Original Game Idea Nominee
2016 IGF Awards Excellence In Audio Nominee
192111.description:
Inside My Radio is a rhythm-action platformer adventure
where your every move needs to be right on the beat.

You journey as a green LED mysteriously trapped inside a dying boombox.
Your mission: bring electro, dub and disco music back to life!

Are you up to the rhythmic challenge of Inside My Radio?

Challenging rhythmic gameplay. Rhythmic awareness is vital when you jump, dash or slam. You have to hit that beat!
In a world where music is your best ally, never under any circumstances should you play on mute.

Play with the music,
Unleash your inner musician!
Experience the song by composing the track:
YOU are in control.
Play different musical styles
Picture the game as a mixtape where every level is a different track. Each world has its own musical style, whether it’s electro, disco or dub, and every new level brings different variations to each style.

Source: The Developer Website.

192112.name: Oblivion's Edge
192112.description:
From publisher blurb:

An adventure for master characters

Members of the Esoteric Order of Kyth need capable individuals to transport a relic sacred to their order, the Puzzle Box of Saint Barbatross, along Umbra’s Path to Oblivion’s Edge, an ancient monastery standing on the edge of reality. The relic plays a key part in completing a decade-long ritual performed to drive back the darkness of the Void from where it intrudes into the mortal world. Adventurers undertaking the expedition face terrible danger as they pick their way across a blighted countryside and contend with the minions of a fragmented demon. If they reach their destination, they have a chance to aid the monks in their efforts to combat the spreading shadow, and if they succeed, they will strike a terrific blow against the doom blighting the world. If they fail, the end of all things will truly begin.

Oblivion’s Edge is an adventure for master characters willing to brave the horrors of a porous and treacherous reality. Although it works well at any point in a group’s master story, it works best as the capstone for your campaign.

192113.name: The Deadly Tower of Monsters
192113.description:
The illustrious space explorer Dick Starspeed has crash landed onto the mysterious planet Gravoria. With his rocket ship out of commission and his trusty companion Robot nowhere to be found, he sets out to explore this new world and its hostile inhabitants.

In the midst of a battle between the good and evil factions of ape men, he meets the stunning Scarlet Nova, heir to the planet's tyrannical Emperor. Unwilling to follow her evil birthright, Scarlet tells Dick of the Emperor's atrocities... and never one to turn down a fight—or to turn down a beautiful blonde—Dick agrees to help overthrow her father's cruel regime!

After a chance reunion with the resourceful Robot, our heroic trio embarks on a fool's errand to topple Gravoria's greatest menace and restore peace to the planet once more. However, in order to accomplish this feat, they will have to ascend... THE DEADLY TOWER OF MONSTERS!

Filmed in the 1970s, The Deadly Tower of Monsters is an action-packed adventure, full of time-honored literary themes: the daughter versus the tyrant father, the planet full of innocent ape-creatures, the dashing space-age liberator, the robot companion, the tower full of treacherous mutations... A timeless classic for all ages!

Despite the film's low budget, director Dan Smith was able to craft an engrossing story about strange alien beings and titan-size monsters (sometimes filming without a script!). It is a thrill ride overflowing with elaborate weaponry, eye-catching special effects, lots of technological noises, and of course: plenty of explosions! For the first time in decades, this tour de force is coming to DVD, so a new generation can experience this sci-fi cult classic. Movie highlights include:

Laugh-a-minute director commentary! – Director Dan Smith lends his decades of industry know-how to deliver side-splitting anecdotes and insights on the film's production. You won't want to miss a single syllable from the genius mind behind this masterpiece!
Got vertigo? Too bad! – Experience the awesome verticality of the tower at every step of the journey, with wide-angle camera shots and impressive aerial stunts. Watch as our heroes fearlessly dive off the tower or glide effortlessly across chasms, all in search of hidden secrets and intergalactic glory!

Over half-a-hundred imaginative monsters! – Squid people, nukular ants, dinosaurs-gone-wild, giant blobs, robo-monkeys, and more are brought to life using state-of-the-art effects, including stop-motion, rotoscope, image compositing, and even some elaborate costumes covered in real fur! You and the family are guaranteed a good ol' time!

Ray guns, crystal swords, and laser whips. Oh, my! – At the heroes' disposal are a wide variety of weapons used to smack!, pow!, and ker-splat! their futuristic foes. Watch as our plucky protagonists collect hidden scrap metal pieces and upgrade their arsenal, right before your very eyes!

Did someone say, "Special powers"!? – I sure hope so, because this film's got 'em! From time-slowing vortexes to speed boots... Wait, what's that on the ground? Is that a bird? No, it's a land mine! These aliens are in for a bang, and so are you!

Source: The Developer Website.

192114.name: No One But You
192114.description:
A Visual Novel/Dating Sim about Hideaki, who has moved from his small village to a much larger town, Okutama. He struggles with everyday life, until he arrives at his new high school.

Hideaki moves to Okutama on his mother’s whim. He never cared much for the old town, mainly because he never remembered much about his childhood, and his everyday life was gloomy and boring.

When he first arrives he meets a sweet girl by the name of Chinatsu at an old bridge which seems to have been abandoned long ago. He quickly becomes friends with her and begins to meet with her from time to time on his way to school. He also meets many others, quickly becoming friends with them all. People like Megumi, the ditsy student council president, and Yui, the smartest girl in the school. To Hideaki, it seems as if his days are becoming more bright and cheerful.

But that feeling is short lived.

He discovers fate, yet wants nothing more than to run from it.

Will you run from fate?

Or will you accept it?

Can you discover the hidden secrets Okutama holds?

Once you discover them, will you bury them once again?

Will you make the right decisions, leading to happiness?

Source: The Publisher Website.

192115.name: Gemini: Heroes Reborn
192115.description:
Using a variety of superpowers such as telekinesis and time travel, Cassandra must battle her way through an enemy-filled underground facility called The Quarry in order to save her abducted friend and solve a family mystery.

A first-person action-adventure PC/console game that brings you deeper into The Heroes Universe
Master special powers such as Telekinesis and Time Shift
Fight your way through multiple levels across three acts
Solve mysteries and connect the story to Heroes Reborn: Enigma and NBC’s Heroes Reborn TV show

Source: The Developer Website.

192116.description:
The Elder Gods greet and invite you to participate in trying to save your wretched existence. The stars are aligning soon and only those who have dared to piece together the clues from the mythos even know what's coming. Do you and your fellow investigators have what it takes to save everything? I think not...

In Cthulhu: A Deck Building Game, you cooperatively work with fellow players (1-6 players) as Investigators to banish the Elder God and his minions by using Moxie (force of character, determination, or nerve) to reduce their health to zero. If you banish the Elder God before he reduces all of the Investigators health to zero you win the game.

There are two phases of the game, a planning and combat phase.

1) In the planning phase, the Investigators activate cards in their hand, research new cards at the Miskatonic University and then ready themselves for final preparation.

2) In the combat phase, the Elder God and his minions attack the Investigators' health and sanity. Investigators may go crazy or die out right, however, they have a chance to fight back. The Investigators use Moxie to push back the waves of the occult and supernatural.

Building your personal library by researching in the Miskatonic University makes you stronger and is your only hope against the Elders. Keep in mind, every bit of resource used to research is a bit not used against the Mythos. It is a balance you must solve to defeat the Elder Gods.
192116.name: Cthulhu: A Deck Building Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: 1P 096 - Agricola ACBS and Cthulhu ADBG

192117.name: SLORP: Secret Lies of Roleplayers
192117.description:
User summary:

The game is presented in three scenes. The game primarily is a narrative exercise but d% are used to randomize an event in the third scene. The game supports a game master and a single player character; additional players would assume supporting roles.

192118.name: Dreadsands
192118.description:
From the introduction:

Hearthe is a planet covered in red sand. Fresh water is extremely scarce and the wells that serve the city are guarded heavily. The city is ruled by a merciless Lich-Queen whose magical powers are unrivaled save by her master. Her agents are everywhere and ruthless when they catch a traitor. Yet there are many willing to give their lives to overthrow her and to bring justice to their people. The situation inside the city is barbaric. No one is trusted, and freedom is just a dream.

Outside the city, the desert is roamed by ravenous creatures of unimaginable cunning and cruelty. The once busy trade routes have fallen silent as the other cities either vanished or were abandoned. Haarduune is cut off and stands alone against the encroaching sands. Every day could be her last. Hope is something only whispered about and never given more than a fleeting thought for fear what little of it is left will shatter into a thousand pieces and be scattered by the scorching desert winds.

User summary:

Dreadsands is a genre-specific implementation of the author's generic, universal G.A.M.E. (Generic Action Mediation Engine) System. However, the Dreadsands manual includes all needed material from The G.A.M.E. System.

192119.name: Cheese Chasers
192119.description:
User Summary:

This is an electronic port of the print and play game "Cheese Chasers". In the game, you are trying to get as many points as you can while trying to avoid the cats. You get points by surrounding the cheese with mice. Your mice get negated by being beside the cats. If you have three active traps at once, you lose the game.

192120.description:
Before these elegant little wooden figures served faithfully in Carcassonne City and many other playful treasures, did you know that the meeples were originally battle vehicles for the four kingdoms of Lilliput? Embody yourself as one of the leaders of those kingdoms and re-enact (in actual size!) those tremendous battles of history. Develop your city, claim new territories, fight for glory, and destroy enemy cities: It’s time for meeple war!

To win Meeple War, gain six victory points by fighting enemy armies, destroying enemy cities, and gaining control of areas. Over the course of the game, you develop your city, build powerful armies, fight and destroy buildings. In this game of timing and strategy, anticipation and diplomatic skill — or perhaps crying — is key to victory.
192120.name: Meeple War
boardgamepodcastepisode: 19. Devon Dice Dreaming to Essen trip 2016, Top 10 wants to Buys

192121.name: Gunman Clive HD Collection
192121.description:
User Summary

Gunman Clive HD Collection is collection of Gunman Clive and Gunman Clive 2 remastered in HD for the Wii U.

192122.name: Bridge Town
192122.description:
From publisher blurb:

This instalment of Urban Dressing presents loads of great features, NPCs and minor encounters to add to the trade towns in your campaign. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Urban Dressing: Bridge Town is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

Urban Dressing: Bridge Town presents:

One table (100 entries) presenting the sights and sounds of a bridge town.
One table (100 entries) presenting sample business found in a bridge town.
One table (100 entries) presenting atypical bridges of interest.
One table (20 entries) presenting hooks, complications and opportunities.

192123.name: I Loot the Body
192123.description:
From publisher blurb:

A System Neutral Edition GM's Resource by Josh Vogt

Adventurers are always looting the bodies of their vanquished foes. Often the GM simply reads off the villain’s equipment list and the players move on. In this situation, beyond armour, weapons, magic items and some coin most foes never seem to carry anything of minor interest. This doesn’t help the GM diligently trying to breathe life and verisimilitude into his campaign.

Enter I Loot the Body. Within, find three tables packed full of trinkets, minor pieces of jewellery and other adornments along with the random things found in a villain’s pouch. Use them to enliven the looting in your campaign today!

192124.name: The Shadowfire Acolyte (Base Class)
192124.description:
From publisher blurb:

Following the darker theme introduced in last issue, Issue #55 provides a new base class, the Shadowfire Acolyte. Not only is this base class covered in detail, but a new type of energy is introduced, shadowfire. An original concept by Randy Price, both the energy and corresponding class were created with a darker and more "evil" bent available for players. Although the Shadowfire Acolyte doesn't have to be evil, it probably helps as the class can be characterized by one of selfish intentions and questionable abilities.

192125.name: Blackbody
192125.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Cosmic horror from BEYOND SPACE… Blackbody!

A Power Level 14 Rogue, Blackbody is a powerful foe of all champions of light. Blackbody is an iconic character in the Beacon City universe, but can be dropped into any campaign with very little alteration.

Blackbody’s file is designated “Black" to indicate that his origins are mysterious and beyond the analysis of modern technology. Chosen by primordial forces of darkness from before the birth of the universe, Blackbody wields cosmic power unlike any other character in the Beacon City setting. He is the Champion of the Eternal Night, and is charged with strange cosmic power known only as Black Plasma. A terror to Power Level 10 characters, he can be a recurring villain to challenge an entire team of heroes, or a more personal Rogue for a cosmic-themed hero who fights on the side of light or life. His ultimate goal is the destruction of all creation, but before he can do that he must defeat all the champions who oppose him. Will your heroes be mighty and brave enough to stand against Blackbody?

192126.name: La Ruperta Fantasma
192126.description: La Ruperta Fantasma ("The Ghost Ruperta") follows the rules of Battleship. There is a grid with lines and columns identified by letters and numbers. The contestants have to choose a spot from the grid. It could contain a "slip", a "sneak pumpkin" or the "Ghost Ruperta". Getting in a "slip" give the contestants a question. If they answer correctly they go on playing, if they fail you loose your turn The "sneak pumpkin" opens all the spots around the sneak. The "Ghost Ruperta" makes the contestants the winners. There is only a single Ghost Ruperta on the whole grid

192128.description:
This map is an unofficial fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop

There is an extra set of Chance cards: some are for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city: others give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules.There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks - colour choice and parallel routes are in the hands of the Gods. Thus there are God cards to help you.

There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: earn double or triple points: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
192128.name: Hawaii (fan expansion of Ticket to Ride)

192129.name: Ten Candles
rpghonor: 2015 Golden Geek RPG of the Year Nominee
192129.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Ten days ago, the sky betrayed you. The world went dark. The sun vanished. Five days ago, They came. And now They're coming for you. Keep moving. Don't lose hope. And stay in the light.

Ten Candles is a tragic horror tabletop roleplaying game based around cooperative storytelling. It is designed for one-shot sessions (rather than ongoing campaigns) and can be played with any number of players and one gamemaster. A game of Ten Candles lasts 2-3 hours. Players take the roles of survivors in the middle of a sunless apocalypse, living out the last few hours of their character's lives. The gamemaster controls Them, the unseen adversaries who stalk just beyond the light's edge. But this isn't a story about monsters. This is a story about what happens in the dark. What happens to those who fight against it, seek hope within it, and inevitably become consumed by it.

192130.name: Huh, what is in the wardrobe?
192130.description:
Somewhere in the world there lives a blue-haired monster who has had enough of scaring people and hearing their teeth chatter every time they see him. That is why we sometimes can't find the cloths we are certain that we put at the right place the day before. Can you remember what you have in your wardrobe? You can find out in this game! A tricky memory game with big and small and cards.

Common goal memory game. A card with several clothes is revealed. After memorizing it the players look at their own cards, and decide if they were represented on the common cards.

192131.description:
Description from the publisher:

Cthulhu Wars: Great Old One Pack Two adds four new Great Old Ones to Cthulhu Wars, and all four are available to each faction on a first come, first served basis. If you awaken Father Dagon first, then no one else has access to her...unless they can kill her and reawaken her for themselves. Each Great Old One has its own special ability, plus its own unique spellbook, which is earned separately from your own.

• Atlach-Nacha has a special ability that allows you to place one web token in the area where it is located, and if you have a complete chain of web tokens across the map, you receive its spellbook and win the game.

• Bokrug doesn't vanish if killed, but instead demands that you place it on an area with no enemy units during the cleanup. The drawback is that one of your opponents removes one of your cultists from the map during cleanup as well. Thankfully, you can pass Bokrug to an opponent, thereby forcing the loss of a cultist onto that player instead of you.

• Father Dagon gives you an action that washes enemy units from the shore into the sea depths, and once you have his spellbook in play, you must sacrifice a cultist each turn in exchange for 6 power.

• Ghatanothoa mummifies enemy cultists, and his spellbook lets you do so even faster.
192131.name: Cthulhu Wars: Great Old One Pack Two

192132.name: The Mystery of a Lost Planet
192132.description:
User Summary
The crew of a marooned spaceship must uncover the secrets of an unknown planet to survive. After a crash landing on the lost planet, you’re left with many unanswered questions. What was the mysterious force that seems to have pulled your ship into the planet and what are its intentions? The journey to answer these questions will be challenging but you cannot give up, because if you fail the crew will never see their home planet again!

Explore beautiful landscapes on your journey - visit the islands that float in the air, underwater worlds and alien jungles. Traverse mysterious caves and damaged spaceships to learn more about this world’s amazing inhabitants.

192133.description: Ninja Camp: Badges and Activities'' is a mini-expansion that contains eight badge cards and twelve activity cards. Badge cards reward players for collecting the most of the associated card, while activities add a little more complexity to Ninja Camp by adding in a new rule for each game.
192133.name: Ninja Camp: Badges and Activities

192134.name: Mia and me ... "Rettet Centopia!"
192134.description:
A co-operative game for 2-4 players.

The players have to work together to help Mia, Mo and Yuko to save the unicorns populating Centopia.

On their turn the player rolls up to 6 dice setting aside all symbols of the evil Panthea and choose one action fom the remaining dice (mainly moving the characters). Next player can roll only the dice not set aside. If all dice are locked another Munculus is added to the board randomly guarding a unicorn. To save a unicorn the players have to match the number of Munculi guarding the unicorn. If there are ever 4 Munculi guarding a unicorn players lose, otherwise they win if all unicorns are saved.

192135.description:
Too Many Bones comes loaded for bear by breaking into a new genre: the dice-builder RPG. This game takes everything you think you know about dice-rolling and turns it on its head. Dripping with strategy, this fantasy-based RPG puts you in the skin of a new race and takes you on an adventure to the northern territories to root out and defeat growing enemy forces and of course the infamous "baddie" responsible.

Team up or go it alone in a 1-4 player Coop or Solo play campaign. With over 100+ unique skill dice and 4-7 classes to choose from, every battle is its own mini challenge to figure out. Your adventure will consist of 8-12 battles before you reach your final destination and face off against one of a number of possible kingpins in order to win. Along the way, you will be faced with storyline decisions that will quickly have you weighing risk/reward, odds, and logic - with dice woven into every aspect! Your party will also be faced with other decisions: when to rest, when to explore, or even which fights to pursue! The Encounter cards offer fun plot twists and some comic relief, all while setting the stage for your next battle.
192135.name: Too Many Bones
boardgamepodcastepisode: 1P 098 - Thunderbolt Apache Leader
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 65!!!

192136.name: Curse of Strahd
rpgissuearticle: Tricks of the Game Trade - Tip 1
192136.description:
Publisher blurb:

Under raging storm clouds, the vampire Count Strahd von Zarovich stands silhouetted against the ancient walls of Castle Ravenloft. Rumbling thunder pounds the castle spires. The wind’s howling increases as he turns his gaze down toward the village of Barovia. Far below, yet not beyond his keen eyesight, a party of adventurers has just entered his domain. Strahd’s face forms the barest hint of a smile as his dark plan unfolds. He knew they were coming, and he knows why they came — all according to his plan. A lightning flash rips through the darkness, but Strahd is gone. Only the howling of the wind fills the midnight air. The master of Castle Ravenloft is having guests for dinner. And you are invited.

A fantasy-horror adventure for characters levels 1 – 10, Curse of Strahd™ provides everything a Dungeon Master needs to create an exciting and memorable play experience.

192137.name: Claptastic Voyage and Ultimate Vault Hunter Upgrade Pack 2
192137.description:
The second DLC campaign, Claptastic Voyage and Ultimate Vault Hunter Upgrade Pack 2, was released on 24 March 2015, coinciding with the release of The Handsome Collection. It features the player characters being sent into the mind of Claptrap by Handsome Jack to retrieve a mysterious piece of software known as the "H-Source", hidden within it by Hyperion's former CEO Harold Tassiter, resulting in the release of Shadowtrap, the digital manifestation of Claptrap's FR4G-TP program. The story also features the CL4P-TP genocide and a deeper look into Claptrap's depression. 2K Australia's creative director Jonathan Pelling cited Fantastic Voyage, Tron, and the holodeck of Star Trek as influences on the campaign, explaining that "We thought the best way to get to know Claptrap a little bit more was to actually go inside his mind and see what he thinks. To get those perspectives, recover those memories, and dig through his dirty laundry." The DLC also raises the character level cap to 70, and feature a customizable challenge arena.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Borderlands%3A_The_Pre-Sequel Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

192138.name: One Page Kill Team
192138.description: One Page Kill Team is a skirmish game designed to be played with just a handful of miniatures. The game features dynamic mechanics which allow you to jump onto your foes from ledges or kick them into deadly terrain, making for an action packed skirmish.

192139.name: One Page Fantasy
192139.description: One Page Fantasy is a strategy battle game designed to be played with WHFB miniatures. The game offers simple mechanics based around alternating phases, allowing you to play highly tactical games of regimental warfare.

192140.name: One Page Skirmish
192140.description: One Page Skirmish is a single-paged ruleset designed to be played with just a handful of miniatures. With simple combat mechanics and a dynamic campaign, the game serves as a great way to explore the world of Warhammer Fantasy.

192141.name: Hammer Wars
192141.description: Hammer Wars is a small-scale miniatures wargame inspired by RTS video games. In an alternate universe where battleships from the 41st millennium have crashed on the warhammer world, get ready to fight where fantasy meets sci-fi.

192142.name: Army Men Combat
192142.description: Army Men Combat is a fast and simple ruleset designed for the nostalgic among us, perfect as an introduction to wargaming for young ones. Dust off your old army men, improvise some terrain, and get ready to fight with toy soldiers like you never have before.

192144.name: National Zombie Park
192144.description:
User Summary

You start in a fenced compound with a baseball bat and some zombies. You pick up weapons and kill zombies but can become infected so that you need to find syringes too. The world is procedurally generated and detail like weather and night-time give it more of a rogue-like serendipity.

192145.name: Feats of Envy
192145.description:
From publisher blurb:

This installment of the More Feats! product line introduces a new kind of feat: the sin feat. Sin feats are designed to represent a character’s vices and moral failings, though they are by no means restricted to evil or non-good characters. Though a few sin feats are supernatural in nature, and some even grant bonuses of the profane type, characters of any faith or alignment may wrestle with sinful vices – grappling with and overcoming such a moral complication often serves to highlight a character’s heroism.

Feats of Envy includes twelve new feats for envious sinners: Acquisitive, Arcane Jealousy, Conniving Companion, Covetous Counterspell, Curse of Cupidity, Deny the Gods, Embittering Aura, Envious Spell, Jealous Heart, Perilously Paranoid, Steal the Limelight, and Wicked Wish..

192146.name: After Zombies: Siege at West Lake Middle School
192146.description:
From publisher blurb:

A radio. You’re not sure why you turn it on, but you’ve turned it on a time or two over the last few days, hoping to hear something other than static and the occasional automated emergency broadcast. Suddenly, you hear something strong. Something close.

Little girl: “H- hello? Is anyone there? Is this thing even on?”

Little boy: “I told you it’s on already! It’s just that no one’s listening. No one’s there at all!”

Little girl: “Shut up! Don’t say that! You can’t… just shut up!”

“Listen, if anyone’s out there, you have to be out there. We need you to come save us, please. Come save us.”

Little boy: “Where we are. You have to tell them where we are dumbass.”

Little girl: “Shut up! I was getting to that! We’re at West Lake Middle School. There’s a lot of zombies outside. And some inside too. Um, the teachers and some of us, when they get sick we lock them in the… we lock them in… I can’t do this.”

Sounds of multiple kids crying in the background.

Little boy: “You’re freaking the kids out. Go calm them down. Listen, I don’t know what to say. I am probably talking to myself anyway. I guess… oh, God please, let someone be hearing this. let them answer. This is so dumb.”

Adult female voice, very weak: “It’s ok, Lucas, go take care of the kids. Listen… *cough, cough* if you’re out there, I have it. You know what I mean, and you will not get it without me. So buck up, soldiers.”

And with that, the battery on your handheld radio goes dead.

192147.name: Tephra: The Narrator's Accomplice
192147.description:
From publisher blurb:

If you enjoy playing in a steampunk world, then you're going to love this. Tephra: the Narrator's Accomplice is the GM's ultimate tool for creating a mind-blowing steampunk adventure. Traps, monsters, hazards, terrain, relics, and more will keep your saga fresh for years.

This is what's in it:

Terrifying Monsters: 137 monsters and automatons, aliens and animals, and all other sorts of new and horrifying abominations to challenge your players!
Make Better NPCs Faster: A complete NPC generator, including 24 sample NPCs, and numerous tools to help create memorable NPCs
New to Narrating? This book is full of fantastic advice on running a saga, inspiring players, building adventures, and much more
New Ways to Torture Your Players: New status effects, weather, terrain, diseases, drugs and other hazards to keep things interesting
Watch your step! We've got traps from a wide range of technological levels to trip up your unwary adventurers
Fantastic Rewards: Over 100 new stories to reward your adventurers, 22 unique artifacts, blueprints, loot, and more!

192148.name: Quick Response Marine Base
192148.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible space station. The station introduced in this installment of the series is a moderatly sized base of operations for a company of marines.

The PDF contains the background of the station, statistics for it and its crew. In addition the document contains an image depicting the station. This PDF contains NO deckplan!

192150.name: Mythic Magic Items
192150.description:
From publisher blurb:

BEING MYTHIC IS AWESOME!

However, mythic characters need mythic magic items to keep up with them. In association with d20PFSRD and Rogue Genius games, the Four Horsemen have you covered! From legendary items such as the sorrow-loving obsidian longsword Hirasthe ("the presence of evil") and the tower shield known only as the Mighty Parapet, to magic items ready to be enhanced with a character's mythic power such as the Brush Blade, Cascading Cloak,Mortifying Mask, and Sundering Shield, this product offers 19 items ready for the GM to say "Make some Mythic Characters!"

192151.name: Arcanist Exploits
192151.description:
From publisher blurb:

Behold the Power of the Arcane!

The arcanist is a new hybrid class, combining elements of the two ultimate arcane spellcasters: sorcerer and wizard. Arcanists may be court advisors, cunning enchanters, fiery combat mages, or delvers in secrets mortals were not meant to know.

Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Advanced Class Guide provides some options for specializing arcanists through exploits and archetypes, but space restrictions preclude delving into all the possible ways a slayer might be customized to match character tropes and player ideas.

To help with that reduced support, Advanced Options: Arcanist Exploits offers new exploits appropriate to any arcanist and five arcanist archetypes (the dagger-wielding bloodletter, construct-focused galvanist, monster-emulating thiriomancer, item-focused wandmaster, and abjuring ward weaver) each with its own set of additional exploits appropriate to the archetype's theme!

Magic is power. Exploit it!

192152.name: Challengers
192152.description:
From publisher blurb:

Family First!

The Challengers aren’t just a tight-knit group of heroes with a shared history, they’re also a family. Though Byron Stern (Brute), Amber Gale (Ember), Savannah Gale (Veil), and Richard "Dick" Hughes (Expansion Man) didn’t intend to become heroes, they took to the roles thrust upon them with passion and dedication. From their debut protecting New York City from an invasion by Atlantis to thwarting alien invasions, discovering long-lost civilizations, making peace with interstellar sun-eaters, and even curing the common cold, the Challengers soon became known as one of the premiere go-to teams for facing any threat.

Iconic Legends. Because sometimes you a need a character everyone knows, even if they're meeting them for the first time.

boardgamehonor: 2016 Golden Geek Best Cooperative Game Nominee
192153.description:
Beings of ancient evil, known as Old Ones, are threatening to break out of their cosmic prison and awake into the world. Everything you know and love could be destroyed by chaos and madness. Can you and your fellow investigators manage to find and seal every portal in time? Hurry before you lose yourself to insanity.

In Pandemic: Reign of Cthulhu, you'll experience the classic Pandemic gameplay with an horrific twist that'll have you face twelve Old Ones, each threatening the world with their unique powers. As players take on the roles of investigators attempting to seal a series of portals before monsters of unspeakable horror pour into our world there is, of course, a high risk of the investigators losing their own minds.

Instead of curing diseases like in the original Pandemic, players seal portals and shut down cults in the classic New England fictional towns of Arkham, Dunwich, Innsmouth, and Kingsport. Can you and your fellow investigators manage to find and seal every portal in time? Hurry before you lose yourself to insanity and the evil that lurks beneath your feet...
192153.name: Pandemic: Reign of Cthulhu
boardgamepodcastepisode: #24: The HYPE Episode! Gen Con 2016 Preview; Rocky Road a la Mode preview; Among the Stars on tap
1P 110 - Far Space Foundry
39: Boardgame Cthulhu
Boards Alive Monster Mash-Up - Episode 7
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 028 – 10 Games for Essen
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 035 – Top 25 of 2016
DJ128: Pandemic El Reino de Cthulhu (2016) Chuck D. Yager + Matt Leacock
Ep 046 – Spookiness abounds with The Bloody Inn
Episode 26 - Happy Birthday Ding & Dent!!
Episode 31: The Networks Review + Gencon 2016 Preview
Episode 42 :: Board Game of the Year 2016 - Brawling Brothers Awards
Pandemic: Reign of Cthulhu Review
RDTN Episode 104: Mansions of Madness, Pandemic: Reign of Cthulhu, Qwixx, Karibou Camp and Rant
RDTN Episode 85: Golden Years – Chit Chat, Pandemic Cthulhu, Seafall, Portal Announcements, and Other Stuff
RJ61: Especial Dau Barcelona 2016
The Game Pit Podcast - Episode 57: The Fury of Dracula 3rd Edition and more…
The Good The Board and The Gettin’ Capped: Episode 85 “Interview with Clay of Capstone Games”
The Good The Board and The Man Who Hates All Of It: Episode 96 “Joe’s Top 10 of 2016″
The Polyhedron Collider Cast Episode 4
The Polyhedron Collider Cast Episode 9
Vox Republica 112: Veni, Vedi, Vici

192154.name: DK: Jungle Climber
192154.description:
Spin, Swing, and Fling Yourself into Adventure!

King K. Rool is up to no good again, and it’s up to Donkey Kong to swing into action. Using the same simple control scheme that made the DK: King of Swing Game Boy Advance SP game so accessible and fun to play, players of all skill levels can swing and climb to new heights made possible by the dual screens of Nintendo DS.

King K. Rool is up to no good again, and it's up to Donkey Kong to swing into action. Using the same simple control scheme that made the DK: King of Swing Game Boy Advance SP game so accessible and fun to play, players of all skill levels can swing and climb to new heights made possible by the dual screens of Nintendo DS.

Not only does Adventure mode feature Diddy Kong as a sub-character, but players can look forward to new moves, new items and a bunch of mini-games sure to make them go bananas. Not only that, but fun tutorials that ease new players into the game also can be accessed as mini-game challenges.

If players are more in the mood to rumble, they can take on up to three pals in fun multiplayer challenges using DS Download Play and the DS Local Area Network. They can pick from Donkey Kong, Diddy Kong, Dixie Kong or Funky Kong, and let the monkey business begin.

Source: The Publisher Website.

192156.name: Kill The Plumber
192156.description:
Think of the first time you grabbed a controller and played as a character who rampaged through a world, killing everything in sight. Have you ever stopped to think how those little guys felt? Well worry you not...we have the antidote!

The Basics - Kill The plumber is a parody to other platformers. Your goal is to stop the 'protagonist' from winning each level. You start off as a slow minion who can't even jump, but has enough power to kill the hero. As you get the hang of it, you start playing as other enemies that can jump, shoot, stomp and even fly, sometimes controlling more than one character at a time!

The Story - It was a peaceful day in the kingdom, when all of a sudden a Mexican plumber decided to rampage and cause destruction. No matter what the critters through at him, he kept coming back, and even tried to kidnap their princess.

Source: The Game Website.

192157.name: World War II GI
192157.description:
WWII GI is the invasion of Normandy. The paranoia. The fear. the intensity that was D-Day. You will experience it first hand.

You’re in the 101st Airborne, part of the first wave of allied forces to touch down in a no-man’s land of twisted shrapnel, dead bodies and heavily armed Nazi-infested machine-gun bunkers. Now you must fight your way through hostile beaches, abandoned country roads with tall, sniper infested hedgerows, the narrow streets of devastated villages and more.

This is D-Day!

Source: The Publisher Website.

192159.name: The Aquatic Adventure of the Last Human
192159.description:
The Aquatic Adventure of the Last Human is an exciting and pessimistic pixelated side-scrolling underwater action adventure about exploring the decaying ruins of our species and fighting deadly sea-creatures in search of answers. With hopeless violence as a defining human trait alongside optimistic curiosity, how far will this adventure take you? The focus lays in exploration! story! and boss battles! You will have to observe the surroundings to make your own connections and conclusions which will help you better understand what happened to Humanity and how the Earth lost us. As you encounter and defeat sea-creatures new paths will be unlocked to grant you further access into unexplored waters. It will be up to you to determine if the ruins of our species is a travesty or an inevitable conclusion.

Source: The Developer Website.

192160.name: Garbage Day
192160.description:
The game takes place in a regular suburban town, powered by a nuclear plant, but after an accident in the power plant you get stuck in a temporal loop.

Your main goal is to find a way to break the time loop by exploring the world and to find out the secret behind all of this. If you die, you just wake up in your bed and the day starts again, so the world is your oyster.
When you wake up you still know the information from the previous day and this influences the dialogue choices. Be a ruthless killer or become the friendliest neighbor to have ever walked the earth. Nothing matters when you're stuck in the same day for eternity... But maybe there's a way out.

Source: The Game Website.

192161.name: Lazy Jack Visual Aids Game
192161.description:
Lazy Jack Visual Aids Game is a series of picture and question cards that can be used to play a variety of simple educational games. Here's what's included:

1 to 24 Number Game for Beginners: Players match "story cards" with scenes from a story to number cards to try to make the most matches
Speedy Alphabet Game: Players take turns searching their cards for the letters of the alphabet in sequence, passing when then fail to find the next letter. The player who finds Z wins.
Family Word Games: Each player chooses and reads a card, then asks the next player to spell one word on the card. The player to spell the word correctly keeps the card. The player with the most cards wins.
Family Picture Games: In turn, players read the text on one card. The next player must name one character depicted on the card. Another player may challenge by calling out "Lazy Jack" and naming a different character. The correct player wins the card. Most cards wins.
Family Questions and Answer Game: Each player has a stack of picture cards. Players in turn ask a question from a question card. The player who is able to find the answer on a picture card answers and takes the card. Most cards wins.
Party Game No. 1 and Party Game With Props: Players choose "party game" cards and perform a challenge. Other players vote on best performances.
A.E.I.O.U Game: Each player draws a card and must find all five vowels to win the card. Most cards wins.
Name a Person, Place or Thing Game: Player chooses a card and names a color that appears on the card. Other players in turn try to guess which item of the color the player referred to. Correct guesser keeps the card. Most cards wins.
Picture Matching Game: Shuffle 24 each of black and white and color picture cards together. Players take turns drawing a card, trying to match b/w and color cards. Player with the most matches wins.
Family Reading Game: Color story card are dealt to players. Corresponding black/white cards are turned up one at a time. Player with the matching card reads the card's caption. If read correctly, the player claims the card. Other players may challenge and then read the card. Whoever reads the card correctly claims it. Most cards wins.




- Family Change a Word Game: Black/white picture cards are dealt to players. Color cards in turn are turned face-up. The player with the matching card reads the caption, but changes a word to change the meaning of the card. There is no competition involved, so this last "game" is the only one that is not really a game.

192162.name: My Secret Waitress
192162.description:
User summary:

The comic game presents a single scenario, albeit a complex scenario that could be replayed with great variability.

From the introduction:

In My Secret Waitress, the players take on the role of waitresses in the most glamorous, most expensive and most exclusive supper club in the world. In fact, the supper club is so exclusive that it has exactly 535 tables on multiple floors, and each one of those 535 tables is reserved all the time for one person and their guests. Each waitress is assigned to just three of those tables, so the guests can come to rely on the same waitress and her same services. In addition, this supper club has a secret floor high above the rest that has just two tables. Only the best two waitresses and only the most important two people in the world are allowed on that floor.

192163.name: Havets Vargar
192163.description:
From publisher blurb:

"För nordmännens raseri, bevare oss milde Herre Gud!"

800-talets europa darrade av skräck för de vilda nordmännen. Med jämna mellanrum styrde de drakskeppen ut ur hamnarna i norr med sikte på de försvarslösa städerna på kontinenten.

Sedan en tid tillbaka befinner sig rollpersonerna i Kaupang, vikingarnas handelscentrum i södra Norge. Efter många olika turer hamnar äventyrarna i norra Spanien där de deltar i en hämndaktion mot rövarhövdingen Luis Candelas.

Dessförinnan har de inte bara utkämpat en mängd strider mot vilda djur och andra varelser, utan också stött på motstånd från andra vikingar.

Klarar de sig med skinnet i behåll?

Häftet innehåller beskrivningar och kartor över Kaupang, Luis Candelas fäste, slumpmässiga möten och färden till Spanien samt fem nya varelser.

OBS! Detta är inget egentligt spel. Du måste ha tillgång till DRAKAR OCH DEMONER för att kunna ha glädje av äventyret.

192164.description: Do you like duck! duck! GO! but you have younger children that love the ducks? duck! duck! GO! Junior is a 16-card expansion for the beloved rubber-ducky racing game. These cards are an alternative deck for use with younger players. The cards ease players into the game by including numbers instead of hex space symbols. As players become used to the game, they can gradually switch to increasingly complex hex space cards. The duck! duck! GO! Junior deck is a great way to introduce players to your favorite rubber ducky game!
192164.name: duck, duck, Go! Junior

192165.name: Halloween Forever
192165.description:
Something mysterious is happening in the pumpkin patch this Halloween! You control Pumpkin Man, a humanoid pumpkin thing animated by occult forces on a quest to discover why things are so creepy. And you vomit candy corn.

Adventure through three weird, spooky worlds in search of your destiny. Meet chainsaw maniacs, undead sorcerers, spooky bats, and lots of skeletons on your way. Can you survive the horrors that await you within these spooky tombs?
I started work on Halloween Forever in the Summer of 2014 and it's finally complete! It is also my first full game created in Gamemaker. All artwork and animations were created using Photoshop. Halloween Forever supports play using both keyboard and usb gamepad.

Source: The Developer Website.

192166.name: Those Dark Places
192166.description:
From the introduction:

The title Those Dark Places perfectly describes what this game is about. The shadowy corners of space that no one has ever explored – what is there? Is it intelligent? Is it a monster? The deep space stations and outposts that nobody visits – what would happen to a small crew stuck in the back of beyond where even light does not reach? What would that do to your mind? Your sanity?

User summary:

Includes Edward, an introductory scenario.

192167.name: Colony Space
192167.description:
From the introduction:

A campaign setting, with supplemental rules, for Those Dark Places game system.

The current year, according to the oldest known still-in-use dating system, is 2704. Humanity, after nearly eliminating itself several times through war, disease, financial collapse, cultural malaise, environmental devastation, or all of these at once, has spread out to inhabit a volume of the galaxy approximately 10,000 light years across.

192168.name: Star Navy: A Colony Space Source Book
192168.description:
User summary:

This game supplement details the structure and operational processes of the Star Navy, a significant force in the Colony Space campaign setting for Those Dark Places. The supplement also details various ships and equipment.

192169.name: Tech: A Colony Space Source Book
192169.description:
User summary:

This game supplement presents additional weapons, vehicles, armors, and space suits for the game, as well as detailing civilian vehicles and several miscellaneous equipment items.

192170.name: GAME: Generic Action Mediation Engine
192170.description:
The G.A.M.E. System

From the introduction:

The Generic Action Mediation System is basically a blank slate of a system that liberates the players and the characters to act how they choose in feats of heroism and skill. This game is about challenging yourself to top yourself each and every time your character faces a challenging situation. Liberate your dreams, then do them.

192171.name: Sickness
192171.description:
Sickness is a Visual Novel following the life of Suoh, a high school student turned violent criminal.

Following the deaths of his parents, Suoh is left without a home or source of income. All he has is his twin sister, Sara, who he promises to provide for, even if doing so means throwing his life away.

Using the entirety of their savings, the two move to another city, wherein Suoh quickly finds work. Sara commutes to her old school, Suoh works long, physically-demanding hours, and the two survive off instant food, barely scraping by. It isn’t a happy life, but they make it work.

Or at least they did, until a violent outburst set into motion a rapid descent.

Amid a physical altercation with his boss, Suoh blacks out, waking up to find a corpse laying at his feet. His knuckles bloody, his muscles aching, he realizes that he has just murdered his boss, the person responsible for his continued well-being. But rather than lament the loss of life, all Suoh can think of is how badly he needed the money, and what he’ll do next to get it.

Drawn by the scent of blood, one of Suoh’s coworkers, a young man with criminal connections, offers him a not so legal revenue stream, one encouraging violent behavior and rewarding the capable.

And from there, everything spirals out of control.

As it turns out, Suoh has a knack for crime, and the petty reservations he had about such acts don’t last long. For the well-being of his sister, as well as his own self-interest, he becomes a killer for hire, taking out people anybody his new boss tells him to. He quickly adapts to life as a killer, adopting a double life his sister can never know about.

But his new life is not without trouble. Facing death on a weekly basis is only the beginning; between avoiding police detection, eyewitnesses, and even the malice of his fellow professional killers, Suoh’s new life looks to be the death of him.

Will Suoh manage to survive long enough to keep his promise to his sister? Will he turn tail and escape from this life of crime, finding solace in the company of someone or something else? Or will he be hunted down and killed before he ever gets the chance?

Source: The Publisher Website.

192172.name: Energy Cycle
192172.description:
User Summary

Energy Cycle is a puzzle game. There are a number of symbols representing energy laid out. These are in horizontal and vertical lines, though some spaces will be empty. When you click on an energy it changes the color of the other energies that are adjacent to it, horizontally and vertically. Your goal is to get all the energies to be the same color.

192173.name: Drop Kick
192173.description:
User summary:

Character creation is quite simple, involving a single d% roll for strength (re-roll if less than 60). The remaining traits are narrative tags determined by player fiat. The game is very simple and consists of extensive charts that are used to determine the outcomes of various moves.

192174.name: Drop Kick Character Record Sheet
192174.description:
User summary:

Although the Drop Kick core rules manual includes a character record sheet, it also is made available as a separate JPG download. The record sheet is fairly simple and several will fit on a standard page.

192175.name: Dungeon Crawl: Risus
192175.description:
From the introduction:

Dungeon Crawl: Risus uses the simple, easy-for-everyone Risus: The Anything RPG rules and folds in the expected elements of the classic fantasy setting. It's not the first take on fantasy in Risus, but it is the most complete. It eliminates the vague parts of Risus and the superfluous details of most fantasy RPGs and makes a smooth, easy to run game. These rules assume you know how tabletop role playing games work, and are at least familiar with the basic fantasy clichés.

192176.name: The Empire of the Jade Fist
rpg: The Empire of the Jade Fist
192176.description:
User summary:

The Empire of the Jade Fist focuses on characters' martial arts abilities. Characters have Attributes and traits, but the defining characteristic is their Style, which is somewhat analogous to Class in other RPGs: once selected, it does not change, and it gives access to various abilities not otherwise available. The game document enumerates several Styles. It also includes an introductory scenario and a character sheet.

192177.name: Hunter Rose
192177.description:
User summary:

Characters in Hunter Rose primarily are represented by their Attributes (Prowess, Destiny, Love, Body, and Thirst); Attributes have a numeric Value as well as a few narrative tags. In the game, all characters are Huntsmen, or village protectors. The manual is fairly evenly divided between rules and setting.

192178.name: Mind Game: Basic System Rules
192178.description:
User summary:

Mind Game: Basic System Rules presents the core rules; the author intended to publish further rule elaboration. The game is played on a grid using colored tokens. Characters have a Class defined and gain Levels during play. Though the game claims to be highly innovative in concept, generally it presents fairly traditional mechanics.

192179.name: Way of the Samurai (Solitaire)
192179.description:
User summary:

Characters in Way of the Samurai have Attributes and Skills that provide modifiers in some circumstances. Various tests are presented during solitaire play, some fairly traditional but others very atypical and imaginative. Overall play is quite unusual for a solo RPG.

Note although the manual is 40 pages (PDF), the rules appear on the first 14 pages, a character sheet appears on 2 pages, and the remaining 24 pages are blank to enable a record of play.

192180.description:
English:
Set with Catan marked Dice cup with lid and 2 sets of wooden Catan pieces.
A pink and Yellow set. 2x (City x 4, Town x 5, Street x15)

Nederlands:
Set bestaande uit een Catan dobbelbeker met deksel en 2 uitbreidingssetjes van houten figuren voor het catan basis-spel.
Licht roze en gele set. 2x(Stad x 4, Dorp x 5, Straat x 15)
192180.name: De Kolonisten Van Catan: Dobbelbeker

192181.name: Balancing Dolphin
192181.description:
1 blue dolphin
18 coloured rings (small,medium and large in red, orange, yellow, blue, green and purple)
* The small rings are able to be placed inside the large rings
1 coloured dice

The dolphin is placed on the table with it's back facing down, like a see-saw. The 18 rings lie next to it. Players take turns to roll the dice and place a ring of the required colour on the dolphin's tummy. The player that makes rings fall off the dolphin must drop our. The remaining players then continue to play without the eliminated player and the fallen rings become part of the game again.

192182.name: Balancing Frog
192182.description:
1 frog
6 yellow and 12 green tokens
1 dice with symbols

The object of the game is to place the balls on the frog without the animal tipping over or one of the balls falling off.
Rolling the dice determines the symbol which is to be placed on the frog. A player that causes a ball to fall during their turn is out of the match. The winner is the player who put the last and the most difficult token on the frog without knocking it over.

192183.name: Balancing Cat
192183.description:
1 Cat
18 Balls of thread
4 reels of thread
1 coloured dice

The object of the game is to place the brightly-coloured balls or blocks on the cat without the animal tipping over or one of the balls falling off.
Rolling the dice determines the colour ball which is to be placed on the cat. Each player takes turns throwing the dice, moving in a clockwise direction.
A player that causes a ball to fall during their turn is out of the game. The winner is the player who places the last ball of thread on top of the pile without causing anything to dislodge and fall or who is the last player to remain in the game.

192184.name: Balancing Ark
192184.description:
1 Ark
12 animals (in 6 pairs)
1 dice with symbols

The object of the game is to place the animals on the Ark without the boat tipping over or one of the animals falling off.
A dice with symbols is rolled to determine which animal should be placed on the Ark.
If a player causes pieces to fall off the boat, then the player is out of the match.
The winner is the player who puts the last piece on the Ark without knocking it over

192185.name: Matryoshka
192185.description:
Some rare Matryoshkas composed of seven dolls each were spread during the years and ended up distributed randomly among some antique collectors. These collectors arranged a meeting to exchange dolls and try to reassemble the rare Matryoshkas. Obviously each collector wants to leave this meeting with the most valuable collection. But who will succeed?

Matryoshka is played in four rounds. In each round, each player shows a Matryoshka from his hand and all other players make a hidden trade offer. After checking all offers, the player trades his card with another player.

At the end of each round, players must show a part of their collection by placing Matroyshkas on front of them. That way other players know what they're looking for. The player with the most valuable collection at the end of the game wins.

192186.description: Thaw of the Lich Lord is a complete campaign for Frostgrave that will challenge both new and veteran players. Through a series of linked scenarios, players discover the existence of a new power in the Frozen City, one who was old when the great city was still young, and who saw both its rise and its disastrous fall. Warbands will confront the Lich Lord's minions, race against his agents to seize possession of mysterious artefacts, and brave the perils of Frostgrave in search of his lair. Eventually, they will need to muster all their courage to venture into the depths of the city and face the Lich Lord himself. Not all wizards will seek to stop the Lich Lord, however, and full rules for giving into his corruption and following the dark road to becoming an undead lich are presented for those who crave power and immortality above all else. While the campaign presents many new threats against which wizards and their warbands must test themselves, including an expanded bestiary, it also offers additional resources, such as new henchmen that can be recruited and unique magical treasures that can spell the difference between survival and oblivion.
192186.name: Frostgrave: Thaw of the Lich Lord

192187.description: With this new supplement for Frostgrave, players lead their warbands into the vast network of catacombs, sewers, and dungeons that run beneath the Frozen City. It was in these dark confines that ancient wizards experimented on living creatures, creating strange hybrids and deadly monsters, many of which still roam the forgotten passageways. Along with a host of new scenarios, treasures, spells, and creatures, the book also contains rules for running games of Frostgrave set in dungeons, including traps and secret passages. With the wonderful and rare magical treasures to be discovered, will players risk taking their warbands down into the Breeding Pits?
192187.name: Frostgrave: Into the Breeding Pits

192188.name: Apocalypse In Your Hometown
192188.description:
From publisher blurb:

Stay Alive!: Apocalypse In Your Hometown

The end is nigh in Cleveland, Ohio. Molly Hatchet still hasn't made it into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame. England has been thrust into a new dark age as survivors in Leeds confront terrors that were previously thought to be only legends. Hippie, hipster and horror: who dwells on the Venice Beach Boardwalk after the twin tidal waves of gentrification and elder sorcery? A new pandemic races across the globe and a vaccine has been rushed to market to ease public concern, but can survivors in Toledo, Ohio deal with a new problem that has developed? And on the other side of the world in Auckland, New Zealand, global problems and catastrophes are inflicting massive changes to the world that we know.

Apocalypse In Your Hometown is a collection of GM scenarios designed for use with the Stay Alive! modern rules variant for Tunnels & Trolls, a trademark of Flying Buffalo Inc., created by Ken St. Andre, and used with kind permission. A copy of the Stay Alive! Lite Edition rules is included.

"The Sickening Green Day" by Tom K. Loney
"Catacombs of the Black Coven" by Scott Malthouse
"Venice Boardwalk" by David Moskowitz
"Apocalypse Kinda Now" by Jerry Teleha
"Utu" by Mark Thornton

192189.name: Icar Fleet Setting
192189.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are a proud member of Recon Squad 2 of Trooper Unit 555 operating from the Star Clipper Orion’s Scabbard. Your job is to protect the human race from the onslaught of the Droids. In this setting you will start with the odds against you and use ingenuity, technology and firepower to fight your way back to rejoin the Fleet.

You will make difficult choices, bring down orbital bombardments, direct Stub Wing strafing runs, commandeer civilian resources, fight pirates, drag crippled spacecraft into life, detonate planets, cajole civilian spacecraft Captains, battle Droids and the scum of humanity.

This is a source book for Icar, the free Sci Fi RPG. Includes maps, player handouts, and plenty of Gamesmaster hooks to build your campaign on. Includes a printer friendly version with white background.

192190.name: Sunken Treasures
192190.description:
From publisher blurb:

Our fifth entry in the 10+ Treasures line features 28 aquatic magic items, including a gun that shoots never-ending blasts of water, suddenly expansive armor (mind the pointy bits), a ring that will keep you alive if you're lost at sea (though you probably won't enjoy the experience), a potion that lets you breathe water (and only water), a cloak made of tentacles, and a legendary submersible (including stats for using it with A Sundered World's more in-depth ship rules).

There's also extensive notes on how we go about creating magic items (which we've included with all of our 10+ Treasures collections).

192191.name: The Chaos Gods Come to Meatlandia
192191.description:
From publisher blurb:

If you always wanted to play a Bard but hate that they've been weak for so long, this book is for you. Compatible with all OSR systems, the world of Meatlandia is bloody and horrific and just a little silly. It resembles Stuart Gordon's Reanimator more than H.P. Lovecraft's.

Materials include:

1 New City: Meatlandia, which is ruled by the Meat Lord and his juicy meat magic. The city seethes with intrigue as the stalwart Rust Lord and his warriors, the hidden assassins of Death's Hand, and the all too friendly cultists of Our Lady of Sorrows all vie for control of Meatlandia. None of them are truly prepared for the great worms that swim up from the bowels of the earth.

5 New Classes: Meet the disgusting Carnomancer, the fourth wall breaking Chaos DJ, the charming Raconteur, the spider-headed Kaldane, and the reality altering Nexus Bard.

42 New Spells: Carnomancers use buckets of blood and metric shittons of meat and as they grow in power they risk transformation into hideous worms themselves.

Also included are new monsters, nutritional supplements, magical meat items, hidden catacombs, lots of maps, and five game seeds to get you started playing right away.

The mechanics in this book are unbalanced, ridiculous, and overpowered. Enjoy.

192192.name: Tomb of Follies
192192.description:
From publisher blurb:

Take the mayhem and whimsy of Costume Fairy Adventures into the dungeon in search of cake, treasure and the secret to the greatest prank of all time. Outwit the traps, befuddle the monsters and face down dastardly villains in a labyrinth conjured from wishes run out of control!

Tomb of Follies brings old-school dungeon crawling to the table with a distinctly fairy flavour. Whether you're a first-time kobold-worrier or a dragon-bothering veteran, this Playset will give you everything you need to send your fairies delving into a world of underground peril, all in the name of the mighty Mischief Coin.

This digital product includes:

The Tomb of Follies Playset PDF, in both singles (one-up) and spreads (two-up) formats
A 72-card print-and-play Encounter Deck PDF
A print-and-play token sheet PDF (for inventory tracking in face-to-face games)

192193.name: O Gangster de Retrocity
192193.description:
During the Depression, the streets of Retrocity were controlled by the iron hand of Don Picolotto ... But he died. Now, four families are fighting each other to control the organized crime in the city.

O Gângster de Retrocity is a competitive game for 2-4 players where each one assumes the role of a mafia boss that seeks to dominate the crime of Retrocity.

Only one player can become the big boss and to achieve this goal, each player must create a strategy by joining board movement, card's special effect and attacks on their rivals.

The game uses modular boards, which allows the city to have a different setting every new play.

The deck of 60 cards is divided in three types: Action, Equipment and Building. All cards have a special effect and Action and Equipment cards can be used in combat against a rival.

The length of a game is 30 to 60 minutes and as players become accustomed to the rules, the game becomes increasingly wild!

192194.name: The Big Pie Caper
192194.description:
From publisher blurb:

Come to the village pie festival! Eat a hundred times your weight! Teach three very foolish humans the dangers of asking fairies for help in romance!

The Big Pie Caper is a Costume Fairy Adventures Playset for 3 to 6 fairies, featuring a target-rich environment for mischief and light-hearted chaos. Enter (or subvert!) the famous pie-eating competition, evade the wrath of the Sheriff, and make the overworked baker's special day uniquely magical.

With a flexible core scenario supplemented with buckets of random whimsy, from sinister gnomes and strategic sheep to the one and only Random Pie Generator, The Big Pie Caper is suitable for new and experienced gamers alike.

This digital product includes:

The Big Pie Caper Playset PDF, in both singles (one-up) and spreads (two-up) formats
A print-and-play Shenanigan Card PDF, containing all of the core and optional quests for ease of reference

192195.name: Arena: Sangue & Glória
192195.description:
Arena: Blood &Glory is a competitive game for 2 players where each player, who roleplays a Gladiator, seeks to win his opponent to achieve fame and recognition or perhaps freedom!

The game uses a deck of 54 cards (divided into Combat, Events and Equipment cards), a board, two tokens and seven damage markers.

To win, the player need to cause 4 damage in the opponent. For his, the player uses board movement and cards management (the cards can be used to attack, defense and special effects).



Arena: Sangue & Glória é um jogo competitivo entre 2 jogadores onde, cada jogador interpretando um Gladiador, busca vencer o seu oponente para alcançar fama e reconhecimento ou, quem sabe, liberdade!

O jogo utiliza um baralho de 54 cartas (dividido em cartas de combate, eventos e equipamento), um tabuleiro, dois peões e sete marcadores de dano.

O objetivo é causar 4 de dano no oponente e para isso o jogador usa movimento em tabuleiro com uso de cartas (que servem para ataque, defesa e efeitos especiais).

192196.description:
LONG DESCRIPTION

Everything or almost everything is possible in this game, based on the theme of World History figures from 13 important areas: governors, the military, astronomers, philosophers, scientists, explorers, mathematicians, pioneers, writers, painters, musicians, Nobel Prizes and Human Rights.

HOW TO PLAY
- EUREKA (GAME 1)

OBJECTIVE
It is played by two teams of two players. The aim of the game is to gather 4 people from one of the 13 sets: the military, astronomers, etc…
When the player gathers the 4 cards they secretly signal their partner who then says EUREKA.

Moving forward...

1. At the beginning of each round, turn 4 cards over (from the deck) on the table.
2. All together, players count up to 3.
3. After finishing the count, each player can switch the cards held in the hand with the ones on the table (he/she can switch as many cards as desired).
4. A round ends when players do not wish to exchange more cards.
5. The 4 cards on the table from the previous round are discarded. Turn 4 new cards over from the deck and repeat the procedures from step 2 forward.

- FAMILY GAME (GAME 2)

OBJECTIVE
Gather as many Families as possible. Each Family is composed of 4 characters. Each character is associated to a colour: green, red, yellow and blue.

Moving on…

Step 1

The first player asks another player for a card of his/ her choice. This request must respect the following rules:

the player already has a card of this Family;
the player must always say: first, the name of the Family to which the card belongs; then, the colour associated with the desired character: green, red, yellow or blue.




Step 2

One of the following options occurs:


if the player succeeds in getting the asked card: then, he/ she asks a player for a new card;
if the player cannot get the asked card: he/ she picks up a playing card from the deck placed on the centre of the table and stops playing. It is the next player’s turn.
192196.name: People with Memory

192197.name: Costume Fairy Adventures Core Rulebook
192197.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Costume Fairy Adventures, a game about fairies. In costumes. Having adventures.

(Fairies are not good at creative titles.)

From enchanted forests to star-faring spaceships, and even to your own backyard, fairies can be found just about anywhere – and where fairies go, shenanigans are sure to follow! Drawing magic from the power of mischief, fairies can turn the world upside-down with whimsical wishes and preternatural pranks – and when their usual tricks aren't enough, new talents are only a change of clothes away.

Costume Fairy Adventures is an improvisational roleplaying game for 2 to 7 players. Gather your friends and a handful of six-sided dice and take on the role of a fairy of your very own. With lightning-fast character creation, over 100 ready-to-wear costumes courtesy of the Core Costume Deck, and a whole passel of pregenerated pranking patsies – including fuddled philosophers, solicitous spiders, and gnefarious gnomish gnecromancers – you'll be ready for mischief in mere minutes.

What are you waiting for? Adventure awaits!

This digital product includes:

The Costume Fairy Adventures Core Rulebook PDF, in both singles (one-up) and spreads (two-up) formats
A 108-card print-and-play Core Costume Deck PDF
A zipfile containing high-resolution images of all 108 cards (for use in online tabletop apps)
A freely distributable Costume Reference Booklet PDF (for use in online games that aren't using a tabletop app)*
Character record sheet PDFs in both printable and form-fillable formats

rpgitemversion: Double Dose Monsters #01: Shark Orc and Burning Guardian PDF
