Monstros em Dose Dupla #01: Orc-Tubarão e Guardião Ardente PDF
192198.name: Double Dose Monsters #01: Shark Orc and Burning Guardian
192198.description:
From publisher blurb:

The folks here at Flying Ape Studios have always been fans of the world’s most famous roleplaying game, especially its older iterations. Fifth edition was a great surprise, since it had elements from past editions and became once again a game that can be played without worrying too much about rules and etc.

Much to our surprise the rules for this edition were released under the Open Game License. We knew we had to come up with some content for it... but we didn’t even have to after all! We had already created some monsters for fun, so all that was left to do was to polish them up. So began Double Dose Monsters!

This will be a regular series in which two new monsters are presented back to back. It is also available in Brazilian Portuguese. In this first volume we present the Shark Orc and the Burning Guardian.

192199.name: Legacy of Doom
192199.description:
From publisher blurb:

A legacy of doom! For centuries, cults dedicated to the World Serpent have worked to pave the way for the Earth's destruction. Years ago, the villainous Steel Snake nearly succeeded in bringing global disaster with his immense strength and ability to manipulate metal. Although he failed, he still managed to claim victory with the killing of the hero, Thunderstrike! He hasn't been seen since and is believed to have fallen to the radiation from his doomsday weapons - or is that something people just tell themselves to help them sleep at night?

But now a new champion of the Serpent has been chosen: Bloodrake! His super speed, might, and ability to recover from most any injury make him a valuable agent of destruction to the Sons of Jormungand cult. Luckily for the world, the vandalistic Bloodrake scoffs at all the cult nonsense and is far from reaching his full potential!

192200.name: Legacy of Thunder
192200.description:
From publisher blurb:

A legacy of thunder! For centuries, the eldest child in each generation of the Torsen family have been gifted with superhuman strength and command over lightning. The most recent recipients of the birthright, though, are twins! Dedicated to living up to their fallen father's example, Rumble uses her great strength and thunderous punches to take down the bad guys. Her brother, Wildstrike, lets loose on villainy with multiple, barely controlled lightning bolts that fill the area.

Also included is Thunderstrike, their father, as he was in his prime from 20 years ago. A famous hero backed by the government, he was a physical powerhouse with mastery of the weather. Still remembered today as the hero who gave his life to stop the doomsday weapons of the Steel Snake!

192201.name: Wiener Walzer
192201.description:
Description from the publisher:

Vienna is a city of fabulous gala nights in which ostentatiously dressed ladies and elegant gentlemen sway in magnificent halls on the dance floors. The guest list is as exclusive as the culinary delights at the buffet. Who would not be happy there?

Wiener Walzer takes you into this glamorous world. Ist ein typisches Knizia Spiel.

192202.name: The Sorcerer
192202.description:
From publisher blurb:

It takes years to learn magic from tomes and tutors. The formulas, the rituals, the spells like recipes waiting for a chef to prepare them.

But you didn't choose to learn magic. It chose you.

Elemental power spills from you like water off a cliff, shrieking into the world in an unfettered torrent. You awaken a familiar with a blink of your eye and erase foes from existence when your temper slips its leash. You don't just cavort with forces of nature. You are one.

Learn to master your new powers quickly, before the world decides you're too dangerous to be left alone.

The Sorcerer is a class playbook for use with the Dungeon World roleplaying game. It is meant to complement the existing class playbooks, while providing an alternative for players who want to try a mage class that doesn't use spellbooks or learn magic by study.

This product includes:

A 2 page ready-to-print class playbook PDF
A 9 page full class PDF in the style of the Dungeon World core book
A 9 page class insights PDF with tips and exploration on what it means to build and play as the sorcerer
Three compendium class PDFs -- the spellslinger, the worldwaker, and the pariah -- formatted in the style of specialties from Johnstone Metzger's Class Warfare supplement

192203.description:
The competition takes place in rounds and each round is divided into 4 parts: sunrise, attack, sunset and night. All players play at the same time during 12 rounds. Use your Power Cards at the most appropriate time so as to win the Battles. Stay clear from the RED BARON, a brilliant acrobat and pilot, who will not hesitate to fire negative points towards you.

The player with the Most Number of points after 12 rounds is the winner.

This game tells the story of the fearless Portuguese hero of the First World War. It is a fun, intelligent game, full of historical curiosities to change family dinners and evening with friends.
192203.name: Millions: The Last Soldier

192204.name: Stark Space
192204.description:
From publisher blurb:

Space is dark. Space is cold. Space is deadly. This isn't a universe of clean cut heroes saving the day or plucky rebels fighting an evil empire. This is a universe of corrupt mega-corporations, uncaring governments, and living for the moment because it could be your last. This is Stark Space.

Stark Space is a humancentric, dystopian supplement. It has an implied setting of a rough and corrupt universe. Stark Space contains three new classes designed for gritty space adventure: The Brains, The Face, and The Muscle. It also contains three new "races".

Max-Gene's: Humans who have been genetically altered to be superior physical specimens at the cost of their minds.
Simulants: Bio-mechanical androids who are so close to being human that there's doubt that aren't.
Psi's: Humans who developed extraordinary mental powers.




Also included are optional combat rules, equipment, and antagonists.

192205.name: Mythic Giants
192205.description:
From publisher blurb:

Giants have been both the allies and enemies of adventurers throughout history. The giants included in this manual are all threats to humanity and other humanoid races. They aren't just enemies, they are villains. The Imperium Gargantum is led by:

Karakanos - The Storm Tyrant - A storm giant magus
Shelana - The Dark - A cloud giant warpriest
Zygar - The Frost Blade - A frost giant barbarian
Calisal - The Desert Storm - A desert giant slayer
Nernuk - The Fist of Stone - A stone giant brawler




Each giant has their own history and motives. Can your adventurers bring peace back to the land?

192206.name: A Necromancer's Almanac: 2015
192206.description:
From publisher blurb:

Animate Your Game Today!

A Necromancer’s Almanac: 2015 is a compilation of all the material produced in 2015 for Necromancers of the Northwest’s popular article lines Best in Class, Obscure Arcana, Magic Market, and Exotic Encounters, plus a few additional extras scattered in. With over 180 pages of gaming content, it’s not hard to believe that this book was a full year in the making.

Somehow, we’ve managed to pack no less than 40 combined archetypes, bloodlines, and spirits, a new base class called the cultist (plus three cults to choose from), over 125 new spells, ranging from 0-level to 9th-level, and providing something for every spell list at every spell level, nearly 120 brand new magic items, plus 20 monsters from CR 1 to 20, six new templates, 10 detailed NPCs each with unique special abilities not found anywhere else, and 5 new player races, all in one single, massive tome of exciting new content for your Pathfinder game. With A Necromancer’s Almanac: 2015, you’ll have all the options to make exactly the character you want.

And what’s more, you don’t have to search through dozens of articles to find it. Everything has been collected, archived, and gathered in an organized fashion. Even better, the digital version boasts not only extensive bookmarking, but also hyperlinked tables and spell lists, allowing you to jump straight to an item, monster, or spell with a single click.

192207.name: Pipe Work
192207.description:
Pipe Work is a simultaneous-play, tile placement game with the tiles actually being pipes that connect colored tokens on your 5x5 playing area.

In each of the eight rounds, players start by revealing a card that shows where the pairs of colored tokens are placed on their individual 5x5 game board. As soon as everyone's done this, all players race simultaneously to place pipes in their game board to create connections between matching tokens. Players grab numbered spanner cards in the order that they finish, and whoever grabs the "1" spanner gets first choice of a scoring card. Incorrect tile layouts net someone the "4" spanner.

After eight rounds, whoever has the most medals wins!

192208.name: City of Rain, City of Darkness
192208.description:
User summary:

This supplement provides a concise generic, universal setting with steampunk overtones, adaptable to any genre. The brevity of the presentation makes this more of a conceptualized setting than a game locale usable "out of the box".

192209.name: Neuroshima Hex! The Pear
192209.description: A single tile promo for Neuroshima Hex given to members of the Shut Up and Sit Down Gold Club. The tiles allows players to send the mighty reference pear into battle on their behalf.

192210.name: Anarchists & Falangists
192210.description:
User summary:

This document presents the core rules of the game, including character creation and campaign setting. Characters have Attributes (Body, Mind, Spirit) and Skills that provide modifiers to a d16 role, which forms the basic action resolution mechanic.

192211.name: Badajoz
192211.description:
User summary:

The characters have recently been involved in the bloody Battle of Badajoz on the side of the defeated Republicans. Stunned by this early, major victory of the Nationalists, the depleted remnants of the Republican forces fall back and regroup. Rumors have been pouring into headquarters that the Nationalists are rounding people up and performing mass executions. The characters are sent to investigate.

192212.description:
Monster Mix consists of two games: "Monster Mix" and "Monster Express", both of which use cards that show monsters and cards that show only the top, middle or bottom of a monster.

In "Monster Mix", players each hold a monster card in hand and take turns adding monster part cards to the table, trying to assemble the parts they need to match the card they hold. If they do, they score 1 point and take a new monster card. Whoever scores 3 points first wins.

In "Monster Express", all of the monster cards are laid face up on the table, and the top, middle and bottom cards are placed nearby as three decks. One card from each deck is revealed, then players race to grab the monster card that matches the combination of cards shown.
192212.name: Monster Mix
boardgamepodcastepisode: RJ61: Especial Dau Barcelona 2016

192213.name: Forlorn Hope
192213.description:
User summary:

The characters are involved in the assault on Bilbao on the side of the victorious Nationalists. After several notable successes, the characters are feeling invincible and foolishly volunteer for a "dangerous mission". On June 12, the characters are assigned to accompany a demolitions expert on a pre-dawn mission to assault and secure a strong point in the "Iron Ring".

192214.name: I Hope We Live to Tell the Tale
192214.description:
User summary:

On January 22, 1937, the characters, members of the Spanish Republic forces, are assigned to guard a military engineer and a group of civilians as they dismantle the Terrasso arms factory machinery, critical to the Republican war effort. They are supported by three squads of regulars. The dismantling proceeds without major incident until 2 PM when the supporting squads are ordered to depart to reinforce the crumbling front lines. A few minutes later, the military engineer deserts into the city.

192215.name: Pan y Fusiles
192215.description:
User summary:

The characters have participated with the Republican forces in combat during the Battle of Guadalajara until March 18, 1937, at which time the Italian retreat has disengaged from the Republican main line of resistance. The characters are placed on detached status as an independent squad and ordered to forage throughout the area. They are notified that Italian or Nationalist rearguard units, as well as stragglers, should be expected. The characters are to avoid combat and gather as much ammunition and food supplies as they can.

192216.name: FLAG: Fictional Lands Adventure Game
192216.description:
User summary:

Characters have Attributes (Dexterity, Intelligence, Personality, and Strength) derived from a semi-random process. Hit Points are set equal to the character's Strength score. Characters also have Skills with values derived from a points pool. Opposed rolls utilize a modified d20 compared to a target difficulty; rolling low indicates success.

192217.name: Temple of the Nightbringers
192217.description:
From the front cover:

A tribe of goblins are raiding travelers on the Long Road, and our heroes decide to help. After a dangerous overland journey, they enter a mysterious abandoned temple where they encounter terrifying monsters, deadly traps, dark magic and a shocking secret. Will they survive the Temple of the Nightbringers?


From the introduction:

Temple of the Nightbringers is an introductory adventure for newly created characters. It is designed to be played in a single session.

192218.name: Newsies & Bootblacks: The Primer
192218.description:
User summary:

This document provides a quick-start option for the game, presenting basic rules and concepts. Character creation is presented, as well as basic encounters and action resolution mechanisms.

Forsaken!, an introductory scenario, also is included.

192219.name: Sords
192219.description:
User summary:

Characters in Sords have Sills (these would typicall be called Attributes in most role-playing games) consisting of Strength, Agility, Attack, Defend, and Vitality, with values distributed from a Point Pool. Characters also have equipment which is atypical in its significance. The remainder of the rules focus on combat mechanics and character experience.

192220.name: Pirates Attack
192220.description:
Description from the publisher:

Pirates Attack is a collaborative strategy game in which two players face the pirates together. The last player to neutralize the pirate threat is the winner.

Pirates will attack your ship, which means that you must be on your guard to obtain the best possible results as you play.

192221.name: Backup Storage War: Exagrid Vs. EMC Data Domain
192221.description: Very simple roll and move game that while you play tries to convince you that Exagrid's backup solution is better than EMC's.

192222.name: Roguelike Solitaire (Version 1.4)
192222.description:
The Hack 'n' Slash Adventure

User summary:

This version of the game supports play for one to three players without a game master. Characters select a Race (Troll, Human, Fairy), a Class (Fighter, Cleric, Barbarian, Thief), and purchase equipment. Race has a larger impact on game play than Class, as it determines the initial Attribute scores as well as giving some significant play bonuses.

192223.name: Roguelike Solitaire (Version 1.6d)
192223.description:
The Hack 'n' Slash Adventure

User summary:

This version of the game supports play for one to three players without a game master. It supports three character races (Troll, Human, and Fairy) and four character classes (Fighter, Cleric, Barbarian, and Thief). This version of the game adds refinement in the randomization process and some small changes to game balance.

192224.name: Roguelike Solitaire (Version 2.0)
192224.description:
The Single Player Hack 'n' Slash Adventure

User summary:

This version of the game supports only solitaire play. Character race has been removed as an option, but four Classes are available (Fighter, Cleric, Barbarian, and Thief). The solitaire-only play option yields an easier rule structure, and this is the simplest and cleanest version of the game.

192225.name: Pickle Letter
192225.description:
Description from the publisher:

Just dill with it! In the lightning-fast letter-matching game Pickle Letter, you pick a peck of Pickleletters for a jarring good time. Time is ticking in the race to match the most letters before your opponents find them first. Find matches first and pickle the other players. But here's the dill: Things can go sour fast! You'll be in a pickle if it doesn't all match up and your opponents prove you wrong! So keep calm and crunch on.

192226.name: Ultimate Showdown
192226.description:
Description from the publisher:

The knockdown, no-holds-barred party game Showdown pits famous people and characters in a battle to decide once and for all who can triumph under the situation at hand? Will it be the Easter Bunny vs. Ben Franklin for Best Babysitter? Or will Ghengis Khan beat out Frank Sinatra for Best Road-trip Companion? Anything goes! You pick the challenges and YOU try to get your picks to win!

192227.name: Swipe Out!
192227.description:
Description from the publisher:

Look, react, swipe to win! Take a swipe at speedy victory with this addictive game of high energy and fast hands! When the chips are down in Swipe Out!, be the first to swipe yours off the board to match the pattern on the Swipe Out card. Win the card to win the round. Collect five Swipe Out cards to win the game!

192228.name: Time's Up: Title Recall – Expansion 1
192228.description:
Time's Up: Title Recall – Expansion 1 contains more cards for use with the Time's Up: Title Recall base game.

Based on the popular game Time's Up!, Time's Up: Title Recall challenges players to guess the titles of books, films, songs, and more. Players try to get other players to guess the same set of titles over three rounds. In each round, one member of a team tries to get his teammates to guess as many titles as possible in 30 seconds. In round 1, almost any kind of clue is allowed. In round 2 no more than one word can be used in each clue (but unlimited sounds and gestures are permitted.) In round 3, no words are allowed at all.

192229.name: Time's Up: Title Recall – Expansion 2
192229.description:
Time's Up: Title Recall – Expansion 2 contains more cards for use with the Time's Up: Title Recall base game.

Based on the popular game Time's Up!, Time's Up: Title Recall challenges players to guess the titles of books, films, songs, and more. Players try to get other players to guess the same set of titles over three rounds. In each round, one member of a team tries to get his teammates to guess as many titles as possible in 30 seconds. In round 1, almost any kind of clue is allowed. In round 2 no more than one word can be used in each clue (but unlimited sounds and gestures are permitted.) In round 3, no words are allowed at all.

192230.name: Time's Up: Title Recall – Expansion 3
192230.description:
Time's Up: Title Recall – Expansion 3 contains more cards for use with the Time's Up: Title Recall base game.

Based on the popular game Time's Up!, Time's Up: Title Recall challenges players to guess the titles of books, films, songs, and more. Players try to get other players to guess the same set of titles over three rounds. In each round, one member of a team tries to get his teammates to guess as many titles as possible in 30 seconds. In round 1, almost any kind of clue is allowed. In round 2 no more than one word can be used in each clue (but unlimited sounds and gestures are permitted.) In round 3, no words are allowed at all.

192231.name: Time's Up: Title Recall – Expansion 4
192231.description:
Time's Up: Title Recall – Expansion 4 contains more cards for use with the Time's Up: Title Recall base game.

Based on the popular game Time's Up!, Time's Up: Title Recall challenges players to guess the titles of books, films, songs, and more. Players try to get other players to guess the same set of titles over three rounds. In each round, one member of a team tries to get his teammates to guess as many titles as possible in 30 seconds. In round 1, almost any kind of clue is allowed. In round 2 no more than one word can be used in each clue (but unlimited sounds and gestures are permitted.) In round 3, no words are allowed at all.

192232.name: EverQuest (2010)
192232.description:
User summary:

Characters in EverQuest are generated through a fairly traditional process, having Attributes that are determined randomly, then selecting Race, Class, and Skills. The manual includes a bestiary and a character sheet.

Note the game's name was criticized for being easily confused with Sony's EverQuest video game franchise on the forum where it was published, though the author chose to retain it.

192233.description:
Description from the publisher:

Each turn in Karibou Camp, players discover their partner, then simultaneously exchange the cards from their hand with those in the center of the table in order to create a collection of identical animals — but to earn points, you still need to make your partner understand which collection you have completed!

Marmots? Give them a wink. Caribou? Pull your tongue out. Be discreet because at any moment your opponents can catch you and steal your points. Speed, observation, grimaces, and laughs are plenty in this crazy party game.
192233.name: Karibou Camp
boardgamepodcastepisode: RDTN Episode 104: Mansions of Madness, Pandemic: Reign of Cthulhu, Qwixx, Karibou Camp and Rant

192234.name: Cyberpunk Remix Core Rules
192234.description:
User summary:

The Core Rules for Cyberpunk Remix present an adaptation of Fate 3 that is modified to support the unique setting which is a fusion of pop culture and cyberpunk elements. The standard game distribution includes everything that is necessary for play (except dice), including several print-and-play components.

The game typically is distributed as a ZIP archive containing these PDF items:


Cyberpunk Remix Core Rules
Character Sheet (One page)
Remix Cards (One page of Card Backs)
Remix Horror (One page of Card Faces)
Remix Odd (One page of Card Faces)
Remix Slumming (One page of Card Faces)
Remix Transhuman (One page of Card Faces)

192235.name: Difference Junior
192235.description:
Based on the popular "spot the differences" challenges found in books, newspapers and elsewhere, Difference Junior challenges your abilities to observe and react quickly. The deck includes two sets of double-sided cards, with one set being more challenging than the other. Place one card in the center of the table, then deal the rest out to players as evenly as possible.

To start, each player looks at the top card of their stack, then tries to spot the two differences between their card in hand and the reference card on the table. Whoever spots their particular differences first stops play, demonstrates them to everyone, places their card on top of the reference card (creating a new challenge for everyone), then draws the next card from their deck. Whoever gets rid of all of their cards first wins!

192236.name: Picmix
192236.description:
Description from the publisher:

In Picmix, each player has a set of four cards on which are shown sixteen items. Each turn, a goal card with three or four of these objects is revealed. Be the fastest to position your cards in such a way that only the objects appearing on the target card are visible. Keep your cool to find the right combination first.

192237.name: Specific
192237.description:
Description from the publisher:

Open your eagle eyes! Do you know an omnivorous animal that has two legs and flies? Roll the dice in Specific and be the first to identify the animal matching the three characteristics: habitat, diet, and number of legs. Variants make the game suitable for all ages.

192238.name: 0h h1
192238.description:
Oh h1 is a little logic game created by Q42. It was created by Martin Kool. The concept is also known as Takuzu or Binairo.

Three adjacent tiles of the same color in a row or column isn't allowed. Rows and columns have an equal number of each color. No two rows and no two columns are the same.

Source: The Game Website.

User addition
Players can pick the size of the puzzle (4x4, 8x8). Each puzzle starts with a few fixed colored tiles. It's up to the player to correctly determine the colors of the rest the tiles.

192239.name: Budō
192239.description:
Budō is a two-player mixed martial arts card game that challenges each player to manage a dojo of martial arts skills while striving to knockout the opponent. Learn to manage a dojo in ten minutes then spend a lifetime mastering the martial way. Adapt your mat position and craft a deck of attack and defense skills to combat your opponent. Balancing tactics and strategy, play the player across the tables as much as the dojos.

Players balance the use of Stamina and Experience Points to build a deck of attack and defense cards from their dojo of skills in order to adapt to an opponent's evolving strategy. Holds create an opening for an attack and often work in combination with other moves. Stuns break an opponent's rhythm leaving her without enough stamina to pull of offensive combos. Takedowns are advanced moves that put the opponent on the mat defenseless.

The linear mat component allows players to control distance to avoid damage and get in range to strike their opponent providing an additional level of tactics and strategy.

Lasting about 30 minutes, no two fights are ever the same. With each new bout, new strategies emerge

192240.description:
In Control, players are time travelers who have been caught in a rupture in spacetime and displaced outside time. You must use Fuel Cells (the cards) to refuel your time machine or stop other players from refueling theirs first.

To escape the rupture, you must reach a Fuel Cell Charge of 21 or more on your Installed Fuel Cells at the end of your turn. Whoever does so first closes the rupture, leaving the other travelers lost outside time.

During your turn, you choose to either draw a card, install a Fuel Cell in your area of play, burn a Fuel Cell to the discard pile, or defuse an opponent's Fuel Cell. The Fuel Cell Charge on cards ranges from 1–10 and different abilities on Fuel cells make for changing strategies and multiple lines of play.
192240.name: Control

192241.name: Prospekt
192241.description:
Prospekt begins in the Nova Prospekt prison in the Half-Life universe. Gordon Freeman is slowly being overrun by soldiers in the prison, however unknown to him, his Vortigaunt allies manage to find some help from a forgotten hero.

Source: The Game Website.

192242.name: BLAM BLAM PLANET
192242.description:
BLAM BLAM PLANET is a chaotic "infinite" first-person shooter on a planetoid, initially created for the Ludum Dare #27 compo. The theme was "10 seconds", so a lot of the gameplay has to do with 10 seconds. For example, every 10 seconds your weapon switches.

Source: The Game Website.

192243.name: Hashtag Me!
192243.description:
Hashtag Me! is an interactive storytelling game for small to medium groups. Everyone has their favorite stories to tell, but some stories have been buried over years of neglect. It’s time to dust off those old pages and share ‘em. A set of Ninja throwing stars you got for Christmas when you were 12? An excursion into the snowy wastelands in a beat up old car? Tell your stories and other players will interact by hashtagging your story!

Everyone starts with 6 hashtag cards in their hand. Players take turns being the storyteller. The storyteller draws two question cards and chooses which question to tell their story about. Once the story has begun, the rest of the players lay down hashtag cards during the story as they become relevant. At the end of the story, points are awarded and the role of storyteller passes to the next person.

It's a fun party game that's easy to pick up. It’s great for an icebreaker or as a way to get to know your friends and family better.

192244.name: MonStars
192244.description:
Raise the curtain for the funny freak show with cute creatures for little monster fans!

In MonStars, 45 colorful "MonStars" are crowding the stage, ready for the big show. Only an absolutely distinctive style will leave a lasting impression with the jury. Who will be among the Top 10? Each jury member holds a colored card set. By overlapping the cards, details can be combined so that different MonStars are created. Everyone plays simultaneously and tries to copy the candidate shown on the current card.

192245.name: Schattenmeister
192245.description: The family game Schattenmeister creates tricky gaming fun and lots of challenges as players have to unravel a mysterious shape and divide it into its components. To do this, they must bring a keen eye and the power of deduction as it isn't easy when they are looking at silhouettes overlapping each other. Only little details are recognizable. But what do they depict? An ear, a wing, or a handle? The player who sees through the shadows and collects most points will be the Master of Shadows.

192246.name: Activity Krazy Kritzel
192246.description:
One thousand expressions, a small board with a rubber band, an erasable pen — and time is running out!

You have to think back to front in this latest variant of the popular party game. Activity Krazy Kritzel offers a new challenge even for weathered Activity veterans. Blind and back to front, they have to give a shape to expressions on a board they wear on their foreheads. Scribblings or art? It doesn't matter...as long as it's recognizable!

192248.name: Japanese: The Game – Animals Expansion
192248.description: A lot of people don't know how awesome and complete the Japanese list of animal sounds is. Rabbits, dragonflies, and foxes actually say something in Japanese, and their sounds will be on the cards!

192249.name: Japanese: The Game – Calligraphy Expansion
192249.description: This deck will help players learn Japanese kanji and gain points by building words made up of several characters. The kanji's meaning and dictionary-style examples of each character will be in the rules document, as will many word-building options and the bar codes to scan for pronunciation. So the cards will have full functionality, and will definitely still be usable by less advanced learners with some effort, but the card faces will be minimalist, focused on the beautiful art of written Japanese.

192250.name: Japanese: The Game – Children Expansion
192250.description: Speaking to children requires a kind of Japanese that is both loving and authoritative. The Children Expansion will teach you words you don't use when talking to adults... unless they're acting like children (which happens). It will also help you tell them to sit still, play nice, take turns, and brush their teeth.

192251.name: Japanese: The Game – Household Items Expansion
192251.description: People love learning vocabulary that's easy to remember, which is why one of the most requested decks is a Household Items Expansion. You'll learn the words for things you see every day so you can repeat them in your head. You could even place the Fridge card on the fridge with a magnet. But don't put the waste basket card in the waste basket.

192252.name: Japanese: The Game – Martial Arts: White Belt Expansion
192252.description: Words valuable in martial arts will be included for study and hilarity. Mixing and matching it with other expansions can result in glorious sentences like "If Godzilla attacks, our honorable grandfather will roundhouse kick him into an office building."

192253.name: Japanese: The Game – Respect Expansion
192253.description: Japanese culture has a strong social structure that is reflected in their language. You use different pronouns and verbs when referring to people of a higher or lower social level. The Intermediate Expansion: Respect will include names, titles, and verbs with varying degrees of respect to help you speak appropriately in different situations.

192254.name: Japanese: The Game – Anatomy Expansion
192254.description: Contains nouns like Arm, Shoulder, Leg, Neck, and verbs like Turn, Reach, and Point. This is very useful vocabulary and the explanations and example sentences will help you make sure you're using them properly.

192255.name: Japanese: The Game – Counting Expansion
192255.description: Counting is a little different in Japanese and this expansion deck will help you learn your numbers and how to count people, cards, bikes, books, and other every-day objects!

192256.name: Pixel Galaxy
192256.description:
User Summary

This Shoot 'Em Up has almost no shooting -- by you that is. Instead, you pick up other friendly and enemy squares, avoid enemy bullets, all the while protecting your initial white square, which if struck by a bullet brings the game to an end.

192257.name: Hell's Rebels Poster Map Folio
192257.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Rebels in the Streets!

Fight to break the Thrice-Damned House of Thrune's control over a large expanse of Cheliax with the Hell's Rebels Poster Map Folio! Seek high adventure while battling diabolical foes or map your party's progress through the streets of Kintargo with these three massive poster maps designed for use with the Hell's Rebels Adventure Path.

These huge, lavishly illustrated poster maps depict prominent locations from the Hell's Rebels Adventure Path. The first depicts Kintargo, the City of Silver, the primary setting for the campaign and a city trapped under the oppressive thumb of House Thrune. The second map portrays Vyre, the City of Masks, a place where one can find any imaginable vice. The third map shows Kintargo in a different light—a beautifully illustrated look at the city from a bird's-eye view. These maps can also be used as player handouts, so the heroes can plan their attacks and gain a greater insight into the streets they're working to free.

Whether you need elaborate city maps or stunning posters, these beautiful maps are the perfect resource for the Hell's Rebels Adventure Path or any fantasy campaign.

192260.name: Universe
192260.description:
In the dexterity game Universe, up to four players use marbles, dice and disks as ships and flick, roll, or spin their way into the Universe. It's shuffleboard, pinball, marbles, crokinole, craps, bocci ball, and even a bit of golf — but with the fingers — synchronized into one.

You can go for points, planet ownership, or the black hole, and whoever has the most points at the end of a set number of rounds wins.

Universe includes two additional mini games, giving you three games in one.

192262.name: Zombie Wars: Invasion
192262.description:
User Summary

A tower defense game featuring zombies. Build towers, use abilities and utilize your hero to keep the zombies from getting past your defenses. Fight over 20 different zombie types.

192263.name: Disturbed Friends: Suicide Deck
192263.description:
The Suicide Deck is an expansion to Disturbed Friends that contains 40 Question Cards, 8 unique #WINNING cards, and a set of 4 bloody player cards.

It was initially available through Kickstarter as an addon to the Disturbed Friends game.

192264.name: Disturbed Friends: Booster Pack
192264.description: The Booster Pack for Disturbed Friends was achieved as stretch reward through Kickstarter. It contains 12 Question cards, 3 #WINNING cards, and an additional 3 Kickstarter #WINNING cards.

192265.name: Disturbed Friends: Mini Game & Expansion
192265.description:
Disturbed Friends: Mini Game / Expansion is both a small version of Disturbed friends for 4 players that can be played stand alone or mixed with the base game Disturbed Friends and/or previously released expansions such as the Suicide Deck or the Booster Pack.

It contains 90 cards: 4 sets of player cards, 20 #WINNING cards, and 56 Question cards.

192266.name: Breakthrough! The Bible Board Game
192266.description:
Object:
Travel through various biblical eras (primeval history to early Christianity) answering questions about people of the Bible that address the who, where, when, what, how, and why of their places in salvation history. Players determine length of time and game play by choosing from any of the designated starting and stopping points on the board--the Garden of Eden, Egypt, the Promised Land, the Temple--with New Jerusalem as the final destination. The team or individual that collects the most character cards wins the game. Board game includes a free Bible!

This game is designed to be played two different ways:

Learn-as-you-play:
If you're new to the Bible, the learn-as-you-play mode will help you get acquainted with Breakthrough! The Bible for Young Catholics and all the wonderful stories, characters, and lessons it holds. When faced with questions, you'll be free to look up the answers in the Bible.

Test-your-knowledge:
If you're more experienced, you'll be able to test what you know about the Bible by answering the questions from memory with the test-your-knowledge mode of play.

192267.description: A score pad to aid in the final scoring of Discoveries.
192267.name: Discoveries: Score Pad

192268.name: Cool am Pool
192268.description:
Despite the relaxing atmosphere, there's a struggle in this holiday paradise as the beach chairs are in high demand: Who will snatch the places close to the pool and with the best view, despite the stern gaze of the lifeguard?

In Cool am Pool, the sunbathers need to get up early, with players placing their towels on beach chairs around the pool at the start of the game. Now players need to fill these reserved chairs with bathers of their color during the game. In the end, dice luck and good planning decides who makes the best impression — whether in Bermuda shorts, bikini, or swimsuit...

192269.name: Karawanix
192269.description: Karawanix challenges players to climb atop their dromedaries and make their way through the desert together, enduring sand storms and mirages on their way to the oasis.

192270.name: Till Eulenspiegel: Schabernack mit Schuhen und Schalk
192270.description:
In Till Eulenspiegel: Schabernack mit Schuhen und Schalk, the playful tightrope act stimulates the brains of acrobats both large and small, with players trying to pick out matching pairs from 32 motley shoes. The first player to collect four or five pairs of shoes wins.

Till Eulenspiegel includes three game modes: a memory game, "Till pilfers", and the quick-playing "criss-cross".

192271.name: The Millionaires' Club
192271.description:
A Game of Capital Gains!

Invest in the Stock Market!
Buy and Sell Real Estate!
Beware!
Money Loves Nobody!
Wallets Grow while Pockets Empty!

The Millionaires' Club is a game for 2-5 Players taking about an hours worth of time to play.

Games are played in Rounds, with Players taking Turns within each Round. A Round starts with every Player collecting a crisp One Million Dollar Bill.

Players then take turns engaging in intriguing business decisions; Competing over ownership of the largest share in various companies, as well as, Buying and Selling Real Estate Properties.

The Millionaires' Club will make you feel like a wealthy entrepreneur in no time!

After every Round, the Starting Player rolls Two 'Market Dice', One Red; One Blue. The Red affects the Stock Market: A Low Roll can Crash a Company, while a High Roll Skyrockets Stock Values. The Blue manipulates the Real Estate Property Market: A High Roll Creates a Bubble of economic prosperity, gaining Players a bonus Cash Pay Out! from the Bank. Reversely, a Low Roll will Burst the Bubble; Forecloseing Properties, costing Players their hard earned money.

Afterwards, the Starting Player shifts Clockwise to the next Player, Starting a new Round.

The Game continues, Round after Round, with Players Conducting Business and Rolling the Dice. The Player with the highest valued Estate at the End of the Game Wins!

192272.name: Friendship Island
192272.description:
This game focuses on making friends, being a good friend, and resolving disagreements in a win-win way. The game is designed so that players cooperate and help each other as well as answer questions about friendship to win points for themselves. The game also helps shy and socially delayed students explore friendship issues. Features two different games that use the same board but have separate questions. The second game involves more strategy, harder questions, more advanced vocabulary, and more opportunities for negotiation.

A “Teachers Guide” with complete lesson plans for both versions of the game is included. Students practice reading skills (reading the cards) and math skills (handling the point certificates). Students are challenged to use critical thinking in answering questions and in forming their strategies for playing the game. During the post-game discussion students link their experience in the game with real life.

Includes game board, six game tokens, one die, Making-a-Friend cards, Good Times cards, Solving Problems cards, and instructions

192273.description:
Knights and Knaves is a supplement for the Battlesworn: Bid for Victory miniatures rules.

18 new Classes: Tested against the basic classes of Battlesworn: Bid For Victory, Knights and Knaves adds rules for Acrobat, Alchemist, Assassin, Bard, Beast, Berserker, Chaos Warrior, Construct, Druid, Giant, Monk, Paladin, Pistoleer, Priest, Ranger, Swarm, Witch, and Witch Hunter.

More Magic: This book adds generic magic melee and ranged weapons, Talismans, Amulets, Potions, and 12 new spells, all formatted as cards that can be printed or photocopied.

Solo Play: Guidelines for solitaire play are included.
192273.name: Knights and Knaves

192274.description:
In the golden green woodlands of the Alpine Slopes, stands Bethel Woods; an orphanage once explored by young, creative minds pushing the limits of space and time, gravity and light. But when an ominous force invades the world, Bethel Woods becomes a distant memory, lost inside the thickets of the forest.

Now a group of young people, wearing the crest of the orphanage, return to finish the work that was started long ago. They must work diligently, however, to repair and restore the machines scattered throughout the forest, before the ominous force finds the technology and destroys the only chance the world has in surviving.

The cooperative game Bethel Woods is set in the universe of "Hours", created by author, Jessy Ribordy (Falling Up/The River Empires) and uses a mancala-like mechanism. Players first pick up all the Workers from any one of the 6 Machines surrounding the Orphanage, then move either clockwise or counter-clockwise around the board, dropping one worker on each Machine and fixing Malfunctions as they go. There are 4 Malfunction types, each with a matching Worker type to fix it. All Malfunctions that players fix are added to their personal supply as "Knowledge".

To win, players need to send 6 of the 12 Workers into Bethel Woods Orphanage with increasing amounts of Knowledge to construct the "Daydreamer" (a machine that will rescue the orphanage's inhabitants from the impending downfall). The first Worker needs just 1 Knowledge of their type, the second 2, the third 3, and so on.

Players also need to use their acquired Knowledge to uncover spies, hidden within each of the Machines. Players may uncover 1 Spy only on the last Machine they place a Worker on each turn.

After each turn, three random Malfunctions are drawn and added to the various Machines. If a Machine has more than 3 Malfunctions and/or Spies, it goes into the critical state. These all make the task of maintaining the Machines and constructing the Daydreamer that much harder. Also, any round where at least one Machine goes critical, results in a Spy being placed.

Players lose the game if at the end of a player's turn, there are 4 critical Machines. They can also lose immediately if there are ever 6 Spies on the board or not enough Malfunctions when placing them.
192274.name: Bethel Woods
boardgamepodcastepisode: 18. Devon Dice Podcast - Warring colons
1P 110 - Far Space Foundry
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 028 – 10 Games for Essen

192275.description:
From the publisher (Translated):

It is well known that powerful Olympians walk hidden among us. These faithful followers mythological beings seek to get them their prayers and be so invincible. Harmony has remained so for centuries, until Humanity has changed its position on these beings with grace.
Currently, Gods and Men fought epic battles in the metropolis, destroying temples that give protection to these myths, since man ever greed divine power, without knowing, that divinity is granted only to a few.

HOW TO WIN
Get the power of 4 of the Gods in front of you.
if the above goal is not achieved, The player who draws the last card, make his turn and the number of gods which each player will be counted on the Metropolis. He who possesses most, wins.

HOW TO PLAY
Each player starts with 4 cards. At the beginning of each shift can be made 2 different actions:

Draw 1 card. Use it.
Discard.




From the publisher (Spanish):
De todos es sabido que poderosos Dioses del Olimpo caminan ocultos entre nosotros. Estos seres mitológicos buscan fieles adeptos para obtener de ellos sus plegarias y hacerse así invencibles. La armonía se ha mantenido así durante siglos ,hasta que la Humanidad ha cambiado su postura ante estos seres con Gracia.
En la actualidad, Dioses y Hombres libran épicas batallas en las metrópolis ,arrasando los templos que dan protección a estos mitos, pues el hombre siempre codicia el poder divino, sin saber, que la divinidad solo es otorgada a unos pocos.

OBJETIVO DEL JUEGO
Hay varias formas de ganar en OLYMPIANS WAR
-consigue el poder de 4 de los Dioses frente a tí.
-si no se consigue el anterior objetivo, se jugará todo el Olimpo para determinar el vencedor. El jugador que robe la última carta, realizará su turno y se contarán el número de Dioses que tenga cada jugador sobre su Metrópolis. El que posea más, ganará. En caso de empate, se contarán también los templos, ganando así el que mas tenga.

MECÁNICA DEL JUEGO
Cada jugador comienza con 4 cartas. Al inicio de cada turno se puede realizar 2 acciones diferentes:

Robar 1 carta. Se coge una carta del Olimpo




Jugar 1 carta o pasar turno. Bajas una carta de tu mano y se ejecuta su acción o bien pasar el turno sin jugar ninguna
Invocar. Coge de los CAMPOS ELÍSEOS los Dioses para invocar nuevas criaturas que te beneficien.

Descartar. Dejas un número de cartas en el TÁRTARO, y coges el mismo número de cartas del OLIMPO. Pudiendo descartarse desde 1 carta a todas las cartas. Pero después de realizar esta acción se pasará turno.
192275.name: Olympians War

192276.name: Towers
192276.description:
From publisher blurb:

Each stone and brick laid cements a nation’s hold on its lands.

The strong are called upon to be the shield of the people.

The tyrants plot and rule from behind strong walls.

The world is full of danger and uncertainty.

The world belongs to those who can defend it.

Build your destiny.

Revised and expanded, Castle Builder Reforged, Chapter 4 takes you inside the iconic dwellings of wizards and border stations in the fantasy realm: towers. These are the buildings that dare to reach the sky and keep an eye on all they survey from the lofty heights of their roofs. Imposing, slender—and sometimes graceful—towers capture the imagination in ways that other strongholds can only dream of.

A partial list of what you’ll find inside:

Sample maps
Ways to use towers to make memorable locations
The limitations of towers and how to maximize their strengths

192277.name: Secret of the Moon-Door
192277.description:
From publisher blurb:

Legendary Treasure of a Forgotten God!

Behind the horned altar of ruined temple to a forgotten god stands a great stone door carved in the likeness of the crescent moon and decorated with mysterious sigils. Countless attempts by explorers and treasure-seekers to open the door have failed, until now!

Secrets of the Moon-Door is a short PDF adventure for 10th to 12th level characters, set in the Primeval Thule 5e campaign setting, and written by Sasquatch Games Studio co-founder Richard Baker. This adventure was written as part of the Primeval Thule 5e kickstarter campaign, and is now available for purchase for your 5e Thule game!

192278.name: Primeval Thule Player's Companion
192278.description:
From publisher blurb:

Before endless winter enveloped the cities of the northern isles, there was a time of legends now forgotten. This was the age of Thule, savage and spectacular - an age of wonders and terrors that survive now only in half-remembered glimmers of myth. Across this primal landscape stride bold, brawling, larger-than-life heroes, and your character can be one of them!

The Thule 5e Player's Companion is a rules expansion that provides you with dozens of interesting new options for your Primeval Thule character. In this book you will find:

New subclasses for the barbarian, druid, paladin, rogue, and sorcerer
Cold and Fury domains for Thulean clerics
New Thulean feats, such as Bloodlust, Spymaster, and Tireless
15 new spells, including blade magic and ice magic.
Personality and trait tables for all character narratives introduces in the Primeval Thule Campaign Setting book.




Create a slayer barbarian, a poisoner rogue, or a wizard armed with spells such as ice claw or gelid fog. Try a few rolls on the narrative trait tables to generate ideas for your character's personality quirks, ideals, and flaws, or choose a uniquely Thulean feat. A glorious age of savage adventure calls to you. Will you answer?

192279.name: Abla Ubla
192279.description:
Description from the publisher:

A tremendous earthquake has diverted the raging river that has separated the Ablas and Ublas for decades, reuniting the two tribes. The only problem is that each tribe's language has changed over the years, and they cannot understand each other. Queen Abla and King Ubla, needs you work together in a series of crazy challenges in order to communicate!

“Abla Ubla!” is a family/party game for 4-12 players, for ages 10+. The duration of the game is approximately 30’ minutes. Players form 2 teams, in which they write down words and try to describe them to their teammates as quickly as possible, but must abide by the rules and the challenges of the Abla-ublas, like speaking with their tongue hanging out their mouth or keep their teeth clenched together while talking, in order to work out what on earth their team-mates are trying to describe! The game contains 85 Category cards that can be erased when filled up and 15 Challenge cards that will keep players excited for a long time! There are 2 modes that we can use the Challenge cards, for even greater replayability. The team with the most Victory Points wins the game. So get ready to Twist your tongue and tangle your words!

192280.name: Gauntlet of Spiragos (5E)
192280.description:
From publisher blurb:

For centuries, titans bestrode the world, colossal heads and shoulders lost in the clouds, carelessly smashing and crushing all beneath. When the youngest of them had enough and declared war on their ancient parents, even the land itself suffered. These scars of the Divine War, which ended less than 200 years ago, have still not healed.

One such scar is the Chasm of Flies, a rent in the earth created when the titan Spiragos the Ambusher was smote down by one of the young gods, Vangal the Ravager. Now, the Chasm is inhabited by spider-eye goblins and their spider allies, but it is also thought to be the resting place of powerful artifacts from that elder age.

"Gauntlet of Spiragos" is a Scarred Lands adventure designed for 1st level characters, although it can be easily modified for characters of up to 5th level.

192281.name: Mesmerists
192281.description:
From publisher blurb:

Look Deep Into My Eyes!

Occult Character Codex: Mesmerists brings you a full array of 20 detailed mesmerist stat blocks, including both ordinary mesmerists using their hypnotic stare to cloud and delude the minds of those that oppose them, alongside the spirit walkers that master the séance and conniving cult masters spinning their webs of intrigue. You'll find mesmerist humans, gnomes, half-orcs, and elves, but also stranger races like kitsune, nagaji, changelings, and doppelgangers, running the gamut from good to evil and all points in between. With the Occult Character Codex, you'll have an entire arsenal of mesmerist characters waiting and ready to blow your players' minds!

192282.name: The Thaumaturge
192282.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Thaumaturge is a brand new class for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game - one who incorporates forbidden magic, occult orders, and the dire patrons who support these ancient orders. This PDF includes a new class, seven new magical orders to support the thaumaturge, as well as new Feats that are developed to expand the class.

If you are a fan of the kineticist or the older 3.5 warlock, you’re going to want to play with the thaumaturge!

192283.description:
Description from the publisher:

“Emojito!”is a party game full of emotions! Players try to express the emotion
depicted on the cards of living creatures and objects! Do you think it is easy?
Play this game with friends and family and let yourself feel this cocktail of
emotions! The game can be played cooperatively or competitively and there are
also 2 variant rules for experienced players, which adds a new perspective of
fun and interactivity between players.
192283.name: Emojito!
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Game Pit: Episode 72 - Spiel 2016 Treasure Hunt Part 2

192284.description:
Sipario! is a card and strategy game set in the glittering world of opera.

Get ready to stage the most dazzling and prestigious opera season
ever! To achieve this, you will have to engage the most
renowned singers, put up with Prime donne, tantrums, invest
in the best advertising, hire paparazzi, pay the claque, and most
importantly throw spanners in the works of competing theater
managers. After you receive the titles of the three operas you
are going to stage, start opposing anyone who tries to stop you
from conquering the Hall of Fame!
Sipario! is a card and strategy game for 2-5 players, where each
player thinks of ways to outsmart their opponents and at the
same time advance their own plans. The only thing you should
NOT have, to be the best in the business, is scruples…
192284.name: Sipario!
boardgamepodcastepisode: Play 2016: le novità ludiche – Il Dado Incantato #5

192285.name: Kong: The 8th Wonder Of The World
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance Release
192285.description:
From the back of the box:

Play as Man.
Plat as Kong.
First for your life in the dangerous jungles of Skull Island. Experience the extraordinary power of King Kong in this unforgettable adventure.

192286.description:
Land your crew on the island of SOL, a highly colorful but forgotten island in the Atlantic Ocean, then pit your skills against another team to find and (more importantly) leave the island with the treasure of the God of the Sun.

In SOL, players divide into two teams: adventurers vs. conquistadors, with each team having three or four characters. Each character has movement, fighting, and search skills; inventory for two or three items; and a unique special ability for use in the advanced game.

On a turn, all of the characters on one team act first, one after another, then the opposite team goes. During your turn, use your action points to move your character and search on the island. If you meet someone from the other team, you can fight them, whether to steal the treasure or simply to set them back. When you search, you might find move and fight tokens to save for the future; flags that let you claim a dock on the island to make it easier to leave; or clues to the treasure. The clue tokens let you play cards, and those cards determine where the treasure will be found — ideally in a spot more advantageous for you than the other team.

Once the final clue has been found, the treasure is up for grabs, with a team needing to have one of its characters possess it on a dock to which they have access at the start of their turn. Thus, holding it isn't enough as the other team can possibly steal it away on their turn.
192286.name: SOL

192287.name: CT Special Forces 2: Back In The Trenches
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance Release
192287.description:
From the back of the box:

You are a part of the CTSF unit -- Counter Terrorist Special Forces -- an elite command of the Special Intervention Forces. This organization is extremely top secret and even you know very little about their activities. You are one of its highly trained soldiers, able to engage in combat alone or as part of a team.

Your orders have been issued... You must secure the areas currently under enemy control, destroy their forces and capture their leaders. The eyes of the whole world are on you!


Exclusive game modes: along with sniper and shoot 'em up action, you'll also be able to drive a series of vehicles and save hostages using your helicopter.



All the modern warfare weaponry: shotgun, smart-grenades, bazookas, knives, assault rifles...



Dozens of different enemies; will you dare confront killers and highly trained paratroopers?



Play in 5 worlds and at 20 different levels with 4 playable characters.



A captivating storyline, engage the worst bad guys in a worldwide fight



Challenge mode: via the Came Link Cable, play in "Time Attack" with friends!

192288.description:
At 1020 hours on June 4, 1942, Japanese naval aircraft still ruled the skies over the Pacific. All that changed within ten minutes, when U. S. dive bombers sunk three out of four carriers constituting Kido Butai, the Imperial Japanese Navy’s main strike force which had devastated Pearl Harbor only six months before.

The solitaire game Kido Butai simulates the dramatic events of the pivotal battle at Midway from a Japanese perspective. As commander of the Tenno's strike force, your task is to
destroy the American base on the atoll and sink any carrier you encounter while preserving your own strength. Simple yet elegant mechanics make for an entertaining challenge. Will you be up to it and keep the imperial sun shining?
192288.name: Kido Butai: Japan's Carriers at Midway

192289.name: The King of Fighters A-2012
192289.description:
User Summary

The King of Fighters mobile series continues with King of Fighters A-2012. Featuring more than 30 characters and using a simplified touch control scheme, the game includes all of the complex fighting game tactics of its console counterparts, such as combos, super special moves, and cancels. Battles can be fought either 1 vs 1 or in the traditional KOF 3 vs 3 Team Battle modes.

boardgamehonor: 2016 Golden Geek Best Card Game Nominee
192291.description:
Description from the publisher:

Sushi Go Party!, an expanded version of the best-selling card game Sushi Go!, is a party platter of mega maki, super sashimi, and endless edamame. You still earn points by picking winning sushi combos, but now you can customize each game by choosing à la carte from a menu of more than twenty delectable dishes. What's more, up to eight players can join in on the sushi-feast. Let the good times roll!
192291.name: Sushi Go Party!
boardgamepodcastepisode: #22: The Great Fire of London review; Sushi Go! on-tap; Summer Session Beer Roundup
#24: The HYPE Episode! Gen Con 2016 Preview; Rocky Road a la Mode preview; Among the Stars on tap
MN 0141 Holiday Gift Guide 2016
Vox Republica 122: Roll For Self-Care

192292.name: Dog-Faced Kobolds
192292.description:
From publisher blurb:

Astonishing Races: Dog-Faced Kobolds gives the kobold a full-racial review and expansion, emulating the style of the “Core Races“ as detailed in books like the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Advanced Race Guide and others.

Astonishing Races: Dog-Faced Kobolds aims to give players of this iconic and evil diminutive race immersive, world-neutral materials and support for almost any kind of play. Included are new and expanded options for alternate racial traits and subtypes, favored class options for all the base, core, hybrid, and occult classes, and a racial archetype. The book also has new racial rules for race equipment, feats, traits, magic items, spells and more!

So if you’ve ever wanted to play a seaborn or house kobold, a beast training kobold with a swarm collar, or just take your little kobold to the next level, Astonishing Races: Dog-Faced Kobolds is the book for you!

192293.name: Bad Day CA
192293.description:
User summary:

The game presents a rules-light, minimal role-playing game. Characters have a name and select one Attribute. Actions based on that Attribute get a bonus on the die roll. Note the actual resolution method is suggested to be a modified die roll compared to a target difficulty, though the exact process is not defined in the rules.

192295.name: Modern Ruins 6
192295.description:
From publisher blurb:

his is a 40 x 40 inch Battlemap of a Modern Ruin, it has Hex, Square and No Overlays, it also includes the VTT files for online play.

“Someone has to go through the gate to gather supplies. When you entered the camp you knew this as a price of your entry. Your lot numbers say it’s your time to get supplies.”—John Turner, Camp Leader

Modern Ruins 6 is an exterior map of a ruined city block with three barricades in the northwest, southwest, and east. The east barricade has the main gate and a guard tower. The middle of the area has three shanty buildings that the camp of survivors uses for shelter.

Modern Ruins 6 is intended for use in modern post-apocalyptic survivor games.

This map makes an excellent survivor camp and base in a post-apocalyptic game.

Adventure hook for use with this map:

Camp Turner: John Turner’s urban encampment is barely holding on as food, water, and bullets continue to deplete. Surrounded on all sides by zombies, the entire encampment drew lots for the next group of scavengers to leave the camp and explore the ruins of the city for food, water, and bullets. Looks like the player characters are the “winners” of this lottery.

John Turner gives them a K-ration, a canteen, and a pistol with six bullets. He suggests they save their last bullet for themselves, beats the pain of beating eaten. As they open the gate, the zombies come pouring at the camp, forcing the camp guards to fire on them as the group escapes into the city under the cover of darkness to look for supplies to keep themselves alive and the camp if they decide to return.

When they attempt to come back to the camp, they are chased by zombies. They have to fend them off long enough for the camp to open the gates again. Worse, the zombies have come in full force to attack all three sides of the encampment and try to break through the barricades again. Will the group and Camp Turner survive?

192296.description:
The year is 1713. A rare peace comes to the Spanish Main, but peace has its consequences...

With thousands of demobilized sailors, piracy explodes in the West Indies where the port city of Nassau serves as its headquarters. This is the sunrise of the Golden Age of Piracy. It's a time of conquest and riches, indomitable spirit and fat treasure galleons, pirate utopias and watery graves.

The Pirate Republic is a modular fully cooperative to fully competitive thematic adventure for up to four players. The most infamous pirate captains work towards completing mission objectives over three rounds of play. Your mission: Forge the ultimate empire, The Pirate Republic. The sea is your territory, anyone on or near it, your prey.

- Players can cooperatively work to complete Flying Gang mission objectives to forge the ultimate democracy, the Pirate Republic
- Players who enjoy Hidden Traitor mechanics can add optional Captain Missions that make some captains wily saboteurs who are secretly attempting to sink other players' ambitions
- Competitive mode creates a race to amass the most Swagger (Victory Points) through daring feats and plunder on the high seas

Devastate merchant shipping lanes, commandeer new ships, raid and conquer heavily defended towns, and plunder New World riches one seaport at a time.

Attack, strike fear, and duel your way across the high seas with custom action dice and a deck of unique captain cards. Pillage treasure fleets, squash mutinies, sack forts, recruit crew, duel pirate hunters, and seal your notoriety among the greatest captains. Along the way, battle and bring an end to Spanish, British, Dutch, French, and Danish imperial powers infesting your waters.

The Pirate Republic brings the piracy story to life in this swashbuckling blend of adventure and strategy. Even across the centuries, it reminds that if denied the chance to live in freedom, best to go ahead and make your own.
192296.name: The Pirate Republic

boardgamehonor: 2016 Golden Geek Best Party Game Nominee
192297.description:
• In which year was Close Encounters first in theaters?
• Which state gets the most snow each year?
• How many albums has Madonna sold?

It's likely that you don't know any of these facts, but you might have a rough idea, and that's good enough because America is a party game in which being close counts. And what if you have absolutely no idea what the answer is? Take advantage of your friends who do know. And if you realize that no one (including you) seems to know what the answer is, you can bet against everyone!

In America, each player uses their knowledge of pop culture, food, products, games, sports, and United States history to score more points than their opponents. If your opponents know something that you don't, you can leverage their knowledge to your advantage, scoring more than them with clever play. The cards have full color clues to help you, as well as interesting factoids for every question in the game. With almost one thousand questions covering more than three hundred topics, America will be a favorite for family and friends for a long time!
192297.name: America
boardgamepodcastepisode: #26: Gen Con 2016 wrap-up and Interviews with Jamey Stegmaier & Sun King Brewing
Ep 042 – Essen Spiel 2016 Preview
Episode 38 - What Exactly are We Using Kickstarter For?
Episode 80- Cry Havoc and Our Still Gotta’ Get/Play List
RDTN Episode 101: The Networks, America, Quartz, and the Flying Squirrels
The Dice Steeple #18 - Mike Fitzgerald Interview

rpgitemversion: The Grande Temple of Jing Hardcover
192298.name: The Grande Temple of Jing
192298.description:
From publisher blurb:

The grande temple is the dungeon home of an all-powerful trickster god named Jing. It’s an anything goes dungeon crawl of EPIC proportions. You’ve seen other megadungeons, but you haven’t seen anything like this…

The Grande Temple of Jing is a megadungeon designed in the spirit of old school crawls. It is presented here for the Pathfinder system, but it’s content can be modified to play with your favorite fantasy RPG. It is designed for levels 1-20.

A part of the grande temple was originally published in 2000 as a thin, digest sized book, compatible with the d20 system (see it here). Due to a successful Kickstarter campaign it has been updated, upgraded, and MASSIVELY expanded. It is now a full color hardcover tome that any retail store or dungeon delver would be proud to have on their shelves.

The Grande Temple of Jing boasts 60 dungeon levels and is completely jam-packed with fearsome monsters, wondrous magical items, clever tricks, and deadly traps. A customizable screen, bookmarks, a custom die, custom tokens, and even a 16 minute piece of themed music help immerse players in the temple experience.

192300.name: The Grande Temple of Jing Player's Guide
192300.description:
From publisher blurb:

This 12 page booklet provides 4 playable races from Jing's home world as well as rumors about the temple, and the treasures that can be found within. A Must Have companion for completists!

192301.name: Caught Between Planes
192301.description:
User summary:

Characters have Attributes and Traits that are defined partially by player decision and partially by random process. Characters also select Skills. Action resolution utilizes an unmodified D6, however, so the function of Skills, etc., is involved in narrative development more than action resolution. The setting is atypical.

192303.name: Lands of Porphyra
192303.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Patchwork Planet… For You to Explore!

Fresh from the wondermen at PurpleDuck Games-

Lands of Porphyra, the culmination of years of work by many talented artists and writers, whose vision has come together to create a campaign world of dazzling complexity and awesome potential for your Pathfinder campaigns.

Porphyra is a world that grew up without gods, dominated by the followers of the Elemental Lords who oppressed those who would not bow down…until a brave coalition of elves and orcs performed The Calling, and brought an amazing pantheon of gods and the myriad strange lands they loved, to merge with the young world, and start a world-spanning war!

Now, it is eight centuries since the NewGod Wars, and the 50-odd nations and regions of the Patchwork Planet of Porphyra seethe in uneasy truce, the more than 80 races that call it home dreaming of peace- or war anew…

Included within Lands of Porphyra:

52 distinct nations and regions of this highly varied world
87 races, traditional, new, and unusual, and their place in Porphyra
Summaries of the Gods, Landed and Risen; the Elemental Lords, and the mysterious Slithering Symphony
Life on Porphyra, both mundane and arcane- and divine
3 unique prestige classes, embodying the struggle of the Deist and Elementalist causes…
Regional traits for every nation, and a 1st level introductory adventure in the pivotal Middle Kingdoms- The Ruins of Greencastle!

192305.name: Toybox Turbos
192305.description:
Turn friends into foes in manic four player local and online multiplayer, perfect for those one-more-go gaming sessions! Whether playing locally, online, or with a mix, rapid fire rounds bring alive the glory days of multiplayer score-settling competition – dive in!

Put your opponents into a spin and a smile on your face as you use cool power-ups littered around each circuit! Lock on with the machine gun, smash up rivals with a giant hammer and send out electromagnetic pulses to pulverize the pretenders to your racing crown - and much more!

Sprint for the line in classic races, set your best time in time trial, pass as many turbocharged toys as you can in overtake, avoid getting wiped out by the tide in escape and beat the clock in countdown. You’ll also take on bosses in multi-round elimination mode – have you got what it takes to beat the best?

Source: The Game Website.

192306.name: Yngarr (Issue 1 - Winter 2016)
rpgissuearticle: The Great Rift of the Aztragal Frenith
192306.description:
Publisher blurb:

The first issue describes some of the background history of the planet and descriptions on some of it's locations and inhabitants.

192307.name: The Walking Drunk
192307.description: The Walking Drunk is a social-interactive card game designed to create an unforgettable time with your friends. This game is part social interaction, using fun and creative activities to get players laughing and enjoying themselves, part drinking game including all sorts of alcohol related activities, and part board game including just enough strategy to keep the game moving along between activities. The Walking Drunk provides around two hours of gameplay for 3-8 players, although most probably you will run out of alcohol before you could finish the game.

192308.name: Rocket Lander
192308.description:
In the dice-based game Rocket Lander, players are challenged to plot a graph on a three-dimensional axis, with them escorting their ships, searching and overtaking opponents, and defending their home turf.

In more detail, each player controls a group of rockets exploring the vast world and outer space, and during play they plot information on an X, Y and Z-axis, then interpret that info to draw conclusions about what to do next.

192310.name: No Quarter (Issue 64 - Jan 2016)
192310.description:
No Quarter
Number 64
January 2016


Grolar (Guts & Gears)
Model Previews (Bloat Thrall Overseer Mobius & Bog Trog Trawler)
New Warmachine/Hordes Scenario (Fury of the Wurm)

192311.name: Fast & Fhtagn
192311.description:
Fast & Fhtagn is a component rich card game in which players jockey for position on crowded, dangerous city streets. As the pack hurtles through an ever-changing urban landscape, racers must squeeze out their adversaries, accumulate style points, and keep their vehicles running smoothly even as dangers rain down and other drivers plot inhuman violence against them.

Climb aboard your Cycle of Self Doubt. Open a canister of Hypnos Oxide. Plant a lucky kiss on your Perverse Bobblehead of Ulthar. If disaster strikes, perhaps there'll be a Welder Thing at the chop shop up ahead.

Be fast! Get fhtagn! Winners bask in glory, losers get fed to the Great Old Ones!

192312.description:
Each year Vernon Cabbagehead, Mr. Cabbagehead to his friends (who will be played by you), wants to be left in peace to grow his award winning vegetable garden for the annual Garden Club contest, but his tedious neighbors bother him so much that he needs to go on holiday to the beach several times during the summer months just to get away from them. When he is gone his neighbors drop by to “help themselves” to the garden produce. Can Mr. Cabbagehead succeed with his garden dreams and finally win the blue ribbon - all the while keeping his tiresome neighbors away?

In Mr. Cabbagehead's Garden, you will be placing vegetable cards in a grid of six cards by three cards, this being your garden plot. Of the 18 possible positions you will, by the end of the game, have at most 15 cards placed. The game is played in three phases:

1. The “Mr. Cabbagehead plants vegetables in the garden while his neighbors peer over the fence at him and make tedious and tiresome comments.” Phase

Deal the top three cards of the vegetable deck face up in front of you in a row. The leftmost card costs 1 Bee to plant (place one of the Bee tokens from your supply on the Beehive. If you do not have any Bees, you may not choose this card). The center card does not cost any Bees and is free to plant. The rightmost card can be planted for free as well, and as a bonus, you may take one of the Bees from the Beehive and add it to your supply (If Bees are not available on the Beehive you may not choose this card).

When planting the card you may place it anywhere in your garden plot. You may remove a card already in the plot and plant the new card in that position.

Cards may not otherwise be moved once planted. The grid of garden plot cards does not have fixed borders until the 6th card in a row is placed and/or the 3rd card in a column.

Of the two remaining drawn cards, locate the card with the highest Neighbor number. Draw a number of Tedious Neighbor tokens from the token area equal to the Tedious number on this card and place the drawn token(s) on the matching Tedious Neighbor card. Then place these two remaining cards off to one side. They will not be used again.

Repeat this phase until 15 cards have been drawn, 5 have been planted, and the On Vacation card is showing on top of the vegetable deck. Remove the On Vacation card and go to Phase 2.

2. The “Oh those vegetables look ripe! Be a shame to let the birds get them while Mr. Cabbagehead is on holiday. Maybe I should just pop over and grab a few for myself.” Phase

Whichever Tedious Neighbor card has the most tokens on it will determine which neighbor takes a vegetable card from the garden plot. The removed vegetable is placed off to once side and not used again, and all Tedious Neighbor tokens are shuffled back into the supply with their On Vacation side facing up.

The 1st and 2nd Phase will alternate until all 45 vegetable cards have been dealt and 15 cards have been planted (If you or your neighbors have removed cards during Phases 1 and 2 there may be fewer than 15 cards in your garden plot at this point).

3. The “Ms. Eudora Brassica and the Garden Club arrive to judge Mr. Cabbagehead’s garden for the annual Blue Ribbon Garden Contest.” Phase

Scoring of the garden plot now takes place. Vegetables only score if they are orthogonally adjacent to other matching vegetable cards. No single vegetables score any points.

For each vegetable type, the score equals: the point value x number of adjacent matching cards

For each vegetable you have removed from the garden plot subtract 2 points. Score each set of adjacent vegetables and then apply any Awards of Merit as shown on the back of Eudora’s card, adding them to your total.

You may score one or more awards if your garden plot matches the specific award requirements.
192312.name: Mr. Cabbagehead's Garden
boardgamepodcastepisode: 1P 099 - Project Dreamscape
If You Buy One Game - Relaxing Games
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 77!

192313.name: Villains & Dragons
192313.description:
User Summary:

All characters in the game are Villains. Character creation is entirely randomized, using die rolls to select Race, Class, and equipment. Character Attributes are then calculated by adding up incremental bonuses derived during random creation. Play then involves pursuing vendettas against other players, dueling, and delving.

The document formatting makes reading difficult.

192314.name: The Californian Job
192314.description:
User summary:

Characters have Attributes (Brawl, Reflex, Agility, Body, and Mind). Attributes have numeric values assigned from a points pool. Alternately, points can be used for equipment. The game uses dice rolls to resolve action resolution, though the actual resolution mechanic is not detailed in the rules.

boardgameintegration: The Undercity: An Iron Kingdoms Adventure Board Game
The Undercity: An Iron Kingdoms Adventure Board Game
192315.description:
Widower's Wood: An Iron Kingdoms Adventure Board Game is a cooperative, tile-based adventure game for up to four players that contains dozens of high-quality miniatures.

Gameplay takes place on a richly designed board with tiles that change from scenario to scenario, all accompanied by hundreds of tokens and cards for tracking the players' progress.

Widower's Wood is compatible The Undercity, making for a tremendous amount of replayability.
192315.name: Widower's Wood: An Iron Kingdoms Adventure Board Game

192316.name: Masks Beta Documents
192316.description:
From the Kickstarter page:
"Masks is a tabletop RPG about a team of young superheroes forging their own identities in Halcyon City, a megapolis packed with heroes.

If you’re not familiar with the Powered by the Apocalypse system, don’t fret! The full book of Masks will include much more information on playing the game, including instructions for setting up scenes, tips for the Gamemaster, and a more in-depth breakdown of all the important moves of the game. But if you're familiar with Apocalypse World or its derived games, you can try playing right away with these materials."
