This Beta PDF document consists of three files, 2 pages of basic moves, 4 pages of GM reference, and 10 playbooks.

192317.name: Sixth World
192317.description:
From the Introduction

Sixth World is a “hack” of the game Dungeon World which attempts to capture the flavor of the world of the well-known RPG Shadowrun.

The Sixth World is the dangerous and grim future of our own world, where magic has resurfaced, megacorporations rule the world, and humanity has perfected incredible new technological capabilities including advanced cybernetics and the worldwide virtual reality network called the Matrix.

This game assumes familiarity with Shadowrun, as well as with Dungeon World.

192318.name: Crafting Mama
192318.description:
User Summary:

A game where you are creating crafts by following the onscreen instructions in mini games. As you complete the items, you create pictures that are posted in "Mama's Gallery".

192319.description:
A Murder Most Fowl is a peculiar card game about crypto communication and people reading.

In A Murder Most Fowl, 2 or 3 teams of 2-players each (which means the game is played by either 4 or 6 players) compete against each other to solve the murder of Colonel Robin Poor, who is a bird of international importance.

3 investigation agencies will be racing each other to solve the murder, or to steal the solution from other agencies. Play either as Charlotte Holmes and Vet Watson from Dogland Yard, Agent Murder and Agent Scurry from Federal Beavers of Investigation (FBI, for short) or Inspector Purrouseau and Queen Cat'O from Brigade Félinationale de la Sécurité.

Before a game session, the teams meet in secret and devise strategies for crypto communication. The teams can use body language, singing, humming, tell obscure stories, remind each other of past memories, speak unintelligibly, in numbers or form sentences that make no sense at all to the other teams –but hopefully passes information amongst themselves.

To call a murder, the teams will need crypto-communication, since callling a murder involves combining a murder scenario with a suspect, a location and a weapon as a team. However the other team(s) must be unaware of your selections since the solution could very well be stolen from you.

The game is loosely inspired by the English nursery rhyme "Who Killed Cock Robin" – especially Henry Louis Stephens’ 1865 book version which is named; "Death and Burial of Poor Cock Robin".
192319.name: A Murder Most Fowl

192320.description:
Rory's Story Cubes: Doctor Who features nine dice with 54 images of characters and items from this classic television series. It can be played on its own or in combination with any or all of the other Story Cubes titles.

To play, roll all nine cubes of Rory's Story Cubes: Doctor Who, then create new stories with these iconic characters, whether for creative problem solving, language learning, or old-fashioned story-telling. Which alien is unleashing chaos on earth? What new puzzle confronts the Doctor and his companion? Where must the TARDIS go next?
192320.name: Rory's Story Cubes: Doctor Who

192321.description:
Rory's Story Cubes: Scooby Doo features nine dice with 54 images of these classic cartoon characters. It can be played on its own or in combination with any or all of the other Story Cubes titles.

To play, roll all nine cubes of Rory's Story Cubes: Scooby Doo, then create new mysteries with these iconic characters, whether for creative problem solving, language learning, or old-fashioned story-telling. Which monster is chasing Scooby and Shaggy? What clue has Velma discovered? Who is behind the fairground hauntings? Can anyone stop these meddling kids?!
192321.name: Rory's Story Cubes: Scooby Doo

192322.description:
Rory's Story Cubes: Looney Tunes features nine dice with 54 images of these classic cartoon characters. It can be played on its own or in combination with any or all of the other Story Cubes titles.

To play, roll all nine cubes of Rory's Story Cubes: Looney Tunes, then create new tales of these iconic characters, whether for creative problem solving, language learning, or old-fashioned story-telling. What trick is Bugs playing on Daffy? Which ACME gadget has backfired on Wile E. Coyote? Did Tweety really see a Puddy-Tat? Find out who gets up to mischief, and will Wile E. Coyote ever catch the elusive Roadrunner?
192322.name: Rory's Story Cubes: Looney Tunes

192323.description:
Rory's Story Cubes: Rescue is an expansion to the creativity game Rory's Story Cubes that contains three new dice with 18 thematic actions. It can be played on its own or in combination with any or all of the other Story Cubes titles.

Roll all three cubes of Rory's Story Cubes: Rescue to ignite tense tales of daring rescue, whether you're using this for creative problem solving, language learning, or story-telling.
192323.name: Rory's Story Cubes: Rescue

192324.description:
Rory's Story Cubes: Medieval is an expansion to the creativity game Rory's Story Cubes that contains three new dice with 18 thematic actions. It can be played on its own or in combination with any or all of the other Story Cubes titles.

Roll all three cubes of Rory's Story Cubes: Medieval to ignite weave classic tales of the middle ages, whether you're using this for creative problem solving, language learning, or story-telling.
192324.name: Rory's Story Cubes: Medieval

192325.name: Goblin Glory
192325.description:
Two players try to destroy each other's Core in a highly strategic battle by employing creatures, spells and dungeon upgrades.

Creatures can have up to three of eighteen special properties, such as Coward (roll a d20 to determine the success of an attack), but also Mug (steal Gold on attack). Spell Cards add one-time actions to potentially turn the game. Dungeon Upgrades not only provide utility (such as sacrificing cards to gain resources), but also let the player shuffle new cards through his deck.

Key novelty: build your deck while playing the game. This allows for a dynamic and strategic gameplay.

192326.name: Pyramid (Volume 3, Issue 87 - Jan 2016)
rpgissuearticle: Short Bursts: Ten Minutes in October
192326.description:
The Past Is Back, Better Than Ever!

Olden times come to life with new gaming goodness! This month's Pyramid - the PDF magazine for roleplayers - once again revisits the past, with fresh opportunities to discover intriguing treasures to enliven your pre-modern gaming. This month's timeless tome contains:


"The Broken Blade," an optional look at weapon quality in GURPS. Douglas H. Cole - author of GURPS Martial Arts: Technical Grappling - shows you how to ramp up the table's tension with the threat of a shattered sword . . . and the possibility of repairing it.
"Purveyors of the Priceless," a set of new possibilities that let you explore life as a low-tech trader in GURPS. Now you can barter for some loose gems, use new perks to help you flex your mercantile might, and even have a full-time job as a trader.
"Medieval Sea Trade," this month's Eidetic Memory offering from GURPS Fourth Edition co-author David Pulver. Sail the oceans in search of cargo and passengers, with a system adapted from GURPS Spaceships 2: Traders, Liners, and Transports.
"Knowledge Is Power," a look at those who kept the Chinese bureaucracy working. Your guide, Matt Riggsby - co-author of GURPS Low-Tech - shows what's required to enter the halls of power . . . including how to cheat your way in!
"The Music Maker," a primer on the master artisan known as Stradivarius. Discover the history of this unparalleled craftsman (with GURPS stats), revel in the insight about his legendary violins, and unleash the included story possibilities on your heroes.
"Tempered Punks," presenting some ideas for keeping would-be inventors from being too innovative in bygone days, from GURPS Crusades co-author Graeme Davis.


This issue also unveils a vignette by Pyramid Editor Steven Marsh set in the new Car Wars universe, and a Random Thought Table that gives you permission to break reality. This month's Pyramid shines such an inspiring candle on times gone by, you just might say this is an illuminated manuscript!

- Publisher's description

192327.name: Frantic Flip
192327.description:
Frantic Flip
12 Double-sided animal tiles and 1 board game! Which side of the tile to use to fill out the board? Sounds simple! you will be surprised! A challenging and fun game for the fast of sight and mind.

1. Each player receives 12 double sided animal tiles.
2. The game board is flipped and then each player tries to place all of his tiles on the designated spot on the board, filling it out.
3. Pay attention! the tiles are double sided so you might havet to switch sides to fill out the board! Be fast so you don’t waste time! whoever places all of his tiles first wins the game.

192329.name: On the Smolensk Road (Revised)
192329.description:
From publisher blurb:

The 1812 retreat from Moscow as a DramaSystem pitch

On the Smolensk Road began with a contest at RPG Geek run in April 2015. The contest was for a DramaSystem Pitch, and run by Yohann Delalande. The contest invited pitches in the style of those in Blood on the Snow, but there were no restrictions for theme or content.

I choose to write about Napoleon's invasion of Russia. The horrific retreat from Moscow is the most powerful episode in this period. During the retreat the collapsing French Army had to fight against the weather, the Russians and eventually their comrades as it became every man for himself. I believe this event makes for a compelling DramaSystem game.

Once I submitted my original entry, I quickly thought up some additional material which could be of interest to anyone running On the Smolensk Road. This extra material is included here, in an updated version of On the Smolensk Road. I have added in an essay about adding extra horror elements to the game. Alternatively, you may want to play a more fantasy version of the setting, outlined in Fantasy & Flintlocks.

This pdf features:

Background information, character outlines, thematic suggestions, names and more, per the usual DramaSystem style
BONUS - Horror on the Smolensk Road, five additional themes to add an element of horror to your game
BONUS - Fantasy & Flintlocks, seven ways to add magic to this Napoleonic game

192330.name: Magesty
192330.description:
From publisher blurb:

All this are facts:

More than five hundred years ago Ark brought the last Dorians to Earth in deep Sleep.
Fifteen years ago Ark put all his race’s future in the hands of the worst kind of psychopath his planet had ever produced.
After that, it decided to holler their most bitter enemies in the whole universe so they can come and destroy them;




then it woke Aaren and asked her to save them all.

Aaren got furious for a minute, despaired for another two and then she rolled up her metaphorical sleeves.




She had to mop the whole mess up somehow.

It is not going to be easy.

Magesty is a character ready to be used with the Mutants & Masterminds Third Edition System but it would be really easy to adapt it to any other superhero rule-system.
She is an Alien Queen witha mission and artifact fueled super-powers.

This product includes original art for the character and 14 pages full of content including:

ORIGIN STORY
CHARACTER DESCRIPTION
ROLEPLAYING HINTS
RELATED INFO
MUTANTS AND MASTERMINDS 3RD EDITION FULL CHARACTER SHEET (ready to use, PL 10).




This book presents a new golden eyed space-race and origin for characters and also two nemesis for Magesty. It's our intention to develop this setting with more content and sourcebooks, villains, etc. ready to be used with MAGESTY.

192331.name: Amber Waves of Grain
192331.description:
From the publishers website:

They’re Bawling about You Down on the Farm

The Chicago sprawl is host to all manner of strange creatures—ghouls, toxic spirits, hellhounds, barghests, and chickens. Yes, chickens. The city is mostly urbanized, but there are also large swathes of vacant land, and some enterprising souls have been farming that land. This is the Sixth World, though, which means that whenever you have someone trying something bold, you have a dozen other people thinking, “How can I use that to hurt other people?”

The runners are going to have some unusual jobs on this mission, including spreading some poisons and making sure innocent lives are spared (if they’re so inclined). They’ll have to be on their toes to steer clear of the authorities, get all the pieces of this particular scheme in place, and in particular answer the pressing question: Just what is Mr. Johnson up to?

Amber Waves of Grain continues the latest Shadowrun Missions plotline set in Chicago. Whether you played other Chicago Missions, including the first one in this plotline (Ten Fifty-Seven) or are just launching into the series, this Mission provides plenty of action packed into a single adventure.

Amber Waves of Grain is for use with Shadowrun, Fifth Edition.

192332.name: Reborn (M&M3)
192332.description:
From publisher blurb:

People say that heroes are born, not made.

Jacob is the living proof that is not true.

He was Reborn to rise from a doomed existence to become a true hero. A priest gave him an option to be Reborn into an improved self and he took it without thinking it twice. Now he acts as a mythical urban angel of justice and nobody knows who he is or where does he came from. Sometimes not even himself.

Reborn's origin is shrouded in mystery and nobody, not even him, is quite sure if its Godly or not. He certainly hopes so, and tries to act accordingly.

This character is ready to be used with the Mutants & Masterminds Third Edition System but it would be really easy to adapt it to any other superhero rule-system.

This product includes original art for the character (with an alternative non-Christian version for those who may prefer it) and 9 pages full of content including:

ORIGIN STORY
CHARACTER DESCRIPTION
ROLEPLAYING HINTS
RESOURCES
M%M FULL CHARACTER SHEET (ready to use!).
+4 OTHER STORY RELATED SECTIONS (related characters, background info, etc).

192333.name: Reborn (Fate)
192333.description:
From publisher blurb:

People say that heroes are born, not made.

Jacob is the living proof that is not true.

He was Reborn to rise from a doomed existence to become a true hero. A priest gave him an option to be Reborn into an improved self and he took it without thinking it twice. Now he acts as a mythical urban angel of justice and nobody knows who he is or where does he came from. Sometimes not even himself.

Reborn's origin is shrouded in mystery and nobody, not even him, is quite sure if its Godly or not. He certainly hopes so, and tries to act accordingly.

This character is ready to be used with the FATE System but it would be really easy to adapt it to any other superhero rule-system.

This product includes original art for the character (with an alternative not Christian version for those who may prefer it) and 9 pages full of content including:

ORIGIN STORY
CHARACTER DESCRIPTION
ROLEPLAYING HINTS
RESOURCES
FATE SYSTEM FULL CHARACTER SHEET (ready to use with 3 new stunts!).
+4 OTHER STORY RELATED SECTIONS (related characters, background info, etc).

192334.description:
Vikings on Board is a family-strategy/worker-placement game in which your objective is to set sail with your clan of Vikings on board the ships best supplied for a successful voyage, while simultaneously placing bets on which clan you think will control each ship as they set sail.

Ships are divided into three sections: the front (bow), the middle (body), and the end (stern). During the course of the game, you will place supplies on the ships’ bows, while moving around their body pieces so that your clan has majority control of a ship when it sets sail. Stern pieces are used to show which ships have already set sail.

Each turn, the active player will perform one of the remaining available actions. Actions include: taking first pick of actions next round, rearranging ships' pieces (x4), placing bets on ships (x2), adding supplies to a ship (x2), increasing the value of supplies in the market, or setting sail.

When a ship sets sail, players will share its supplies in order of how many times their clan's shield appears on the body pieces of that ship. Starting with the player with the most shields, players will claim a supply token of their choice from the bow of the ship and place it facedown on their scoring circle. These supply tokens will score points based on their value in the market at the end of the game. Additionally, if a player placed a bet on the clan that had majority control of the ship, then they take their winning bet and place it facedown on their scoring circle.

The game ends after seven ships have set sail. Players calculate their final scores by adding together the value of their supply tokens with the value of their winning bets. The player with the most points wins.
192334.name: Vikings on Board
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 022 – Origins 2016
Episode 78- My Village and GenCon 2016 Preview
The Game Pit: Episode 70 - Spiel 2016 Treasure Hunt Part 1

192335.name: Werewolf: the Forsaken 2nd Edition Condition Cards
192335.description:
From publisher blurb:

Part of the Werewolf: the Forsaken 2nd Edition rules, Conditions add an additional layer of consequence and reward to certain actions in the Chronicles of Darkness. Various things within the course of a game can cause Conditions. These include exceptional successes, supernatural abilities, and really any situation where the Storyteller thinks they can be used to heighten the drama of a game.

These Werewolf: the Forsaken 2nd Edition Condition Cards are a handy way to keep track of and incorporate Conditions into your Chronicle with each of the 41 cards featuring a single Condition.

192336.name: Chronicles of Darkness Condition, Numina, and Dread Power Cards
192336.description:
From publisher blurb:

Part of the new Chronicles of Darkness rules, Conditions add an additional layer of consequence and reward to certain actions in the Chronicles of Darkness. Various things within the course of a game can cause Conditions. These include exceptional successes, supernatural abilities, and really any situation where the Storyteller thinks they can be used to heighten the drama of a game.

Also available in this deck are brand new Numina and Dread Powers cards featuring these rules from the Chronicles of Darkness rulebook for ease of reference at the table.

192337.name: Eidolons
192337.description:
From publisher blurb:

Call creatures to your summoner's side like never before with Everyman Unchained: Eidolons by Everyman Gaming, LLC! Everyman Unchained: Eidolons is packed with over 40 pages of all-new options for summoners looking to conjure the perfect companion for any adventure, and includes content such as:

12 pages of all-new evolutions based upon existing universal monster abilities as well as the unique powers and traits of certain monsters, such as advanced golem evolutions, fey magic, blood drain, and many more.
15 all-new subtypes for eidolons, including loyal foo creatures, destructive qlippoths, enlightned manasuptras, devious rakshasas, and many more!
Rules that allow summoners to call eidolons of different creature types, including options that grant summoners access to eidolons of the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game's most popular monsters.
And much, much more!

192338.name: Shadows in Focus: City by Shadow - San Francisco Metroplex
192338.description:
From the publishers website:

When the Lights Go Down

Money? Check. Political turmoil leading to scrambling for power? You bet. Megacorps jockeying for position while working to take their rivals down a notch? Of course! A festering hive of corruption set next to one of the most scenic bays ever colonized by humans? Absolutely! San Francisco has all of the ingredients needed to make a nice, festering stew for shadowrunners. With the former imperialistic fascist General Saito out of power and the entire bay area united as a single sprawl, there is power and money to be had, which means business in the shadows is booming. San Francisco is a shadowrunner’s guide to the people, places, and plots that make up this city, providing the paydata they need to navigate the hilly streets and cruel back roads of a sprawl whose aura of sophistication can’t mask its deadly heart.

With information on getting into and around the city, notable locations across the sprawl, and plot hooks to keep runners busy, San Francisco is an indispensable aid to Shadowrun players looking to bring their skills to the city by the bay.

San Francisco is part of the City by Shadow series of e-books focusing on cities across the Sixth World and is for use with Shadowrun, Fifth Edition.

192339.name: Paranormal Adventures
192339.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unearth ancient secrets, tap powers long forgotten or hidden, and delve into the unknown using Paranormal Adventures, by Everyman Gaming, LLC. Designed for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, Paranormal Adventures allows players to tap into esoteric forces while similtaneously giving GMs the tools they need to infuse their campaigns with ancient rituals of immense power and horrific creatures better left forgotten.

Paranormal Adventures includes:

Two all-new 20-level base classes inspired by the new occult classes from Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Occult Adventures.
New archetypes and class options for characters associated with the occult.
New feats and character traits.
Favored class options for characters who master the powers of the adaptive shapeshifter and the enigmatic vessel.
Simple creature templates and class templates that allow GMs to make any monster into a shapeshifter or a vessel, or that simply allow the monster to walk among mortals undetected.
Levialogi, horrific monsters born from the fetid blood of an ancient evil.
Tips for running an investigation-style adventure themed around the occult and paranormal.
And much, much more!

192340.name: Argus
192340.description:
From publisher blurb:

Do you wanna know a secret? If its small and personal, that's pretty much on you. But if its nasty and important, or well-hidden and expensive for the people hiding it, Well then, Argus is the person you hire to get it. Maybe someone's already hired him to find out your secrets. Like real identities behind those masks. Or weaknesses. Interested yet? Too bad. Your enemies certainly are.

Argus is a PL 10 threat to add to your Mutants & Masterminds campaign.

192341.name: Astral Deva
192341.description:
From publisher blurb:

Since the release of the first bestiary, the first monster book, there have been those who asked - can I play something exotic, can I play a monster instead of a regular character?

This is the first release in the Monster Classes series, that gives you that opportunity, to shoulder the mantle of being a true angel, a divine warrior born to protect others, whose very essence is supernatural. No mere mortal, these angels help defend their domains from demons and devils, yet every path begins somewhere. Take the first steps on the path to becoming a complete astral deva with this book, then complete your journey and embrace your destiny.

This book includes the astral deva class together with associated feats necessary to build interesting and diverse angels, that at the same time are true to the concept presented in the Bestiary. Enjoy!

rpg: Lair of Sword & Sorcery Adventure Game
192342.name: Lair of Sword & Sorcery Core Rules Compilation
192342.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Lair of Sword & Sorcery (LoSS) Core rules compilation.

This compilation of the first 5 issues of the loss magazine comprise the core rules of the LoSS adventure game.

A rules lite Sword & Sorcery Rpg based in the Snowy Winterlands of the World of Kartharka.

The game takes place on a 3d dungeon battlemap and in the first section of the book you'll find out how to make one yourself for only a few dollars.

Character creation is a points buy classless system allowing the heroes to grow as they choose.

Magic in the LoSS game is primarily through sorcery, the summoning and control of spirits and demons. With rules to allow your heroes to command these powers for good or evil.

This compiliation is a collection of the first 5 issues of the magazine, unedited and presented in exactly the same way as originally printed.

192343.name: Bubblee Pop
boardgamepodcastepisode: 19. Devon Dice Dreaming to Essen trip 2016, Top 10 wants to Buys
192343.description:
Description from the publisher:

Align them all! In Bubblee Pop, players compete head-to-head to save Bubblees by aligning three of them horizontally or vertically. Once aligned, the Bubblees give the player points and trigger special powers. If you pile them the wrong way, though, you risk losing the game immediately.

192344.name: Booo!
192344.description:
Description from the publisher:

Who is going to be the fastest ghost? Take the corridors and the secret passages, pass through the walls and change colors to find the right path and scare «Blackrock Castle»’s visitors.

192345.name: Keskifé?
192345.description:
Description from the publisher:

In Keskifé?, all players but one — either individually or in teams — carry out an action that all players but one know about. Can the buffoon, the sole player unaware of what's going on, imitate the others successfully without disclosing their identity?

192346.description:
Description from the publisher:

“In space, no one can hear you bleat.”
Edenia, a sheep-racing game for guaranteed cosmic effects!
This is the hour of great start to Edenia, a legendary planet of infinite pastures. Explore space, visit the wonderful planets, discover the forgotten artifacts and find the fastest route to be the big winner on Edenia.
192346.name: Edenia
boardgamepodcastepisode: [Essen 2016] Bioviva – Edenia – Plateau de jeux – Legends of Luma

192347.name: A day at the track
192347.description:
A day at the track is a Grid Movement/Dice rolling 9 card game about horse racing. The game is made up of 9 double-sided cards that consist of different sections of the race track. As you move around the track you will move these card section around to produce a full race track. Each player has his own d6 and two tokens; one to represent his/her horse on the track and the other to represent the Jockey Boost token.

Components:
[9 cards] - on [1] A4 letter size Double sided PDF sheet
[1] - A4 Letter size Double sided PDF sheet - Rules
[4] - d6 dice [1 Green, 1 Blue, 1 Yellow and 1 Red]
[8] - Wood cubes - [2 Green, 2 Blue, 2 Yellow and 2 Red]

GAME PLAY:
It's racing day is played in turns with each player rolling his/her d6 and moving his horse token the same number of spaces, as rolled on the d6, around the track. The player with the lowest die roll moves his/her horse token first, which also means that player could roll the lowest die and still cross the finish line before a player with a higher dice roll!

On each turn a player can decide to use one of his two Jockey Boost actions, which would allow the player to reroll his/her d6. If a player decides to take this action the move their Jockey Boost token on the 1st token space and rerolls their d6 die. The player MUST use this new roll, even if it is less than the previous roll, to move his/her horse token around the track. Each player is only allowed a maximum of two Jockey boosts per game.

CROSSING THE FINISH LINE:
As the players get closer to the finish line each die roll becomes critical. Since the player with the lowest die results moves first, this player could cross the finish line before a player who is closer but rolls a higher number!

If two or more players roll the same number they move there pieces at the same time. If those two or more players can all cross the finish line with their die results, the player that is closest to the finish line will cross first followed by the next closest player and so on.

The BLUE player is one space away from winning. The RED player is two spaces away from winning and the GREEN and YELLOW players are both three spaces away from winning. The following dice results are rolled: BLUE=5, GREEN=3, RED =3, and YELLOW=1. Since the YELLOW player rolled the lowest die roll he/she moves first but still doesn't cross the finish line. Since the BLUE player rolled the highest die roll he moves last. Now we come to the RED and GREEN players who both rolled 3, which means they move their horse tokens at the same time. Since the RED player is one space closer to the finish line, he/she ends up crossing the finish line one length ahead of the GREEN player. The results so far are RED player comes in 1st, the GREEN player comes in 2nd, and the BLUE and YELLOW players still need to take another turn to finish the race.

ADVANCED GAME PLAY:
It's racing day can also be played with an ADVANCED race track layout by using the Hedge cards. Hedge cards add an hazardous obstacle to the game. Whenever a player tries to jump over a HEDGE space and they roll a 5 or 6, their speed is too fast, causing their horse to stumble and slow down. The player must immediately stop their horse token directly beyond the hedge space and lose their next turn. A player could avoid this roll by using their Jockey Boost action but if the second roll is low enough to prevent them from reaching the hedge, they would still have to roll again on the next turn to try and clear the hedge.

WINNING THE GAME:
To win the game a player's horse token must be the first to pass the finish line before any other player! As each player passed the finish line they will place their horse token in the corresponding winners box. Each player continues to roll his d6 until he passes the finish line and his/her horse token is placed in one of the four winners boxes.

192348.description:
Never put a Dark Elf and an Orc in the same room — unless you're playing Epic PvP: Fantasy, that is! With Epic PVP: Fantasy Expansion 1, you can add the devious Dark Elf and the easily peeved Orc races to your games of Epic PvP: Fantasy as well as the disciplined Monk and the brutal Barbarian classes. These new and unique decks are fully compatible with all previous Epic PvP: Fantasy decks, allowing for some powerful (and sometimes ridiculous) new character combinations.

Get back to the arena as the battle is on!
192348.name: Epic PVP: Fantasy Expansion 1

192349.name: Risky Adventure
192349.description:
Description from the publisher:

In the dice-rolling game Risky Adventure, players embark on expeditions and try to find rare artifacts in an undiscovered world. Each player assumes the role of three adventurers trying to roll the right dice combination to get equipment, discover artifacts, and find new and mysterious places. The trick: Players have to mark the things they want to roll for with their adventurers before they actually roll the dice. Assessing the risk, using the right equipment, and finding the best locations to place the adventurers will be key to win a game of Risky Adventure.

192350.name: Tiger Hell
192350.description:
User Summary

Tiger Hell is a shoot'em-up for Commodore 64. The game was made by The Sarge (Joachim Ljunggren) of Triad.

The game is an unauthorized clone of Tiger-Heli.

The game is a vertical scrolling shoot'em up there the player controls a helicopter. The mission is to fly thru enemy territory to the home base, shooting down tanks and ships etc. Then the player reach homebase the game loop back to the beginning.

The game was made using SEUCK, but has graphics and music on the title screen, that other SEUCK titles didn't have.

192351.description:
Description from the publisher:

Dive into the world of master builders and construct monumental buildings of historic significance.

In each game of World Monuments, you and your fellow players choose one of four buildings and start constructing it from the ground up: The Capitol in Washington, the Notre Dame cathedral in Paris, the basilica San Pietro in Rome, or the Taj Mahal mausoleum in Agra. Only the most talented master builder among the players gains many points and has a chance of winning the game, after the building is completed.
192351.name: World Monuments
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Game Pit Podcast: Episode 61 - 2016 Treasure Hunt Part 1

192352.description:
Description from the publisher:

In Super-Vampire, the evildoer Dr. Garlic has set his evil plan in motion to place garlic everywhere in the freshly cleaned crypt! This means you need to hurry and get rid of all the garlic before sunrise. Luckily, super vampires keep special garlic-eating pets called "Gorlocs" inside their towers, but Gorlocs don't like to run or walk or do just about anything other than eat garlic, so you must fly around the crypt and collect all the garlic to bring it back to the tower before sunrise.
192352.name: Super-Vampire
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Game Pit Podcast: Episode 63 - UK Games Expo 2016

192353.name: Spooky Castle
192353.description:
Description from the publisher:

In Geisterburg, players take turns in the role of Spooky, a ghost being led by the other ghosts through a castle on a treasure hunt.

In more detail, the player who is Spooky is blindfolded by donning a mask, then they start poking around Geisterburg with a magnetic pole, with their fellow players offering advice on where to move and (possibly) what to avoid given that adult ghosts can also be found within the castle and the kids want to leave them alone in order to find what they need before time runs out!

192354.name: Monsternomicon: Kyuss and His Faithful
192354.description:
From publisher blurb:

Whispers have emerged that The Worm That Walks is returning to Faerun. Contained in the following pages can be found a summary of the heralds of Kyuss, as well as optional rules for characters that may find themselves beholden to the harbinger of the final apocalypse.

Includes 3 new creatures, one new cleric domain, and adventure seeds to get your characters moving along their new, dark path.

192355.description:
Rory's Story Cubes: Powers is an expansion to the creativity game Rory's Story Cubes that contains three new dice with 18 thematic actions. It can be played on its own or in combination with any or all of the other Story Cubes titles.

Roll all three cubes of Rory's Story Cubes: Powers to spark super-powered stories of heroic adventure, whether you're using this for creative problem solving, language learning, or story-telling.
192355.name: Rory's Story Cubes: Powers

192356.description:
A small expansion that can be added to Xenoshft: Onslaught or the Xenoshyft: Dreadmire.

This hellscape world’s inhabitants have evolved to survive it’s blazing temperatures, and the Xenosathem NorTec craves has only made the aliens a bigger threat. These new foes are known as the Cinderkin and are ready to burn NorTec’s efforts to the ground. A new Fire Tracker is being introduced that will increase enemy abilities and threaten the very base itself as the fire progresses.

Of course, NorTec won’t just stand idly by. It’s developed some new special items that will help on this terrible world. These Emergency Supply Items differ from the equipment you’re familiar with because they are available to everyone at the start of the game and only come with one charge, requiring resources to be put into them to recharge.

Xenoshyft: Immolation comes with the following:

52 Wave 1 Cinderkin Enemies
52 Wave 2 Cinderkin Enemies
52 Wave 3 Cinderkin Enemies
3 Emergency Supply Item Cards
1 Fire Tracker Card
1 Plastic Fire Counter
192356.name: XenoShyft: Immolation

192357.description:
Board football team management game. Matches, players trading, random and non-random events determine the ultimate champion.
The players starts witn an amount of 40 million euros and obtain players with a range of 5-9 ability. As more the ability as much the money needed for buying. After that the players (if want) expand the capacity of their soccer field so they can sell more tickets on the home matches they play. The match is played by one dice and the winner gets 3 points instead of 1 for tie and 0 for lose. The winner is the player who gets winning points with the follow system .
10 winning points for the champion
5 winning points for the second place in the championship
6 winning points forr the Cup winner
2 winning points for the Cup finalist.
0,5 points for every 1.000.000 remain in the final treasury of the team.
In the middle of the season the players can change and axchange players.

Also there are random facts with cards that can change the rank of the players.

Επιτραπέζιο παιχνίδι διαχείρισης ποδοσφαιρικής ομάδας. Αγώνες, αγοραπωλησίες παικτών, τυχαία και μη γεγονότα καθορίζουν τον τελικό πρωταθλητή.

Giocco dal tavolo gestione della squadra. Giochi, negoziazione giocatore, casuali e non casuali eventi determinano il campione finale.
192357.name: Football Managers

192358.name: Octask System Rules
192358.description:
User summary:

Characters in the system have seven standard Qualities (Attributes), including Brawn, Durability, Finesse, Acumen, Awareness, Conviction, and Influence. Qualities have numeric Ratings from 1-7. Characters also have Statistics that are game traits, including Grip, Knockdown, Speed, Knowledge, Progression, Courage, and Social Armor. Characters adapt to specific genres by using some subset of fourteen Capabilities (somewhat like Skills), with Ratings from 1-4 allocated from a points pool. Damage is tracked using a numerical Wound Level chart.

The Octask System contemplated eight separate genre systems utilizing the same core mechanics. The six systems actually noted were:

Dark Places - Supernatural evil in a modern setting
Supragen - Super heroes and science fiction
Winterblood - Dark medieval swords, sorcery, and ice
Clockwork Dissonance - Postmodern ecological apocalypse
Red Cube - 1950s Communist earth
Portalis Draconum - Dragons




However, none of these systems emerged beyond the conceptual or initial design stages except for Dark Places which was reworked into a standalone game (not using the Octask System Rules). Winterblood, Red Cube, and Portalis Draconum also are featured in the author's novel series Spiralchain.

192359.name: Octask System Standard Character Sheet
192359.description:
User summary:

Characters in The Octask System are quite complex in build with numerous groups and types of numeric ratings. The Standard Character Sheet tracks all of these aspects using a dense but functional layout which supports wound tracking. The Standard Character Sheet was published independently of the main rules and was intended to support any of the games' intended genres.

The second page features a traditional layout focused on equipment, weapons, armor, and character notes.

192360.name: Itras By Download Chance Cards
192360.description:
User summary:

This free, basic print-and-play card set supports game play basics. It should not be confused with the expanded "full" deck of published commercial cards that form a complete pack.

The product includes eight cards on each page, faces only, totaling 32 cards in the free deck.

192361.name: FAITH: the Sci-Fi RPG – Player Deck
192361.description:
From the publisher website:
The Player Deck is an original deck of poker cards with custom suit symbols and 52 uniquely illustrated cards with scenes from the Universe of FAITH, plus two Joker Cards.

rpgseries: Far Away Land RPG Adventure Module
192362.name: Serpent's Peak
192362.description:
From publisher blurb:

Serpent's Peak is a Far Away Land RPG dungeon adventure that takes place inside the Serpent's Peak. This adventure features an open adventure with location descriptions, treasure chart, trap chart, and random encounter chart along with a big 12x18 inch map. Everything on one page (be it a fairly large page). Also contained within this pdf is a second map (absent of text) which allows GMs and players to come up with their own adventures using the map by itself.

192363.name: Dungeons & Vigilantes
192363.description:
User summary:

Using similar mechanics to its sister game Vigilantes & Dragons, Dungeons & Vigilantes character creation entirely is randomized, resulting in rapid characters with Race, Class, and Equipment. Character Attributes then are derived based on the earlier randomization.

Characters may pursue Vendettas and Duel, in addition to dungeon Delving.

192365.name: Dungeon Squad: Yet Another Variant
192365.description:
User summary:

Dungeon Squad: Yet Another Variant presents several optional rules and additional abilities to alter the play of the basic game. Or, as the introduction states: "The rules are the same as in the original Dungeon Squad except as listed."

192366.name: The 72 Curses of Caliph Asrar
192366.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Caliph Asrar is a powerful sorcerer who can grant your heart's desire. And he will...but first, you must prove yourself worthy. You must, for a single week, become a Royal Curse Tester. Each day you will receive a new curse. Each day you must deal with the curse with dignity and honor. Should you last those seven days, without going mad or losing face, the curses will be removed, and your desire will be granted. But those who do lose face, ah, they are to remain cursed for the rest of their not-so-natural lives. Is the risk worth it? Many would agree. Some would not. Are you willing to prove yourself worthy and gain your heart’s desire, no matter the cost?

192367.description:
Ticket to Ride™: Japan is a fan-made expansion to the Days of Wonder, Inc. Ticket to Ride™ series created by Alan R. Moon. A tribute both to Ticket to Ride™ and the country of Japan, this expansion is designed for players who are already well familiar with Ticket to Ride™’s standard gameplay and mechanics.

Published by permission for non-commercial use. All rights to the Ticket to Ride™ name, gameplay, mechanics, and imagery are reserved by Days of Wonder, Inc., who have not endorsed or playtested this expansion.
192367.name: Japan (fan expansion to Ticket To Ride)

192368.name: Excalibur: The Complete Guide
192368.description:
User summary:

Characters in Excalibur have Race, Attributes, and Class defined at creation. Race and Class provide Attribute modifications. Characters have a variety of derived or secondary game statistics. While the rules are fairly traditional they are also complete and playable. The document includes a basic spell list and a variety of monsters.

rpgitemversion: El Tesoro de los Gigantes PDF Version
192370.name: El Tesoro de los Gigantes
192370.description:
From publisher blurb:

"El tesoro de los gigantes" fue una de las cuatro aventuras ganadoras del concurso de premódulos de Walhalla celebrado en el verano de 2014. Obtuvo la máxima puntuación otorgada por un jurado en el que figuraron Jorge Coto Bautista "Tiberio", Antonio Lozano Lubián e Ignacio Sánchez Aranda.

Se trata de una aventura de tipo lineal ambientada en Inglaterra, con una historia bien trenzada, que contiene algunas secuencias verdaderamente emocionantes. Debido a la gran cantidad de acción que presenta, se puede considerar bastante letal. "El tesoro de los gigantes" suele completarse en dos o tres sesiones de juego.


Translation courtesy of Google:

"The Treasure of the giants" was one of four winners of the contest premódulos adventures of Walhalla held in the summer of 2014. He received the highest score given by a jury which included Jorge Coto Baptist "Tiberius", Antonio Lozano and Lubián Ignacio Sanchez Aranda.

It is a linear adventure set in England, with a well-woven story that contains some truly exciting sequences. Due to the large amount of action presents, it can be considered quite lethal. "The Treasure of the giants" is usually completed in two or three sessions of play.

rpgitemversion: El Pulso de los Dioses PDF Version
192371.name: El Pulso de los Dioses
192371.description:
From publisher blurb:

Una terrible hambruna se extiende por el reino de Dinamarca. Los padres de los personajes, duros granjeros, se ven obligados a enviarlos a la gran ciudad de Heidabýr. Allí los muchachos encuentran trabajo en la casa de uno de los artesanos más célebres de la urbe, Anund el fabricante de peines. Por su taller pasan dos poderosos hombres del reino: Vagn Styrmirsson, hombre de confianza de Beli "el Gordo" (jarl gobernador de la plaza de Heidabýr), y Poppo, el sacerdote cristiano de la ciudad. Pronto cae enfermo el jarl Beli, ocasión que aprovecha Poppo para intentar convertirlo a la fe de Cristo.


Translation courtesy of Google:

A terrible famine is sweeping the kingdom of Denmark. Parents of characters, hard farmers are forced to send them to the great city of Heidabýr. There are boys work in the house of one of the most famous craftsmen of the city, combs Anund manufacturer. By his workshop spend two powerful men in the kingdom Styrmirsson Vagn, a confidant of Beli "Gordo" ( Earl governor Heidabýr Square) and Poppo, Christian priest of the city. Soon he falls ill the Earl Beli, Poppo occasion fail to try to turn to the faith of Christ.

rpgitemversion: La Caceria de los Cwn Annwn PDF Version
192372.name: La Caceria de los Cwn Annwn
192372.description:
From publisher blurb:

Los personajes forman parte del clan Mac Arailt, vikingos originalmente daneses que llevan un par de generaciones afincados en las Hébridas Interiores. Comienza el verano de 967 y, como últimamente en estas fechas, viajan a la Isla de Man para reunirse con los vikingos de ese reino, compañeros de saqueo a los britones de Anglesey, en el norte de Gales. Impaciente por iniciar el strandhögg, Maccus Haraldsson, hermano de algunos de los personajes, se embarca en un langskip junto con algunos vikingos del reino de Man para llevar a cabo un reconocimiento del terreno mientras los personajes realizan los preparativos para el saqueo propiamente dicho. Pero el langskip retorna precipitadamente, devolviendo a Maccus malherido e inconsciente. El mal que le arrastra al inframundo parece provenir de la "Caza Salvaje" que los britones de Gales han convocado como respuesta a los saqueos. La única manera de salvarlo parece ser rastrear a los perros de la muerte comandados por Arawn, el dios guerrero del inframundo de las creencias galesas, y hacerse con un antídoto para el veneno druídico que inunda la sangre de Maccus. El problema es que este plan no cuente con el beneplácito del mismísimo jarl de la Isla de Man...


Translation courtesy of Google:

The characters are part of the clan Mac Arailt, originally Danish Vikings carrying a couple of generations based in the Inner Hebrides. Start the summer of 967 and, lately at this time, travel to the Isle of Man to meet with the Vikings of that kingdom, looting fellow Britons of Anglesey in north Wales. Impatient to start the strandhögg , Maccus Haraldsson, brother of some of the characters, embarks on a langskip along with some vikings kingdom of Man to carry out a reconnaissance while the characters make preparations for the looting itself. But langskip returns precipitously, returning Maccus wounded and unconscious. The evil that drags him to the underworld seems to come from the "Wild Hunt" that the Britons of Wales have called in response to looting. The only way to save seems to track the dogs led by Arawn death, the warrior god of the underworld of the Welsh beliefs, and gain an antidote to the poison that floods Druidic blood Maccus. The problem is that this plan does not have the approval of the very earl of the Isle of Man ...

rpgitemversion: El Señor del Fiordo PDF Version
192373.name: El Señor del Fiordo
192373.description:
From publisher blurb:

Los inviernos son duros en la región de Dofrafjöll, Noruega, y este de 931 no parece que vaya a ser una excepción. Sobre todo después de una campaña de strandhögg no especialmente productiva para la comarca donde habitan los personajes. En estos días, colaboran con el constructor de drekar de la zona, en donde se vive básicamente de la pesca, en concreto de la captura de salmón y bacalao. Dicho constructor de barcos, que recibe el nombre de Ámund Herison, no es otro que el padre de alguno de los personajes, así como el tío de otros de ellos. Su destreza a la hora de construir barcos es tal, que desde hace ya unos años el mismísimo hersir de una próspera aldea de Dofrafjöll le viene encargando unos langskip con los que engrosar la pequeña armada que emplea en los saqueos veraniegos.

Así comienza la nueva aventura básica de Antonio Lozano para Walhalla, el juego de rol de la Plena Edad Media. En realidad, se trata de una historia sencilla pero muy especial, ya que el tiempo transcurre en ella de forma diferente a como suele hacerlo en el resto de módulos de Walhalla. La trama puede llegar a desarrollarse a lo largo de varios años de tiempo de juego, y sirve a la perfección para enmarcar el proceso de maduración definitivo de los jóvenes vikingos que son los personajes. La aventura, presuntamente básica, es un verdadero esqueleto de campaña para Walhalla.


Translation courtesy of Google:

Winters are harsh in the region Dofrafjöll, Norway, 931 and this is unlikely to be an exception. Especially after a campaign of strandhögg not particularly productive for the region inhabited by the characters. These days, working with the builder drekar in the area where you live basically of fishing, specifically catching salmon and cod. This boat builder who called Amund Herison, is none other than the father of one of the characters, and the other guy them. His skill at building ships is such that some years ago the very hersir of a thriving village Dofrafjöll it is commissioning a langskip with which swell the small army that used in the summer looting.

Thus the new basic adventure Antonio Lozano to Walhalla, the RPG of the High Middle Ages begins. Actually, it is a simple but very special story, as time passes it differently as it usually does in other modules Walhalla form. The plot may develop over several years of playing time, and serves perfectly to frame the final maturation process of young Vikings are the characters. Adventure, allegedly basic skeleton is a true campaign to Walhalla.

192374.name: Question Time
192374.description:
"Welcome to Question time! A game of Australian politics, political history, intrigue and rat cunning. Every player has a chance to win whether you have been cabinet minister, a student of political science, a member of the press, a regular punter or just voted in your first election. This is politics, the idea is not to be nice to your opponents but to beat them - at any cost - just like the real thing!"--Box.

A mix of trivia game, hand management and strategy, 2 or more players or teams move around the board (the seating layout of the Chamber) using dice (if on the Backbench) and a spinner (if on the Frontbench). The aim of the game is to present three Acts to parliament. An Act is three cards of a particular type, gained when on the Frontbench. When on the Backbench, players also draw Question Time and Stuffups & Scandals cards (general knowledge), Party Room and Press Gallery cards (luck), and filibuster cards (must speak for 60 seconds for or against the motion on the card).

rpgitemversion: La Llave de Carne PDF Version
192376.name: La Llave de Carne
192376.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tras un invierno lleno de relatos junto al fuego, tinieblas y algunas añoranzas, por fin los días se estiran considerablemente y los drekar se sacan de las atarazanas con el propósito de iniciar cuanto antes la campaña de strandhögg. La comunidad en la que residen los PJ bulle de actividad. Todos colaboran en los preparativos. Este año, la máxima autoridad del lugar ha decidido que se perseguirán objetivos más ambiciosos, descendiendo por la costa occidental franca en busca de los buenos botines de la región de Guyena (actual Aquitania francesa). Para ello, la flotilla local, compuesta por una decena de naves, se unirá a un contingente mayor, comandado por el famoso jarl danés Skarphedinn "Barba de Hierro", que dirige una armada de casi treinta embarcaciones. El punto de reunión de unos y otros es la ciudad de Ribe, en el litoral sudoccidental de Dinamarca.

Poco antes de zarpar, un anciano del clan de uno de los personajes se acerca a este último y, entre cuchicheos, le indica que nada más arribar a Ribe debe visitar sí o sí a un célebre vidente que allí habita, de nombre Unnúlf, el cual será capaz de predecir su fortuna en el strandhögg. El anciano también ruega que se le transmita su saludo personal. Por último, y con un aire pretendidamente misterioso, añade que en sus años mozos las conversaciones con el vidente siempre le proporcionaron información exacta sobre su futuro, de la que supo sacar excelente provecho.

Cuando los personajes desembarcan al fin en Ribe y se encuentran con el vidente, las premoniciones de este no resultan muy claras, y las imágenes que evoca son de lo más perturbadoras. ¿Qué destino aguarda a aquellos que se atrevan a seguirlo sin desfallecer?


Translation courtesy of Google:

After a winter full of stories by the fire, darkness and some nostalgia at last days stretched considerably and drekar taken out of the shipyards in order to start as soon as the campaign strandhögg . The community in which they reside PJ bustles. All collaborate in the preparations. This year, the highest authority of the place has decided to pursue more ambitious goals, descending frank west coast in search of good boots Guyenne region (current Aquitaine French). To do this, the local fleet, consisting of a dozen ships will join a larger contingent, commanded by the famous Earl Danish Skarphedinn "Iron Beard", who runs a fleet of about thirty boats. The meeting point of the two is the city of Ribe, in the southwestern coast of Denmark.

Shortly before sailing, an elder of the clan of one of the characters on the latter and, between whispers, nothing tells you arrive at Ribe should visit or yes to a famous psychic who live there, named Unnúlf, the which will be able to predict your fortune in the strandhögg . The old man also requested to transmit your personal greeting. Finally, and with a supposedly mysterious air he adds that in his early years conversation with the seer always provided accurate information about their future, which I was able to take excellent advantage.

When the characters finally landed in Ribe and meet the seer, premonitions of this are not very clear, and the images it evokes are most disturbing. What fate awaits those who dare to follow without fail?

192377.name: No Quarter (Issue 63 - Nov 2015)
rpg: Iron Kingdoms Full Metal Fantasy Roleplaying Game
192377.description:
No Quarter
Issue 63
November 2015


Model Preview (Swamp Gobber Chef)
A History of Dragons
Using Gargantuans in Iron Kingdom RPGs
Forces of Distinction XX (Madrak's Winter Kin)

rpgitemversion: El Ultimo Servicio de Svidi Vatnarsson PDF Version
192378.name: El Ultimo Servicio de Svidi Vatnarsson
192378.description:
From publisher blurb:

El invierno toca a su fin y la nieve empieza a fundirse en la aldea que habitan los personajes. Es hora de que los hombres libres acudan al thing o asamblea anual del país, en el que se discuten asuntos de interés público, se arreglan entuertos, se renuevan amistades, se conciertan matrimonios y, eventualmente, se organizan los strandhögg de verano.

Este año, el bóndi del clan de los personajes se ve imposibilitado para acudir al thing de primavera, cosa que le tiene de muy mal humor, y debe enviar a aquellos en su nombre. Como el bóndi ha esperado hasta el último momento antes de reconocer que no podía efectuar el desplazamiento, los personajes salen de la aldea con algo de retraso... y serias dudas de si llegarán a tiempo al thing o no. Por delante les espera un viaje de cuatro días en barco, para el que cuentan con el pequeño navío familiar, bautizado en su día como "Golpe de Týr" (una especie de byrding más o menos bien mantenido, liviano y maniobrero).

Lo que los personajes no pueden saber es que el crimen y una presunta infamia les aguardan a su llegada...


Translation courtesy of Google:

Winter comes to an end and the snow begins to melt in the village inhabited by the characters. It is time that free men come to the thing or annual meeting of the country, where public issues are discussed, wrongs are settled, renewing friendships, marriages are concluded and eventually organize the strandhögg summer.

This year the Bondi Clan characters is unable to attend the thing spring, which will have very bad mood, and must send those on your behalf. As Bondi has waited until the last moment before recognizing he could not scroll, the characters leave the village with some delay ... and serious doubts whether arrive in time to thing or not. Ahead awaits a four days by boat, for they have the small family ship, named in his day as "Strike Týr" (a kind of byrding more or less well maintained, light and conniving).

What characters may not know is that the alleged crime and infamy await them upon arrival ...

192379.name: Skullf**k (Issue 1 - Dec 2015)
192379.description:
Skullfuck #1
Blood Moon 2015

Cover art by Victor Garrison.

192380.name: Voidrunner
192380.description:
User Summary

Voidrunner is a shoot'em up, and a sequel to the game Gridrunner. The game was made by Jeff Minter (Llamasoft) and publish by M.A.D (Mastertronic's Added Dimension). The player controls a spaceship, and must shoot down other ships before they reach the bottom of the screen. The twist here is that there also is lazer beams trying to shoot you from the sides. The aim is to survive as long as possible.

192381.name: Dinner's Ready!
192381.description:
Dinner's Ready! is a family culinary card game promoting healthy eating by challenging players to collect recipes and their necessary ingredients.

Players are dealt 5 recipe cards. The objective is to collect a "balanced meal:" an appetizer, an entree, and a dessert that together contain one ingredient from each of the food groups (fruits, vegetables, grains, meat, dairy). Players choose their "best" three and discard the others.

The objective is to collect the ingredients to make your appetizer, then the entree, then the dessert. You must go in order!

Each player is dealt four ingredient cards. On their turn, players may ask for a particular ingredient from another player ("Go Shopping"), pick up the top ingredient card on the "Compost Pile," or draw a replacement Recipe card.

The first player to successfully prepare their "balanced meal" wins, exclaiming "dinner's ready!"

The goal of the game is to educate players on the versatility of healthy ingredients, the basic concepts of cooking, and fun facts about food. If children are exposed to food at an early age, they are more likely to eat healthier as adults.

Who says you can't play with your food?

192382.description:
The Combat In Kowloon set, from new publisher Inner Kingdom Games, saw a change in the venerable Shadowfist card game. First, it is no longer sold as randomised boosters. Instead it is a Dynamic Card Game: sets are sold as fifty card decks. Second, it removed the two-player option (dueling) for tournament play and is now focused on 3 to 4 player matches. Third, the factions of the Secret War are set to: the Ascended, Dragons, Eaters of the Lotus, Four Monarchs, Guiding Hand, and the Jammers.

The Combat In Kowloon boxed set included starter decks for the Ascended, Dragons, Eaters of the Lotus, and the Guiding Hand, play-mats, counters, as well as a new rulebook. (The Jammers and Four Monarchs factions would be included in the follow-up set Back For Seconds.)
192382.name: Shadowfist: Combat In Kowloon

192383.name: Walker
192383.description:
User Summary

Walker is a sidescrolling shoot'em-up game for Commodore 64, written by Sven Forstmann. The players controls a creature that can walk, jump and shoot. The longer the player walks into the game, the more enemies to shoot or avoid, like stoneblocks, bees, bubbles and birds. The player does not get points for shooting enemies, only for the distans walked. The aim is to get as high score as possible.

192385.name: Dawn of the Dumb
192385.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game have Attributes (Get Stupid, Go Dumb, Thizz, and Hatin') that are ranked 1-5. An additional Attribute, Thangs, enumerates possessions. Action resolution uses 2d6. It is unclear whether the game was intended as a satire, though the mechanic is playable.

192387.name: Fear On Four
192387.description:
User summary:

Fear On Four attempts to re-create olden horror radio drama stories in a role-playing game. Characters have Fate, Luck, and Doom numbers that vary during play; all start at 0. Players attempt to control which numbers increase during the game.

192388.name: Sanctum Secorum (Issue #08 - Jan 2016)
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

192389.name: Sea Devil (ICONS)
192389.description:
From publisher blurb:

Most of the time, evil goes unchecked. Thugs and criminals do what they want and no one steps up to make them pay. That was until a warlord in a third world country tried to dump Peiter's body into the river. What came back to exact a terrible revenge wasn't a mild mannered researcher. It was the Sea Devil.

192390.name: Florenza: The Card Game – Ingegnere Promo Card
192390.description:
A promo card that came with Bretagne.

Ingegnere is an Arte card. It allows you spend one less resource of your choice when you build an Edificio di Rione, Chiesa di Rione, or Palazzo di Famiglia card

192391.name: Hitman (2016)  - Season 1: Episode 1: The Showstopper
videogamehonor: 2015 Global Game Awards Most Anticipated Game Next Year Nominee
2016 Global Game Awards Best Stealth Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Golden Joystick Game of the Year Nominee
2016 The Game Awards Best Action/Adventure Game of the Year Nominee
2017 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Design of the Year Honorable Mention
192391.description:
It will be the sixth entry in the Hitman video game series. The beta will serve as a prequel to the series. As in other games in the series, players are given a plethora of ways to approach their assassinations, meaning there is a large amount of room for creativity.

Source: Wikipedia, "Hitman (2016 video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

192392.name: Firestorm Taskforce Starter Set – Aquan Prime vs. The Directorate
192392.description: Firestorm Taskforce Starter Sets are an exciting way for players to start gaming spaceship combat in the Firestorm Galaxy. Inside this set are 14x highly detailed spaceship models (2x Medium, 1 of which can be upgraded to a more powerful design using modular components) and 5x Light Frigates. Also included is a Firestorm Taskforce fast play Rulebook, 15x Dice, Token Sheet, 2x Acrylic Movement Templates and 14x Flight Stands.

192393.name: Firestorm Taskforce Starter Set – Sorylian Collective vs. The Relthoza
192393.description: Firestorm Taskforce Starter Sets are an exciting way for players to start gaming spaceship combat in the Firestorm Galaxy. Inside this set are 14x highly detailed spaceship models (2x Medium, 1 of which can be upgraded to a more powerful design using modular components) and 5x Light Frigates. Also included is a Firestorm Taskforce fast play Rulebook, 15x Dice, Token Sheet, 2x Acrylic Movement Templates and 14x Flight Stands.

192394.description: Firestorm Taskforce Starter Sets are an exciting way for players to start gaming spaceship combat in the Firestorm Galaxy. Inside this set are 14x highly detailed spaceship models (2x Medium, 1 of which can be upgraded to a more powerful design using modular components) and 5x Light Frigates. Also included is a Firestorm Taskforce fast play Rulebook, 15x Dice, Token Sheet, 2x Acrylic Movement Templates and 14x Flight Stands.
192394.name: Firestorm Taskforce Starter Set – Terran Alliance vs. Dindrenzi Federation

192395.description:
Smoke billows from the chimneys of your industries. Produce more and cheaper! Why wor- ry about pollution? After all, citizens are eager to work in your factories. But all this production might just wake a few monsters from the Earth of old... Goooooodziiiiiilaaaaaaaas!

Godzillas are now awaken and are going to walk around your city!!!

During the first 4 rounds, the Godzillas are still sleeping. At the end of Round 5 and each Round till the end of the game, all the players roll one 6 Die, the highest roll will host one Godzilla. The Godzilla first appear in the Harbour, then in Factories level 3, 2 and so on... Then they must move in the city, the player still decide the direction. Each citizen on his path are swallowed and each Building becomes inactive.
The players track the Radioactivity with black discs.
It is possible to clean 2 black discs if the player choose the Engineer action.

Also... Good Luck...
192395.name: Small City: Character Meeple Expansion 2 – The Godzillas

192396.name: Small City: Player boards Expansion #2 – The Rivers
192396.description:
4 New Player boards printed both side (Easy and Expert) for the game Small City.
The rivers cut the player board into two parts and the players will have to build bridges to cross the water...

192397.name: Deadnaut
192397.description:
Deadnauts, so named because they’re unlikely to return, must explore, investigate and fight their way through the derelict ships of dead civilisations. Every mission is unique and no two locations are the same. Each ship contains mysterious enemies and hostile security systems.

Manage your Deadnauts’ skills, talents, relationships and flaws – and you might get them out alive.

- Squad-based tactics: Control five complex characters as they explore, investigate and fight their way through each mission.
- Character generation: Create back stories for your team, mould their relationships and equip them well.
- Every game is unique: Dynamically-generated missions and campaigns ensure no two mysteries are the same.
- Flexible and complex: Adapt to your situation with an arsenal of weapons and shields, or use stealth, hacking and sensors to move unnoticed.
- Out of control: Deadnauts have their own fears, motivations and dispositions. Stay in charge, keep in contact, don’t let them out of your sight.

Source: The Game Website.

192398.description:
4 New Player boards printed both side (Easy and Expert) for the game Small City.
Players need to spend money to deforest the player boards, but they will earn Building Materials with the wood...
192398.name: Small City: Player boards Expansion #3 – The Forests

192399.name: Tanto Cuore: Kickstarter Big Box and Maid Randomizer
192399.description:
A box designed to fit the first four Tanto Cuore sets, including the core set Tanto Cuore, and the expansions Expanding the House, Romantic Vacation, and Oktoberfest, as well as the new Maid Randomizer deck which it comes with. It is a limited release item from the Oktoberfest Kickstarter.

The Randomizer deck improves gameplay by allowing for randomly balanced games and unpredictable combinations, leveling the playing field for veteran players and new players by forcing both to form unique strategies. This was previously only available through a fan-made website, but is now a great facet of the official game.

192401.description:
Are you brave enough to accept the dungeon challenge?

In Dungeon Time, a real-time cooperative card game, you will enter a fantasy realm with only five minutes to complete your missions. Find the equipment, get the mission — while frantically trying to beat the clock and avoid being over-burdened by your equipment – and level up to higher challenges if you do!

In more detail, players play and draw cards, with each card showing either an item or a mission. Players call to one another for the items needed to fulfill missions; everybody plays their items on the stack, then you can play your mission on the stack and it will be fulfilled... Easy, isn't it? Except you have only five minutes to go through the whole deck, and each item played at the wrong time will burden your backpack, and risk bringing you one step closer to failure...
192401.name: Dungeon Time
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 022 – Origins 2016

192402.name: Building Blocks
192402.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 286th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a colorful, oversized building blocks, almost as if they were a giants toy.

The map is 14 x 20 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 4 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 2016x2880 pixels in size at 144dpi.

192403.name: Vector (ICONS)
192403.description:
From publisher blurb:

Vector is a pompous villain with formidable telekinetic powers, a super-human sized ego and a penchant for violence and mayhem.

192404.name: Character Compendium 2: Book of the Danged
192404.description:
From publisher blurb:

Character Compendium 2: Book of the DANGED is a supplement created under the Hero Kids Compatibility License. Inside you will find five new characters for use in your campaign!

I have included four versions of each character. The first two versions (1 boy and 1 girl) contain stock art along with the description. The third and fourth versions have a white space where the kids can draw their own characters!

Character Compendium 2: Book of the DANGED contains the following characters, including male and female versions:

Catfolk: a humanoid kitten with ferocious claws.
Dark Elf: an elf from the lands below, who is a master of the underground.
Goblin: an unusual specimen, this goblin has turned to heroic pursuits.
Vampire: a hunter who can devour the strength of his enemies.
Werewolf: a hero who struggles to use their curse (and the strength it brings) for good.

192405.name: Kaltenheim (Pathfinder)
192405.description:
From publisher blurb:

A mini-dungeon adventure for four characters of level 9.

In the far frozen lands of the north, word comes south via traders and messengers that a new threat has reared its terrifying head. Reports claim that a heavily built raider, skilled with a huge sword and a fearsome bow, has struck at several nomadic tribes wandering the snowline as they follow the herds of elk. It is said that this raider, dubbed Koloss and accompanied by a huge white wolf, leaves nothing of these tribes but frozen bloodstains in the virgin snow.

192406.name: Throne of the Dwellers in Dreams (Pathfinder)
192406.description:
From publisher blurb:

A mini-dungeon adventure for six characters of levels 5-6

While seeking work the PCs are contacted by an artificer named Vynthis Targain who offers them a job investigating an ancient tomb complex. He is convinced the site contains information pertaining to the location of three relics known as the dream rods. He also believes that these artifacts are hidden somewhere within, but his own research has proven fruitless.

192407.name: Blackstar (M&M3)
192407.description:
From publisher blurb:

Martin Furlong was never what one might call, "a winner." His drug addicted lifestyle had almost reached a terminal end when a meteor came apart, showering him in radioactive dust. Martin became a man transformed. If only the meteor could have kept him from becoming a supernatural menace.

192408.name: Phasing Abbey of Dora Sin
192408.description:
From publisher blurb:

You have travelled to the westernmost point in the Duchy of Starryshade as you make your way to the borderlands. Your final stop in the duchy is a small roadside inn called the Shepherd’s Spear Inn. While stopping for a respite you hear a few tales including a mysterious abbey nearby. This structure is said to only appear for a short time every three years. Magic and wealth are said to be lost within the walls of this structure and with little else to do this might be a final hurrah for your stay in Starryshade!

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for mid-level adventurers and DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

192409.description:
The circus show went really, really bad, and now the clowns are blaming each other...by throwing pies! And the clowns' code dictates that whoever remains clean the longest wins the argument.

Clown Standoff is separated into two phases. Phase one is a trick-taking phase with simultaneous card selection. Each player has cards 1-6, and four times players each lay down one card; tied cards are eliminated, then the highest card wins. The one exception to this: If a 1 and a 6 have both been played, then the 1 card wins the trick. All winners keep the cards they used to win the tricks, then they move to phase 2.

In Phase 2, six "Pie Throw" cards are in the middle of the table: five "Dodge" cards and one "Hit" card. Starting with whoever has the most cards from phase one, players then take turns as follows: They can draw a card; or they can discard one card from the ones they collected in phase one to shuffle all face-up Pie Throw cards, then draw one; or they can discard cards equal to the number of players who are still in the game to pass their turn to the next player.

If a player draws a Dodge card, nothing happens and the remaining cards move to the next player. If a player draws a Hit card, that player is out of the game; after this, all Pie Throw cards are again shuffled to form a deck, and the player with the most cards from phase one starts a new turn.

The last clown standing wins!
192409.name: Clown Standoff
boardgamepodcastepisode: 19. Devon Dice Dreaming to Essen trip 2016, Top 10 wants to Buys

192410.name: Lex Arena
192410.description:
Lead Rome's best gladiators to glory in Lex Arena – a historic tabletop strategy game with great design, crafted from wood and linen.

Lex Arena is a tabletop elimination game for 2 to 4 players. You take the role of a Lanista – an owner and trainer of gladiators. Following a simple set of rules, it is your duty to lead your fighters to glory.

Before the game each player selects their gladiators (wooden tokens).
The arena is divided into a number of fields on which the gladiators can move.
The game is played in turns. Each turn a player can move one of his gladiators or attack his opponents.

The goal of the game is to have at least one gladiator as a sole survivor in the arena.

When fighting your opponents the player must move one of his gladiators in the same field as the opponent's gladiator. A player then tries to determine the action by rolling the combat die, which can result in attack, defend or critical miss. The attack action allows the player to roll the attack die and the opponent rolls the defense die. The defend action means that the opponent is now counterattacking and the roles are reversed. Critical miss wastes the turn for the attacker.

Each turn a player draws an event card that can affect the gameplay and lasts for one turn. Even cards can be beneficial or harmful.

The arena is also a place for NPCs: warriors and animals, when defeated they yield weapons and armor respectively. Players can then use this to equip their gladiators.

There are other ways to gain the advantage over your opponents. Every gladiator has a unique ability which can have a significant impact if used in the right situation. Gladiators from the same team gain bonus to attack and defense if standing together in the same field.

Lex Arena provides balanced gameplay so knowing yourself and your opponents is crucial for victory.

192411.name: Gunrunner (1987)
192411.description:
Back of the game box

Many millions of light years away from a cooling planetary mass destined to be our Earth, the people of the planet Zero were facing almost certain extinction.

They were a peaceful people, living below the surface of a planet that was permanently in an ice age. Their power and heating source was a complex and intricate network of piping, carrying plutonium from manufacturing plants to the reactors. These pipes ran along the surface in ten giant networks to be cooled by the external temperature.

The pipework with its deadly plutonium cargo proved to be a tempting target for the Destrovians who coveted the rich plutonium deposits on Zero. Teams of saboteurs began to disrupt the outer networks, gaining strongholds. They installed scanning orbs, dome-shaped supply dumps and other devices to protect their territorial gains.

The Zeronian council sent many a young hero to an untimely end, but still the Destrovian menace came on. The Zerovian council decided to call on the one man they believe could save them.

You are that man, the Gunrunner.

192412.name: Revanchist Hybrid Class
192412.description:
From publisher blurb:

When an innocent is wronged, and the guilty go unpunished, the revanchist steps forth to make sure that justice is served. Caring nothing for redemption, she rides into battle, vengeance in her heart, focused on making evil doers pay.

A hybrid Cavalier/Inquisitor class

192413.name: Skyscrapers & Sorcery: Modern Occult Pulp Roleplaying Adventures
192413.description:
From publisher blurb:

What if the world ended and no one really noticed?

What if almost everyone just picked themselves up the next day, dusted themselves off and went back to their routines as if nothing major had happened?

That is what happened here. Sometime in the late part of the 19th century, something exploded in several places around the world at the same time.

Scientists say they think it was a number of comets or some other sort of space body hitting the planet. Some people claim that we were being attacked by Martians. Some folks just didn’t really notice. The explosions caused lots of death and destruction and affected every continent in the world.

Strange things live in the shadows of the world. Other worlds seem to have intruded upon ours and you are one of the few who decided to take notice and take action. Folks have names for people like you, the most polite of which is Adventurer. There is something that makes you want to notice the world and what goes on outside the daily humdrum lives of everyone else, and you have an itch to explore the dark corners and possibly even right some wrongs.

It’s been several decades since the Event and you have decided that it is time to scratch the itch of Adventure. Welcome to Skyscrapers & Sorcery, may your adventures be many and fruitful and may your lives be valiant and your death be bravely faced.

An Old School, White Box compatible game system.

192414.name: Skyscrapers & Sorcery Players Guide
192414.description:
From publisher blurb:

What if the world ended and no one really noticed?

What if almost everyone just picked themselves up the next day, dusted themselves off and went back to their routines as if nothing major had happened?

That is what happened here. Sometime in the late part of the 19th century, something exploded in several places around the world at the same time.

Scientists say they think it was a number of comets or some other sort of space body hitting the planet. Some people claim that we were being attacked by Martians. Some folks just didn’t really notice. The explosions caused lots of death and destruction and affected every continent in the world.
