Strange things live in the shadows of the world. Other worlds seem to have intruded upon ours and you are one of the few who decided to take notice and take action. Folks have names for people like you, the most polite of which is Adventurer. There is something that makes you want to notice the world and what goes on outside the daily humdrum lives of everyone else, and you have an itch to explore the dark corners and possibly even right some wrongs.

It’s been several decades since the Event and you have decided that it is time to scratch the itch of Adventure. Welcome to Skyscrapers & Sorcery, may your adventures be many and fruitful and may your lives be valiant and your death be bravely faced.

An Old School, White Box compatible game system.

This contains all of the player pertinent information, everything from the core book except the Referee's section and the starting adventure.

192415.name: Skyscrapers & Sorcery Supplemental Rules: Encyclopedia Draconis
192415.description:
From publisher blurb:

There was a request for Dragons to be made available as adversaries (or allies) for Skyscrapers & Sorcery, so here you go.

Now, you can find standard dragons in any number of sources that are available for free, including the downloads of the Swords & Wizardry White Box, or the S&W Complete or tons of places online.

If you want a standard dragon, use one of those sources. I’m going to give you a slightly different take on dragons however, one that fits how I see the world of Skyscrapers & Sorcery.

192417.name: EN5ider (Issue 23 - Jun 2015)
rpgissuearticle: Master & Apprentice: Gaining New Levels With Style
192417.description:
EN5ider

192431.name: Cinelinx: A Card Game For People Who Love Movies – Horror Expansion
boardgameexpansion: Cinelinx: A Card Game For People Who Love Movies
192431.description:
Adds over 70 new genre specific movies, actors, and directors to your Cinelinx game.

Includes blank Cinelinx cards to customize your deck even further!

192432.name: Cinelinx: A Card Game For People Who Love Movies – Movie Buffs Expansion
boardgameexpansion: Cinelinx: A Card Game For People Who Love Movies
192432.description:
Adds over 70 influential or otherwise notable movies, actors, and directors to your Cinelinx game.

Includes blank Cinelinx cards to customize your deck even further!

192433.name: Cinelinx: A Card Game For People Who Love Movies – Superheroes & Comics Expansion
boardgameexpansion: Cinelinx: A Card Game For People Who Love Movies
192433.description:
Contains over 70 new genre themed cards to add your favorite movies, actors, and directors to your Cinelinx game.

Includes blank Cinelinx cards to customize your deck even further!

192434.name: 5th Edition OGL Werewolf Variants & An Off-Beat Werewolf Tale
192434.description:
From publisher blurb:

TERROR UNDER THE FULL MOON!

Monster, Monster is a new series from NUELOW Games presenting variations on classic horror monsters for the Fifth Edition of the world's best-known roleplaying game, together with stories ir comics that spotlight the creature.

192435.name: Duergar
192435.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Monster Manual provides only one duergar (a CR 1 creature). Out of the Abyss supplies a few more variations, but any Rage of Demons campaign could use more options. The variations herein can provide you with a larger variety of duergar characters and enemies, ranging from CR 1 to CR 5.

Note that full stat blocks for the incomplete duergar from the appendices of Out of the Abyss are also included here, with just a few adjustments — that is, the darkhaft, the kavalrachni, and the Keeper of the Flame.

192436.name: Tome of Templates
192436.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the Tome of Templates, we’ve got ten great monster templates for use with 5th edition D&D monsters. Make almost any monster angelic, ghostly, vampiric—even clockwork. Designed by David Noonan and Stacey Janssen (Princes of the Apocalypse), this collection of templates helps you keep your players guessing.

192437.name: Monster Mausoleum
192437.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Monster Manual has no undead between CR 5 and 13, so let’s fix that! In the Monster Mausoleum, we’ve got 17 undead horrors, including old-school favorites like the bodak and penanggalan, plus new monsters such as the macabre gaslight. Designed by David Noonan and Stacey Janssen (Princes of the Apocalypse), this collection of cadaverous combatants is sure to make your players scream in terror!

192438.name: The Raven - Legacy of a Master Thief - Chapter II: Ancestry of Lies
192438.description:
User Summary

The next chapter in the series.

192439.name: The Divine Wind: A Dexterity Battle of Martial Farts
192439.description: 'The Divine Wind' is a light-weight dexterity game where you play as Samurai, taking to the field of battle to engage in the ancient tradition of He-Gassen, or “fart battling.” You will ride your horse around the battlefield, positioning your posterior to blow away your opponents with your superior flatulence. Using bean buns to increase your strength, sake to increase your duration, and special cards to tip the battle in your favor, you will fight to be the last Samurai standing. Every card that is not used becomes a shield to protect from your opponents. With positioning and a good ole flick of the wrist, you will corner your opponents, pierce their defenses, and blow them down with a divine wind.

192440.name: Vier gegen Einen
192440.description:
One player has to defend the citadel with 16 black pawns against four allied enemy armies of seven red, blue, yellow and green pawns each. The pawns may move one space or capture (in any direction) an enemy pawn by jumping over it. The defender may not move into the citadel, unless it is under threat by an attacker. The attackers move only forward or sideways, never backward. Movement is one space on the red lines or sideways on the black lines and one or more spaces forward or backward (only the defender)on the black lines.

The defender wins the game if he can occupy oll 4 spaces of the citadel in the center of the game board.

The allied attackers win, if they can occupy the four spaces of the citadel.

The game was published in the 1930s or 1940s.

192441.description:
This expansion consists of 50 new cards and rules to supplement the original game.

You must still make advantageous marriages for your ladies and gentleman but now with the inconvenience of an undead apocalypse which threatens to make a bloody mess of your wedding plans. One player starts the game afflicted with the Curse of the Living Dead.

The Cursed player draws cards from the new deck - both on their own turn and when anyone gets married. This deck includes many Zombie cards, which transform the Cursed player's ladies and gentlemen into flesh-eating monsters! If the player runs out of characters to infect, they must pass the Curse onto someone else.

Gift cards send useful items to other players - including weapons and the means to protect themselves from zombie attacks. Event cards may unleash a horde of ravenous Zombies on polite society or help the poor survivors to persevere with their essential tea-drinking and courtship.

It is very difficult for the Cursed player to win, but not impossible - if they can keep their Zombies well-fed with a stocked up Slaughter pile...
192441.name: Jane Austen's Matchmaker with Zombies

192442.name: Super Galactic Battle Mounties
192442.description:
The Earth is under attack by the fearsome Eclipse and his 14 Zodiac Colossi. Their mission is to take over the world, and the Super Galactic Battle Mounties are the only ones who can stand in their way! That’s why Eclipse has launched an all-out offensive on the city of Kingsmount–home of the Battle Mounties and the source of their power. If the Mounties’ Command Center on Mt. Royal falls, there will be no one left to stop Eclipse. Save Kingsmount; Save the World!

Super Galactic Battle Mounties is a fully co-operative city defense game that features a battle system emphasizing cooperation and combination. As the Zodiac Colossi swarm into the city, aided by their minions, you will work together to protect it. Alone, you are not powerful. It is only when fighting with your teammates that your true power is realized. You win if you survive the onslaught by defeating Eclipse and his Zodiac Colossi. You lose if your Command Center falls, destroying the source of your power.

SGBM consists of 12 episodes (rounds). Each episode, in turn, consist of 4 phases which the players take simultaneously:
Spawn, where you will find out your monster(s) of the week and the episode sub-plot.
Plan, where you will deliberate strategy and move your Mounties to where they need to be.
Battle, where you will all roll your dice to fight monsters and lemmings.
Retaliation, where the Zodiac Colossi fight back and damage the city.

192443.name: Hack & Slash Compendium 1
192443.description:
From the introduction:

A compiled volume of information for players of Classic Fantasy Role-Playing games, including: Advice for beginning Dungeon Masters, discussions of the Quantum Ogre and player agency, and a collections of backgrounds for 5th Edition Dungeons & Dragons.

192445.name: Vaudeville
192445.description:
Players are theater owners in the Vaudeville circuit circa 1890 – 1910. They will book acts from the booking agent or the circuit to earn cash and fame. Cash buys more acts, and fame progresses the player on the fame track and unlocks bigger shows and allows more acts in the finale. Act category values are manipulated by the player during the game in the attempt to make their acts more popular and their opponent’s acts less popular.

The Finale is triggered when the turn token reaches the final space on the turn tracker.

Earn the most fame in the Finale to win.

192446.name: Robinsons Abenteuer
192446.description: Simple roll-and-move game. The first player to reach space 100 wins the game. On the red spaces, events from the novel hinder or benefit the players.

192447.name: The Annotated Unspeakable Oath (Issue 1 - 1993)
rpgissuearticle: Introduction to The Annotated Unspeakable Oath
192447.description:
The Annotated Unspeakable Oath
Issue 1
1993

The Annotated Unspeakable Oath, an authorized, legal, and free e-publication, included most content from The Unspeakable Oath of the same issue number: "Anything missing is described briefly...and is missing either due to copyright problems or because the information has been or will be reprinted in a commercial product." The indicated commercial product was, typically, The Resurrected volumes.

192448.name: The Annotated Unspeakable Oath (Issue 2 - 1993)
rpgissuearticle: A Tale of Terror: Grim Portrait
A Chip Off the Old Blob

1993

The indicated commercial product was, typically, The Resurrected volumes.

192449.name: Spot a Dotted Puppy
192449.description:
Contents: 4 Puppy Playing Pieces, Spinner, Game Board

Object: To be the first player to return his puppy to his doghouse.

Before Play: Each player selects a spotted puppy playing piece and places it on the matching doghouse. Blue puppy goes first.

Play: First player spins the spinner and moves his puppy that number of spaces, counterclockwise around the board. After each player has spun once, the first player then counts the number of spots on the puppy on which his playing piece is resting. He moves his puppy that number of spaces. Play continues in this way. If a player lands on a bone, he then spins the spinner again and moves that number of spaces. If the arrow points to the puppy's head, he has to return to his doghouse. (The spinner is used only at the start of the game and when a player lands on a bone.) If a player lands on a space occupied by another player, he moves to the next space.

To Win: The winner is the first player to go completely around the path of puppies and land on or pass over his dog house again.

192450.name: The Annotated Unspeakable Oath (Issue 3 - 1993)
rpgissuearticle: A Tale of Terror: Men in Black
A Tale of Terror: The Boods
A Tale of Terror: The Spider-Man

The indicated commercial product was, typically, The Resurrected volumes.

192452.description:
Ticket to Ride: Ohio is a fan-made expansion to the Days of Wonder, Inc. Ticket to Ride series created by Alan R. Moon. A tribute both to Ticket to Ride and the great state of Ohio, this expansion is designed for players who are already well familiar with Ticket to Ride’s standard gameplay and mechanics.

Published by permission for non-commercial use. All rights to the Ticket to Ride name, gameplay, mechanics, and imagery are reserved by Days of Wonder, Inc., who have not endorsed or playtested this expansion.

Unofficial Fan made expansion - Symbols & Graphics Copyright 2004-2016 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.
192452.name: Ohio (fan expansion to Ticket to Ride)

192453.name: The Room Three
videogamehonor: 2016 British Academy Game Awards Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
2016 D.I.C.E. Cellular/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Golden Joystick Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
192453.description:
Continuing the story from The Room Two, your obsessive search for the Null results with being lured to ‘Grey Holm’, a mysterious mansion located on a remote island. You must use all your puzzle-solving abilities to navigate a series of trials devised by a mysterious figure known only as “The Craftsman”.

The Room Three is significantly larger than our previous games, taking place in a variety of stunning new environments, each spanning multiple areas. New for The Room Three is the new eyepiece ability which allows you to explore the world in miniature, and also for the first time in The Room series you are able to return to Grey Holm between Chapters and solve its unique puzzles which will decide your fate and determine which of the alternate endings you will experience.

Source: The Developer Website.

192454.name: The Masterplan
192454.description:
The Masterplan is a top-down tactical action puzzle game, about heists, set in the 1970s. Drawing inspiration from both legendary tactical turn-based games and classic heist movies alike, the goal of The Masterplan is to put together the right crew, get the right equipment, and finally plan and execute the biggest heist ever.

The game features beautiful hand-drawn 2D art and an authentic soundtrack recorded by a real band. The gameplay blends a physics-based world and a clever AI system with an easy to approach "real time with pause" user interface.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgameimplementation: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island
192455.description: Built on the core of the award-winning Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island, First Martians: Adventures on the Red Planet pits players against the hostile Martian environment and a whole host of new adventures and challenges. The immersion experience is further enhanced with an integrated app that maintains the balance and challenge throughout. Players have the option of taking on the design as a series of separate games, in a custom campaign mode in which each successive game builds on the last, or even an open world mode in which they are free to roam about the Martian surface and explore for as long as they can survive.
192455.name: First Martians: Adventures on the Red Planet
boardgamefamily: Robinson Crusoe: Adventure on the Cursed Island

192456.description: The first player to reach space 51 wins the game. Movement is controlled by a spinner. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

192457.description: Cry Havoc is a card-driven, asymmetric, area control war game set in a brutal science fiction setting. Each player commands one of four unique factions with varying abilities and units. The game includes 54 custom miniatures, a large format board, and over one hundred unique cards, all with stunning new artwork.

boardgamehonor: 2016 Golden Geek Best Card Game Nominee
192458.description:
The world you know no longer exists. There is no government. No army. No civilization. The United States has collapsed, and now thirty years after the war started, new powers finally try to take control over the ruined country, try to establish a new order, try to control others and create a new country, a new state: the 51st State.

51st State is a card game in which players control one of four powers trying to build a new country. Players put new locations into play, hire leaders, and send people to work in buildings to gain resources and new skills. To do this, every card in 51st State can be used in three different ways:


Raze a location to gain many resources once.
Deal with this location to gain one resource every turn.
Build the location so that you can use its skill each turn.


51st State: Master Set marks the rebirth of the 51st State line, with this set containing 88 cards from the original base game, and 50 cards each from both the New Era and Winter expansions; one of these expansions can be mixed with the cards of the base game, but not both at the same time. The entire set has been rebalanced to offer a cohesive experience no matter which expansion you choose to use.
192458.name: 51st State: Master Set
boardgameexpansion: 51st State Master Set: Texas and Hegemony Factions

WIPNcast 117

192459.name: Life: School Years
192459.description: Life: School Years is a deck building game about real life! Everyone starts the game with only Mom and Dad to help them, but can acquire new friends and properties to help them defeat jerks and succeed in life. Milestone cards also add a press-your-luck mechanic and a way to remove unwanted cards from your deck. The player with the most success points at the end of the game is the winner at Life!

192460.name: Life: Adult Years
192460.description: Life: Adult Years is the sequel/expansion to Life: School Years. Players build a deck during the game by acquiring cards from a shared pool. This time around, the stakes are higher as players can get married, divorced, have a crummy office job, retire and finally, death. As before, the goal of the game is to have the most success points at the end and be the most successful at Life!

192461.name: 0 Grad Nord
192461.description:
User Summary

0 Grad Nord, or "0º Nord" (box title) and "Zielpunkt: 0´ Nord" (In-game title), is a text adventure for Commodore 64, published by Ariolasoft. The game is in german, and works like ordinary text adventures with commands like nehmen (take) and oeffnen (open). The aim is to find your friend dr Scott (den Abenteuern des Nordpolforschers Scott) somewhere at the northpole. The game was made by Kemal Ezcan & Axel Weber of Axis Komputerkunst.

192462.name: Master System Evolution
192462.description:
Translation:

The new version of Master System presents a modern design with all the usual tradition and nostalgia! It is dark blue and has a color picture of Sonic the hedgehog.

You don't need to buy any games! Master System Evolution already has 132 games built-in, ready to play. A super collection including Sonic and Alex Kidd.

The console has two ergonomic joysticks, both with high performance and quick responses.

Source: The Game Website.

192463.name: Pocket Dungeon: Optional Rules
192463.description: A set of free, optional rules to enhance your Pocket Dungeon games! Make play harder, or maybe a tad easier, or maybe just add variety and complexity. Pick and choose as you wish!

192464.name: The Elder Scrolls Online - Thieves Guild
videogameexpansion: The Elder Scrolls Online: Tamriel Unlimited
192464.description:
User Summary

The Elder Scrolls Online: Thieves Guild is the third official DLC game pack for The Elder Scrolls Online.

The story revolves around The Thieves Guild of Abah's Landing, an organization of pickpockets, burglars, robbers, and thieves. As their newest recruit you must help to restore the guild's reputation, and fight a mercenary guard force known as the Iron Wheel.

The game features a new zone (Hew's Bane) located in the southern peninsula of Hammerfell, a new 12-player trial (Maw of Lorkhaj), a new skill line, and new costumes, motifs, and item sets.

192465.name: Palaces & Ponies Quickstart
192465.description:
(publisher blurb)

Welcome to the world of Palaces & Ponies. These are the quick start rules for this exciting game. In these you will find the basics you need to start up a game of P&P. So grab some friends and a few dice and enjoy.

192466.name: Teachers and Tentacles
192466.description:
(publisher blurb)

A one-sheet investigative horror adventure game, inspired by the works of H.P. Lovecraft and modeled after John Harper’s Lasers and Feelings and Ray Otus’s Sorcerer’s and Sellswords.

“You are an eclectic group of academics and artists brought together to investigate mysterious events. Your discoveries may very well change (or doom) the fate of mankind.”

192467.description:
Seven Cat Cards are dealt to each player. The game starts with the youngest player.

In clockwise order, each player takes a turn to roll the die, and acts according to the image shown on the die result.

The game ends immediately when one player gets rid of all Cat Cards in hand.

This Kickstarter Edition combines the following in one package:

Cat Tower,
the Cat Tower Lite expansion,
the Cat Tower Plus expansion.




It also contains several Kickstarter exclusives, including:

Extra cats to play with seven players,
Champion Cat,
Boba Tea Cat,
Panda Cat,
Chihuahua,
Maine Coon Cat,
Three other exclusive cats.
192467.name: Cat Tower: Kickstarter Edition
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 80- Cry Havoc and Our Still Gotta’ Get/Play List

192468.name: Super Secret Spy Agency
192468.description:
(publisher blurb)

A Game of spies and espionage heavily influenced by films like Mission Impossible and Kingsman. The players are spies working for a self financed, independent spy agency. The characters will have access to special equipment and gadgets that would only ever exist in a spy movie or evil genius lab. With dozens of skills like Offensive Driving and Jump from a tall building and combat skills like Catch and Shoot or Clear a room, the Super Secret Spy Agency lets players live out their James Bond fantasies.

The game works on a percentile system will point pool and is a full Rpg.

This was the first RPG ever written by Feralgames, far from perfect but fully playable we invite GM's and Players alike to create what you will from this rule system and have fun with the game.

192469.name: Wizard Cops
192469.description:
(publisher blurb)

Wizard Cops is a free RPG originally written as a demo for the ConnectiCon game design panel Cancel your Fantasy Heartbreaker: How to Actually Write that RPG. It's only a paragraph long, but it is used as an example how a very small number of rules can create very specific conflicts with controlled resolutions. People at the panel wanted to know where they could get it, so I'm putting it up for the big bad internet!

Wizard Cops is a game that creates standoffs, and asks players how much they'll put on the line. And it does so with rules shorter than this description.

192470.name: Luck: The One Page RPG
192470.description:
(publisher blurb)

GM-less gaming for two or more players. No props are necessary! Give it a try.

192471.name: The Devil, John Moulton
192471.description:
(publisher blurb)

Somewhere out there is your quarry. The one that you’ve been hunting across the vast desert of the American West. The one who showed you how to bind a demon to your soul. John Moulton. Murderer, bank robber, outlaw and demon summoning warlock. The man they call ‘The Devil John’.

You’ve gathered together a posse. Each of your posse is also seeking the same sorcerous bandit that you are. Some of you are seeking vengeance. Some are seeking redemption. Some just want to collect the sizable bounty on Moulton’s head. Each says that they want Devil John dead. Some of them might even be telling the truth.

So you’re gonna ride with them, seeking out Moulton. Each town you ride into finds your quarry’s henchmen and minions. They’re losers and deadbeats who sold their souls for peanuts. But each one is going to bring you a little bit closer to the your final goal. Kill enough and you might find your way up to the man himself. Then, there will be a reckoning.

The Devil John Moulton is a tabletop roleplaying game designed for one gamemaster and 2-5 player characters. You can run a game in a single sitting, but it is best suited to being a few sessions long, perhaps meeting 2 to 5 times for a few hours each time.

192472.name: Fudge on the Fly
192472.description:
(publisher blurb)

Fudge on the Fly is a method of character generation that allows games to begin immediately, with only a few moments required for character generation. It does this by allowing players to select their character's skills during play, when the situation arises which calls for them. This has a number of benefits in addition to its speed - most notably it spares players the annoyance of failing to purchase the "right" skills. Every skill purchased will be one that proves itself useful during play. The revelation of character skills over the course of play also allows for the same sort of character discovery that is common in books and film.

192473.name: Her Arcane Service
192473.description:
(publisher blurb)

Levi Kornelsen's "Light" variant of OHMAS (On Her Majesty's Arcane Service) - an astonishingly rich and flavorful game with a simpler, elegant chargen and ruleset.

192474.name: Pillaging the Pitiless Palace
192474.description:
User summary:

Pillaging the Pitiless Palace is a solo table-top role-playing game. Characters are randomly generated but afterwards gain "Reward Points" which accumulate and can be used to customize the character. The scenario presented is, essentially, a simple random dungeon generator.

192475.name: Kpachoapmee
192475.description:
From the introduction:

It is the autumn of 1942. In the Hero City of Stalingrad, heroic Red Army defenders are battling for their lives against the fascist hordes who have invaded Mother Russia. Street to street and house to house, the hard-bitten Soviet soldiers fight with the desperate ferocity of madmen.

User summary:

Kpachoapmee, also referred to as Krasnoarmeets, is a table-top role-playing game that has a heavy emphasis on miniatures, terrain, and squad-level tactics. Characters are soldiers who start as green troops but gain experience to become veterans during the campaign.

192476.name: Deniable Asset: Hiding in the Mosque
192476.description:
(publisher blurb)

Deniable Asset: Hiding in the Mosque is a micro RPG based on the Power of 12 Role-Playing System and is a prelude to Deniable Asset, Random Encounters game of espionage and intrigue.

192477.name: Two Page Mini Delve: Cave of Crystals
192477.description:
(publisher blurb)

The adventurers come across a cave full of crystals that have a rare magical property - they can trap souls. The street value of even a single crystal is quite substantial. However, it seems as though the crystals already have spirits trapped within them...

192478.name: Two Page Mini Delve: Hornhold Crypts
192478.description:
(publisher blurb)

The adventurers are sent to the crypts of the dwarven clan Hornhold, where they are to retrieve a warhammer. In the process, they also discover a family secret...

192479.name: Subway: Race to the Bronx
192479.description:
Players represent rail transit companies in turn of the century New York City, racing to connect Lower Manhattan to the Bronx. Build subway lines, connect stations and entice riders to use your subway.
Players acquire permits, hire workers and purchase materials to build lines, and then populate those lines with trains to generate revenue. Build the most lines in a neighborhood to claim its victory points. Be the first to connect lines to all the key stations to win the game.

192480.name: Star Wars Jedi Legacies: The Great Hyperspace War
rpg: Star Wars Jedi Legacies: The Great Hyperspace War
192480.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game have Attributes (Power, Agility, Toughness, Intellect, Spirit, and Dexterity) and Derived Attributes (Melee, Ranged, Defense, Initiative, Force, and Speed). Characters also have a Species (ten are provided) as well as a Class (twelve are provided). Characters gain experience and levels. Use of the Force is through character Talents. Finally, characters also have Skills with ranks.

The manual includes a character sheet and several other tracking sheets.

192481.name: Freyo
192481.description:
User summary:

Freyo characters are defined by six Abilities (Force, Resist, React, Aware, Impose, and Oppose). Abilities have a Value of 2-12, constructed from a random roll and a standard matrix. Characters also have a Wound Threshold which is a derived value. Action resolution involves an unmodified 2d6 roll against a relevant Abilities, with the player trying to roll under the Ability Value.

192482.description: This promo was available at GenCon 2015 at the HABA booth and consisted of 4 Pigs for the game Animal Upon Animal. The Pig figures have a HABA logo on one side and a Q code on the other.
192482.name: Animal Upon Animal: Pig Promo

192483.description: This promo was available at GenCon 2015 at the HABA booth and consisted of 4 Rhinos for the game Animal Upon Animal. The Rhino figures have a HABA logo on one side and a Q code on the other.
192483.name: Animal Upon Animal: Rhino Promo

192484.name: Erinia
192484.description:
User Summary

Erinia was the first brazilian MMO. It combines elements of RPG, medieval fantasy and monsters from the brazilian Folklore like Saci, Mapinguari (Yeti), Homem do saco (man of the bag) and many others. It remained officially open for about a year and after that some fans and ex-GMs took over and now you can play it from time to time.

It was developped by a team of fourteen people during a period of less than a year. The server was programmed in Java and the client in C++. It had two releases: one in Brazil and another in Germany.

192485.name: Arby: The Meter Reader Game
192485.description:
'Arby' is a game created by Neptune Meter Company and appears to be a sales/promotional tool extolling the benefits of one of their products (the ARB) that allows water meter readers to do their job electronically, automatically, and remotely.

From the box:

"The ARBY game can be played by 2, 3, 4, or 5 players. One player is the ARB meter reader who reads the meters without entering the house; the others are conventional meter readers who must enter the house to obtain the reading. The playing board is arranged in four WATER DISTRICTS or routes of six houses each with the WATER OFFICE in the center where the game is started and finished. The goal of each player is to read all his meters and arrive back at the WATER OFFICE before the other reader (or readers). The ARB reader must read the meters in all 24 houses on the board; the conventional reader reads only six houses (or one fourth of the board)."

The players all start in the Water Office where they each roll a die. The highest number is the ARB reader. The others choose their routes in order of the die number rolled.

When the ARB reader player reaches a dot outside a house they draw a card which will either give them the meter reading or present an obstacle. ARB player does not have to enter a house to get the reading. Once read they move on to next house.

When a conventional reader player reaches a dot outside a house they draw a card which will either allow them to enter the house or give them some reason they cannot. If allowed into the house they wait until their next turn and then rolls the die. If an EVEN number is rolled they put their pawn on the inside dot where they 'read' the meter by drawing another card which allows the reading or presents an obstacle. Once the meter is read player must roll an ODD number to exit the house. On the next turn they head to the next house.

This continues until a player reaches their quota (6 for conventional or 24 for ARB) at which point they race back to the WATER OFFICE. First one there by exact roll amount WINS.

Components:

- Playing board
- One die
- Five meter reader characters, One ARB reader and Four conventional readers (pawns)
- 24 Lockout Markers (plastic discs)
- 30 matching colored cards for each conventional meter reader (18 large, 12 small - in 4 colors)
- 24 white cards for the ARB meter reader

There is apparently a follow up game called 'Carby'.

192486.name: Dream Warrior
192486.description:
From the game inlay

Blast your way through the dreams of your three chums, regaining their stolen Psychic Images and fending off attacking Dream Demons as you go.

192487.name: Passing Shot
192487.description:
User Summary

A conversion of a the Sega tennis arcade game of the same name with 1 and 2 player modes.

192488.name: InWords
192488.description: In the game of InWords, players spin the wheel in the game board to select a common, everyday word for the round (e.g., Cold, West, Grand, etc.). They then compete to produce answers containing that term which fit into one of the categories listed around the game board (People, Places, Things, TV, Movies, Music). As answers multiply, the challenge and the point totals get larger and larger.

192489.name: Time Flies
192489.description:
From the game inlay

You must recover the stolen twenty-four hours, but time is running out.

User Summary

Arcade-style scrolling shooter.

192490.name: Takeda's succession struggle
192490.description:
The second issue game of Game Journal #51.
Designed by Yumiko Endoh.

The game starts at the moment of Hon-noh-ji, the death of Nobunaga Oda.

The three factions, Uesugi, Tokugawa, and Hohjoh started to get the piece of the Koh-Shin area, the heritage of Takeda-clan which had been controled by Nobunaga at the moment.

Though there are 3 factions, this game is played with only 2 people.
The faction each player control is decided randomly just after the first turn. And this information can be kept secret as long as that player would like to reveal and take full control of that faction. Until that moment, each faction is controled by both players alternatively.

The victory is achieved that the faction that player control have conquered the determined numbers of areas. If no player can achieve the criteria, then both players lose the game.

192491.name: Role Mag' (#1 - July-August 1990)
192491.description:
User summary:

Contains scenarios for Call of Cthulhu, Star Wars D6, and Advanced Dungeons & Dragons (level 5-7). Also contains articles, reviews and gaming aids the hero (PJ AD & D class), new magic items for AD & D, Eggs Kharlat & Nightmares (set of aids for Call of Cthulhu), etc.

192492.name: Role Mag' (#2 - September-October 1990)
192492.description:
User summary:

Contains scenarios for Call of Cthulhu, Mega, Advanced Dungeons & Dragons (levels 1-3), Cry Havoc (wargame) and a mini-adventure for The Three Musketeers. Contains articles, reviews and gaming aids on Ecuyer (PJ AD & D class), Monstrus Universalis (new monster), new magic items for AD & D, hitches (set of aid), Space inn (Space Opera game help) , player aids for Space Opera RPG, Critical Hit Warhammer rpg (set of aid), using game for Hexes, medieval astrology, ...

Getting Started with Space Opera, 32 pages of scenarios for AD&D, Cthulhu, Mega

PC: Secrets of Warhead, Xenomorph, Drakkhen

192493.name: Role Mag' (#3 - November-December 1990)
192493.description:
User summary:

A case for Consulting Detective, 32 Pages of scenarios: AD&D, Cthulhu, Chill, Malefices

PC: Xenomorph, Gulf War Simulator

192494.name: Role Mag' (#4 - January-February 1991)
192494.description:
User summary:

Female Character Classes

40 Pages of scenarios: AD&D, Cthulhu, Malefices, Stormbringer

PC: Captive, BSS, and Tank Simulator

192495.name: Role Mag' (#5 - March-April 1991)
192495.description:
Contains scenarios for:

JRTM / MERP
Hexen
Chill
Call of Cthulhu
The Hunger
The Divisions of the Shadow
Cyberpunk 2020
Star Wars D6
The Messenger
Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective
Advanced Dungeons & Dragons (level 4).

192496.name: Clash of the Cards
192496.description:
Clash of the Cards is a high-speed, strategic battle card game in which you battle your opponents to steal cards and win hands. To win each hand of this rummy-style game you collect armies (sets of 4). The first player to collect 2 armies wins the hand, and all players count points. Keep playing hands until someone reaches 1,000 points.

Each card in the game can be harnessed during battle. Use special cards to defend your armies, to walk away from battle, slow down your opponents, or join battles you were not invited to, in order to increase your chance at winning cards. This game allows you to set up traps for other players and develop attack and defense strategies from your first turn.

192497.name: Sirius Online
192497.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

As an homage to Eve Online and Freelancer, you are a pilot seeking mineral deposits and other players to kill. There are quite a few key commands to adjust your ship as well as four basic weapons. At the moment there are no real single player parts to this game but only a multi-player environment.

192498.name: The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild
videogamehonor: 2016 Game Critics Best Action/Adventure Game of the Year Winner
2016 Game Critics Best Console Game of the Year Winner
2016 Game Critics Best of Show Winner
2016 Gamescom Best Action Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Gamescom Best Nintendo Console Game of the Year Winner
2016 Gamescom Best of Gamescom Winner
2016 Global Game Awards Most Anticipated Game Next Year Nominee
2016 Golden Joystick Most Wanted Game Next Year Nominee
2016 The Game Awards Most Anticipated Game Next Year Winner
192498.description:
The Legend of Zelda is a action-adventure game by Nintendo. It is the nineteenth main installment in Nintendo's The Legend of Zelda series and the first original Zelda game developed with high-definition (HD) graphics.

The game will feature an open world in which players can find different ways to approach areas. The game world is as large as the Wii U's hardware can handle. The overworld can be traversed on foot or on Link's horse, Epona. Epona automatically avoids obstacles, allowing the player to concentrate on other tasks, such as shooting arrows.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Legend of Zelda (2016 video game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

192499.name: Role Mag' (#6 - May-June 1991)
192499.description:
User summary:

The Grand Continent, a medieval fantasy world.

AD&D, Cthulhu, Malefices, Reve de Dragon

Includes a 6-page comic and a revelation.

192500.name: Brynk
192500.description:
From the publisher's website:

Will you be able to place your pieces on the teeter-tottering base and get it to stay? Or will you upset the balance and watch as it all comes crashing down in front of you?

Players take turns adding pieces (triangles, squares, or pentagons) onto the Brynk tower by hooking them onto any available slot. If one or more pieces falls off the tower during a player's turn, that player is eliminated from the game and play continues to the left; however, if the entire tower falls over or all of the pieces fall off, the game ends immediately and the last player who successfully placed a piece on the tower is the winner!
